details:
Senior Business Analyst (DA/DW) – on behalf of our client, Procom Services is looking for a Senior Business Analyst to join their team for a seven (7) month contract in Tampa, FL.Senior Business Analyst (DA/DW) Job Details
Our client is seeking a senior level Business Analyst who will be part of global information, Warehouse and analytics teams. This role will work closely with both the business and technology teams for the implementation of innovative analytical solutions.
Perform data analysis and data mappings across various systems. Create data models.
Design visually appealing dashboards with a focus on mobile integration
Liaise with Business users to understand their requirements and document in the form of Business Requirements Documents. Conduct Joint Analysis and Design (JAD) sessions with technology for various enhancements to be implemented in the warehouse.
Create presentations to describe ideas and conceptual design to business stakeholders and senior managers
Provide analytical support by writing complex SQL queries.
Perform data quality checks on various data elements available in the warehouse.
Coordinate and Participate in User Acceptance testing for enhancements done to the warehouse.
Provide user support making sure appropriate Support tickets are created. Participate in weekly production support related calls to review support tickets. Provide timely user communications for any system related issues.
Senior Business Analyst (DA/DW) Mandatory Skills
Data analysis, data modeling, data mapping experience
Reporting and typical technical BA skills
The candidate must have strong data analysis / data mapping / data conversion experience
Strong knowledge about Data Warehousing concepts and principle and ETL process
Candidate must possess strong SQL writing skills in Oracle or equivalent relational database platform
Strong hands on experience with Microsoft Office tools (Word, Excel, Powerpoint etc.)
Experience working with Big Data technology is a plus
Knowledge of Oracle eBusiness Suite applications and different modules (AP, PO, Requisition, EGL) including table structures and data flows is a plus
Reporting tools (MicroStrategy) experience (a plus)
May 7th, 2018 or ASAPSenior Business Analyst (DA/DW) Assignment Length7 month contract *extensions possiblePlease note that we are not able to work with candidates on H1B Visas or candidates represented by third parties.
title: Senior Business Analyst (DA/DW)

details:
Business Analyst - Teller Solutions

Hobbs Madison is growing!  We have immediate opportunities for senior Business Analysts with experience implementing branch banking applications - specifically branch retail teller solutions.  The goal of this initiative is to enhance the customer experience by improving the efficiency & effectiveness at the retail level.  The business analyst will use their knowledge & understanding of front-end, web-based, retail & branch banking applications & systems (customer origination, deposit services, consumer loan origination, new account opening, etc.) at the onset of the project & throughout to gather & prioritize requirements, write user stories & develop the most effective use cases & test cases. 

Performance Objectives for the Business Analyst will include:

Work closely with users & stakeholders at the branch level to gather requirements, develop user stories / storyboards, use cases & test cases with a focus on improving the customer experience
Prioritize requirements as necessary
Improve process workflows
Maintain strong partnerships with IT & business units



Extensive experience working as a business analyst with a focus on retail, branch banking & teller solutions
Hands-on business analysis experience in the implementation of a branch banking platform (TouchPoint, Argo, S1, Harland, D&H or similar)
Applicable knowledge & understanding of front-end, web-based, retail & branch banking applications & systems (customer origination, deposit services, loan origination, new account opening or similar)
Excellent communication & presentation skills - written & verbal.  Able to appropriately interact with users & personnel in all phases
This position will require some travel as necessary.
industry: Banking - Financial Services, Consulting, Computer Software

details:
Our direct client has a immediate contract opening for a Salesforce Administartor.
 Reporting to a Director of Business Application Services in IT, this Salesforce Administrator/Business Analyst will work with the product owner/SMEs and IT resources to ensure accurate representation of Business Requirements and timely and effective delivery of the Salesforce solution to fill those requirements.   Responsibilities:  • Administration and support of Salesforce.com including configuration updates to security, sharing rules, profiles, roles, custom objects, fields, record types, updating page layouts and validation rules, reports, dashboards, etc• Stay current on new Salesforce features and functionality and provide recommendations for process improvements • Support the governance model by working closely with all system partners to ensure minimal impact to organizations within the shared Salesforce instance 
 Qualifications: • 3+ years’ experience as a Salesforce Administrator • 3+ years’ experience as a Business Analyst • 2+ years’ experience with Marketing, Sales, and Sales operations and process monitoring  • 3+ years’ experience implementing enterprise class systems and 2+ years of experience working with the Salesforce.com product  • Experience with Zuora billing system and integration with SFDC is highly desired • Experience in designing and configuring software components and having a very strong service oriented architecture and integration background • Functional knowledge of Salesforce.com data structure and understanding of how to leverage the tool to meet complex process and reporting requirements • One or more Salesforce.com (SFDC) Certifications, Advanced Certifications a PLUS– including (Advanced) Administrator, (Advanced) Developer, Sales Cloud, Service Cloud  Education:  • BS, BA and/or Masters in Business Operations, Computer Science, Information Services or related discipline and 3 – 5+ years of relevant experience.

See above
title: Salesforce Administrator/ Business Analyst

details:
The Senior IT Business Analyst will demonstrate strong experience in implementing business analysis process, techniques and methodologies.  Contribute to application design by defining needs and recommending technical solutions that will maximize the value delivered by the system to stakeholders. Determine how the project they are assigned to impacts other projects, systems or business areas.  Ensure project meets the strategic goals/initiatives of the organization.  Influences, persuades, and leads other team members and stakeholders to achieve project goals and objectives.  Additional duties include:

Facilitates and lead interviews and cross-functional working sessions with the business process owner, functional business analyst and development team to elicit and clearly define requirements.
Converts business requirements into user stories and acceptance criteria
Captures non-functional and other system requirements (e.g., supported browsers, security, system performance expectations, etc.).
Produces deliverables as needed: (e.g., work breakdown structure, product backlog of detailed user stories acceptance criteria, data dictionary, business rules, wireframes, workflow diagrams, process diagrams and system interaction diagrams, etc.).
Provides significant input to system specifications and design.
Develops detailed knowledge/expertise in applications assigned.  Analyzes system integration impacts and define integration requirements.
Collaborates with developers to establish the technical vision and analyze tradeoffs between usability and performance needs.
Attends demos and review completed sprint development for accuracy.
Reviews detailed requirements with project manager/technical lead to ensure adherence to scope and level of effort estimations.
Estimates requirements gathering level of effort, develops business analysis work plans, and ensures BA deliverables quality and timeliness.
Coordinates with Quality Assurance (QA) and the development team to ensure requirements are understood.
Participates in and/or coordinates required testing/validation of system fixes, which may include creating the actual test cases or reviewing test cases created by QA.
Supports User Acceptance Testing.
Serves as the key IT counterpart to the Functional Area (Business Process) Owner and Functional Business Analyst.  Is jointly responsible for understanding, prioritizing, & defining continuous improvement requests.
Performs problem determination and resolution as part of system production support.
Acts as the business analyst team lead on larger projects and initiatives.
Provides guidance and mentoring to less experienced team members.
Ensures issues are identified, tracked, reported on and resolved in a timely manner; escalate and retain ownership of all open/unresolved issues.
Performs other duties as assigned.


REQUIREMENTS
 

Minimum five (5) + years working as a business or technical analyst on application development projects
Experience with waterfall and agile software development methodologies.
Experience with more than one (1) business domain.
Experience with SQL queries
Experience supporting large/complex software development projects including both enhancement/support projects as well as new development (greenfield) projects
Minimum one + years of functional expertise/experience.
Must have strong PC skills and advanced working knowledge with Microsoft Office products, SharePoint and experience with requirements tracking software

 
EDUCATION
 
Bachelor's Degree

details: Job Description If you are an experienced Business Analyst looking for a position with a leading company, Bartech can help! We are a leading staffing firm and our clients include some over the nation’s biggest companies. Our client has a need for a Business Analyst. This is a contract position; however it is not uncommon for assignments to transition into permanent positions with our client companies. If you have the background we are looking for, and you are interested in an opportunity to get your foot in the door with leading company, we want to talk with you!  Business Analyst          Job Responsibilities                                                Your specific duties as a Business Analyst will include:         Analyzes company functions, processes, and activities to improve computer-based business applications for the most effective use of money, materials, equipment, and people. Utilizes available computer systems resources and personnel to carry out analysis to support management's quest for performance improvement. Reviews and analyzes information, forecasts, methods, schedules, systems, processes, and procedures. Determines most useful business solutions for the company. Recommends alternative solutions to management as to courses of action that best meet the organization's goals. Performs duties concerned with the design and improvement of computer-based business systems. Works closely with senior managers to identify and solve a variety of computer-based business system problems. Analyzes requirements, procedures, and problems to automate processing or to improve existing business systems. Confers with personnel of organizational units involved to analyze current operational procedures and identify problems. Solicits from management symptoms of problem, formally defines the problem, breaks problem into component parts, and gathers information about each of these parts from a variety of sources. Selects the most appropriate analytical technique. Utilizes several study techniques including simulation, linear and nonlinear programming, dynamic programming, queuing and other stochastic-process models, Markov decision processes, econometric methods, data envelopment analysis, neural networks, expert systems, decision analysis, and the analytic hierarchy process. Writes description of business needs, business program functions, and steps required to develop or modify computer-based business systems. Reviews computer system capabilities, workflow, and scheduling limitations to determine if requested program or program change is possible within existing system. Studies existing computer-based business systems to evaluate effectiveness, and develops new systems to improve production or workflow as required. This position provides a wide array of weekly and ad-hoc tasks depending on project size and staffing. Collecting and maintaining data for the Project work stream plan Validating of required reports; Assisting with maintenance, tracking and resolution of issues and action items. Collecting and maintaining project plan and schedule data, working in conjunction with Project Scheduler. Elevating risk triggers to Project Manager. Updating and maintaining living documents. Assisting with QA, test planning, test execution and resolution of defects found. Coordinating technical dependencies with other work streams. Maintain risk register, issues and action item logs. Maintain project living documents. Work shop coordination and participation. Collection of data for status reporting. Producing business process maps. Document business requirements. Tracing process mapping to business requirements. Ensuring traceability of project scope and functional requirements to technical requirements. Conducting gap analyses of final technology solutions against both functional and technical requirements.    Business Analyst Job Requirements As a Business Analyst you must represent our company well by being responsible, punctual and motivated to go above and beyond the call of duty. You must also be highly detail-oriented and organized with excellent analytic and problem-solving abilities. It is also important that you display excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills.  0-3 years’ experience. The individual needs to be able to work independently and a self-starter with the ability to work in a large matrix organization requiring collaboration with IT and across business support teams including Change Management, Business Process Management, Training and Business PMO/Governance. Strong analytical and technical background. Familiar with application development and delivery lifecycle. Project experience in technology deployments from a business perspective. Experienced with the use of MS Excel, PowerPoint and Word. Comfortable with presenting materials to all levels of management.    Business Analyst Benefits  As a Business Analyst with Bartech, you will be working through an established and respected staffing organization with 40 years of serving as a trusted partner to our client companies. We are dedicated to providing our talent with personal, responsive attention, and will assign an employee care representative to answer any questions or concerns that you might have. Depending upon the client, the assignment and your performance, you can find potential opportunities for direct employment. Your hard work and professional dedication will be rewarded with competitive compensation, including benefits. Available benefits for Business Analyst Position may include (but are not limited to):  Exceptional medical, dental, and vision 401(k) Paid time off, including holidays  Make the most of your experience! Apply now!  Applicant must be eligible to work in the US for immediate opening.

details: Business Analyst IDescriptionAssist with analyzing and documenting business needs and requirements. Assist in the design, testing, and implementation of new applications and enhancements to existing applications. Assist with end user support of production systems and new technologies. * Assist with day-to-day production system support to end users of assigned business unit. * Investigate initial reports of production application outage or instability, address to appropriate technical team for resolution. * Maintain basic application configuration in applications related to assigned business unit. * Identify opportunities for business process improvements. * Coordinate with business/functional users and IT technical analysts to assist with new systems or system modifications, including but not limited to: * Assist with defining, translating and simplifying business requirements. * Assist with the documentation of business rules and impacted processes or systems. * Participate with document functional specifications. * Assist in developing test plans with the assigned business unit. * Participate and Assist application testing. * Collaborate to produce project documentation. * Participate in implementation planning. * Assist with training of end users for assigned business unit. Skill/Experience/Education * Bachelor's degree and 2 years business analyst experience OR currently pursuing a Bachelor's degree in related field for enrolled college candidates being considered at the entry level. * Understanding of standard concepts, best practices and company procedures related to the assigned business function. * Knowledge of technology applications used in assigned business function. * Understand and recognize when business practices can be improved through technology. * Effective written and oral communication skill, problem solving and decision making. * Working knowledge of Microsoft office; Outlook, Word and Excel including basic formulas and editing to track and report project status and other data. * Maintain effective cooperative relationships with both end users and IT analysts. * Planning skills to coordinate and complete small projects on time and on budget. * Manage time effectively while assuring attention to details. * Make sound decisions with general guidance. Ideal Candidate:This role will require OT and some Saturday work. Candidate would need to be flexible to these hours.This position is in support of the billing department and conversion to the new CIS system. Ideal candidate has the ability to quickly pickup on new technologies and able to quickly adjust to change as it occurs. Must be self motivated and able to prioritize work. Ability to utilize multiple applicatations and systems. Possibility of overtime hours. Candidate needs to have some flexibility. Seeking candidates with prior call center or customer service experience. Major challenge of role is to ensure customer billings are procuded in compliance with applicable pricing and regulatory requirements while meeting company objectives. Will also assist in developing processes that ensure all current and future revenue sources are accurately captured and billed. Evaluate and implement changes as necessary.Interested candidates please send resume in Word format to [Click Here to Email Your Resumé] Please reference job code 51074 when responding to this ad.GDH Consulting, Inc. provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, veteran's status or any other category protected by law. In addition to federal law requirements, GDH Consulting, Inc. complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities and/or employees. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, benefits and training.

details:
SENIOR (PEOPLESOFT FINANCIALS) BUSINESS ANALYST
Seeking a Sr. Business Analyst who will work with users to define and document system requirements for new Financials Cloud implementation.  The Business Analyst (BA) will also contribute to other IT business or sponsored technology projects by translating basic to complex business needs into understandable requirements. Business Analysts participate in the development and management of project plans related to application development initiatives, from project planning (business & strategic) and design, testing, implementation and maintenance. 
 
General responsibilities include: Facilitate requirements gathering and design sessions, review design documentation with users and developers, prepare process and data models, prioritize system functionality based on requirements, coordinate pilot and test activities, and design screens and reports.  
BUSINESS ANALYST (PeopleSoft Financials) RESPONSIBILITIES
·   The Business Analysts educate project team members and the business community on the impact of the proposed technology, as well as developing contingency plans.  
·  Responsible for production support for assigned systems, ensuring an efficient and smooth production environment by working with the developer and applying patches and fixes to the system upon failure of the system.
·  Responsible for ensuring the least amount of downtime or inefficient production for assigned systems.  Work with the developer and/or DBA to “tune” the system to ensure the most efficient system within available resources.
·         Use an in-depth understanding of the system to write reports for users and/or clients from systems which aid in business decision making.
·         The Business Analysts develop and conduct user training on system(s) functionality.
·         Work with internal users to understand system needs and develop plans for meeting those needs.
·         Assist in large scope projects or lead activities in small to medium scope projects during analysis, design, construction and testing phases of projects.
·         Facilitate in requirements and design sessions for smaller to medium scope projects and participate in the requirements and design sessions for large scope projects.
·         Define and document functional and system specifications.
·         Develop process flows, system flows, and data models using modeling and process tools.
·         Prioritize system and data functionality requirements based on user needs and project constraints.
·         Review design documentation with users and developers.
·         The Business Analysts work with vendors/vendor packages to ensure that system requirements are understood.
·         Write test plans and test cases in compliance with relevant organizational and industry standards.
·         Creates clearly documented defect reports that enable a developer or technician to recreate the defect. May clear defect reports.
·         Maintain and update test documentation, user guides, release notes, and help notes to ensure the accuracy of applications and related documentation.
·         Executes end-to-end functional tests and utilizes automated tests developed by others to exercise system. Collaborates to achieve end-to-end product and process quality.
·         The Business Analysts also provide information, analysis and recommendations to support the product.
·         Understands the business needs the product is trying to meet and applies this understanding to guide testing. Applies a comprehensive understanding of the product functions and the marketplace in which it is sold effectively test assigned products

BUSINESS ANALYST (PeopleSoft Financials) REQUIREMENTS


Experience with PeopleSoft Financials (GL/AP/FA/nVision)

A considerable understanding of current and emerging IT products, services, processes, and methodologies, along with a continuing understanding of the business function and process. 
Ability to understand business requirements, goals, and risks, to formulate and define the technical scope and objectives of projects.
Has a team orientation and is focused on improving business operations at all times.

“POTENTIAL NICE-TO-HAVE”: Oracle HCM Cloud and/or ALM experience/knowledge

title: Senior Business Analyst

details:
The Role:
As part of our team, you will plan, design, develop, and launch efficient business, financial, and operations systems in support of core organizational functions and business processes. This role involves 60% technical business analyst work and 40% quality assurance testing of the product based on the requirements you draft.  Position will elicit, specify, and validate the business needs of a project sponsor or end user, and will apply proven communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills to help maximize the benefit of IT system investments.  Our testing environment is currently 100% manual but will rely on VB or Python scripting for automated testing.
 
Responsibilities:
●  Collaborative define and design projects by working with both business and technical staff
●  Elicit requirements from your clients, customers, and stakeholders.
●  Using those requirements, author use cases with detailed, clearly articulated business objectives and acceptance criteria.
●  Solicit feedback before, during, and after the development of projects in order to better iterate upon and refine the design and user experience.
●  Prepares detail work plan and schedule, completes analysis and research, identifies options, and recommends actions or changes for assigned projects.
●  Facilitate meetings when appropriate
●  Identify and document issues and assist in issue resolution.
●  Proactively and objectively evaluate and identify areas in our processes or product that can be streamlined, reorganized, or better positioned and create projects that execute on your ideas.
●  Serve as Subject Matter Expert and Trainer for platforms
●  Define and perform functional system setup and setup documentation preparation.
●  Assist in definition and execution of user training and documentation preparation.
●  Test projects as they are developed ensuring that the acceptance criteria were met to your and your stakeholder’s satisfaction.
●  Understand the personas of your users and know their motivations and goals.
●  Coordinate and perform in-depth tests, including end-user reviews, for modified and new systems, and other post-implementation support.
●  Perform regression testing.
               




Required Qualifications:
●  HS Diploma or GED equivalent
●  5+ years’ experience as an IT Business Analyst
●  5+ years’ experience in Quality Assurance Testing; At least three (3) years testing in an SDLC environment including three (3) years creating test plans and test cases.
●  Proven experience with business and technical requirements analysis, elicitation, modeling, verification, and methodology development.
●  Extensive practical knowledge in importing data for use in report software, spreadsheets, graphs, and flow charts.
●  Fast learner of new tools, processes and methodologies.
●  Strong knowledge of system testing metrics, best practices and methodologies.
●  Experience generating use cases, UML, or other similar formal software documentation frameworks.
●  Experience preparing and maintaining data for execution of test cases.
●  Hands-on experience with ad-hoc query programs, especially SQL.
●  Industry background in payroll, HR, health insurance, employee benefits solutions is a plus.

details:

Responsible for facilitating working sessions using targeted facilitation and advanced modeling techniques. Will work in a highly collaborative, cross functional development team on various project activities  Business Analyst Required Experience  Proven ability to navigate between different project methodologies (i.e. Agile, waterfall) Proven ability to apply industry standard modeling techniques as appropriate to further deepen a common understanding across project team members and stakeholders Proven ability to perform analysis and support teams during an analysis effort. title: Data Business Analyst

details:
NTT DATA, Inc., a top 10 global IT services company, has an immediate need for a Sr. Business Analyst for Market Research to support our client in New York, NY To apply for this position, please follow the link below or send your resume directly to [Click Here to Email Your Resumé] For more information please call Melissa Torrisi at732-362-2604.   Contract Opening 6+ months NY, NY  Sr. Business Analyst supporting a Market Research/Reporting project: The organization supports a syndicated research function providing valuable real-world data across the US and robust reporting and analytics capabilities to clients. The function is currently seeking opportunities to improve the platform and services it offers. This role will be expected to drive this effort, identify opportunities to improve platform, and recommendations on path forward.
 Market Research/Reporting Experience and market research and reporting platforms as a service is a plus
Core Responsibilities: Synthesize information from various departments enabling the project team to make key strategic decisions in a timely manner.  Stellar documentation skills with the ability to articulate complex topics in a concise and articulate manner. Understand data needs and compose data queries, analysis and reports and garner a thorough understanding of data output and potential business implications. Create process flows that map current procedures and workflows. Manage and drive decision making process amongst key stakeholders.  Develop customized analytical reports to meet requests of external and internal customers. Drive effective follow up, including data and information delivery and next steps.  Experience writing use cases containing clearly articulated needs, features and acceptance tests.  Sr. Business Analyst will be required to analyze business process flows and impact on technology flows.  Sr. Business Analyst be required to translate regulatory requirements into functional technical requirements  Sr. Business Analyst writes user’s stories in an iterative fashion, liaising with the developers, product owners and other business analysts within the scrum team.  Ability to collaborate with business and technology teams to understand requirements and share with the technical team.  Provide training and on-going support for system processes and policy-based procedures Attend meetings and daily communication sessions to keep abreast of project objectives, process workflows and progress of business concepts Effectively communicate and message with experience in communicating to senior leadership. Proven experience with project management (e.g., data inventory, rationalization, and migration preferred) including the capacity to manage multiple projects and priorities at an extremely fast-paced schedule. 
Prior Experience/Requirements: 4-7 years of management experience as a business analyst or similar role (e.g., consultant, product management, program delivery, etc.). Prior consulting, business intelligence, data analytics, and business development experience is a plus. Designing, implementing, and/or assessing t of controls, including an intimate understanding of the systems implementation lifecycle, as well as configuring and optimizing business process controls and application security Excellent interpersonal and communication skills - oral, written, and listening with the ability to communicate with a broad range of stakeholders at all levels.  Detail oriented with excellent analytical skills and critical thinking capabilities; must be able to identify, troubleshoot, and present findings in spreadsheet and/or graphical format with a clear and objective accompanying narrative. Strong Microsoft PowerPoint experience and ability to effectively develop and convey communication Ability to work well under pressure in an environment with frequently shifting priorities and to consistently meet project deadlines, and can work independently and be a team player. Must be proactive and demonstrate initiative and follow-up to bring outstanding issues to completion. Strong business acumen and the ability to quickly learn and absorb new information. Previous leadership experience. Experience using project management methodologies and standards. Demonstrated effective collaboration across an organization for new processes and internal operations. Ability to prioritize multiple projects simultaneously and manage deadlines as required.
   NTT DATA is a leading IT services provider and global innovation partner with 130,000 professionals based in over 50 countries. NTT DATA recently acquired Dell Services.  NTT DATA emphasizes long-term commitment and combines global reach and local intimacy to provide premier professional services, including consulting, application services, business process, IT outsourcing, and cloud-based solutions. We're part of NTT Group, one of the world's largest technology services companies, generating more than $100 billion in annual revenues and partner to 80% of the Fortune 100. Visit www.nttdata.com/americas to learn how our consultants, projects, managed services, and outsourcing engagements deliver value for a wide range of businesses and government agencies. The Company is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit and business needs. The Company will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religious creed, citizenship, national origin, ancestry, age, sex, sexual orientation, genetic information, physical or mental disability, veteran or marital status, or any other class protected by law. To comply with applicable laws ensuring equal employment opportunities to qualified individuals with a disability, the Company will make reasonable accommodations for the known physical or mental limitations of an otherwise qualified individual with a disability who is an applicant or an employee unless undue hardship to the Company would result. U.S. Citizens and those authorized to work in the U.S. are encouraged to apply. We are unable to sponsor at this time.

title: Business Analyst

details:
The Technical Business Analyst will participate in technology discovery activities business process evolution for technology initiatives focused on delivering strategic capabilities in areas including: security, 3rd party performance management, data and risk management.  Additionally, will play an important collaboration role in the implementation of other technology capabilities.  This position will formulate, implement, and drive strategies that optimize agility, speed, creativity and flexibility and leverage deep understanding of business process, technology, and industry best practices to deliver solutions that support the overall business intent, while acting as a role model for the principles, philosophies, and values of the company.
Responsibilities:

Draft business requirements, including Use Cases, functional and non-functional requirements and exceptions
Define and document end to end processes and supporting data flows
Translate Use Cases and functional requirements into component technical specifications
Define technology requirements and strategies to support business requirements
Participate in test planning, execution and defect management
Utilize worksheet and database skills to manipulate and analyze quantitative data
Work independently to analyze business / technology issues and develop alternatives and recommendations
Work with project management, design, delivery and support teams to develop workplans and milestone plans
Lead solution delivery; serve as full time or interim technology or project management lead on smaller technology initiatives or project components
Identify, plan and manage technology interdependencies
Proactively identify and mitigate or troubleshoot system issues
Source and assess external resources to support IT and company stakeholders
Safeguard the company’s assets
Adhere to the company’s compliance program
Maintain knowledge of industry standards, methodologies, processes, and best practices
Maintain a service-oriented, customer-focused mindset that supports ongoing operations and drives efficiency, quality, customer service and growth
Ability and willingness to travel as necessary with the United States and internationally


Required Qualifications:

BA/BS in Information Technology or related field
Minimum of 5 years of IT experience in Digital Retail / web development
Experience in the automotive marketing and sales (a plus)
Excellent verbal and written communication skills including development of business and technical requirements and delivering presentations to peer groups, and associates
Demonstrated analytical and problem solving skills
Demonstrated project management and planning skills
Strong understanding of project management life cycle and system development life cycle methodologies and procedures, including Agile
Must be an energetic, forward-thinking and creative individual with high ethical standards and an appropriate professional image
Must be a well-organized and self-directed individual who is "politically savvy" and a team player
Must be an intelligent and articulate individual who can relate to people at all levels of an organization and possesses excellent communication skills
Proven success in a fast-paced environment and relevant experience with e-commerce and digital business models
Prior success in scoping, planning and driving business development initiatives within matrixed organizations
Knowledge of organization policies and procedures
Must be able and willing to participate as individual contributor where situation requires
Must have ability to work the time necessary to complete projects and/or meet deadlines

*Candidates must be local and have authorization to work in the U.S. for any employer. No third parties.

title: Technical Business Analyst

details:
This position will likely exceed the 6 month duration based on performance.   To be responsible for requirements development and management for the assigned components of the Encore product family.   - Prepare product and functional specifications.  - Transfer information in the form of product and/or system requirements from Product Marketing to Engineering.  - Manage requirement change requests in relation to the project plans to ensure agreed deadlines are met.  - Assist in the creation of user and system test plans.  - Maintain a trace matrix to map requirements through each phase of the product development process.  - Engage with the engineering team throughout the development process to ensure that marketing requirements are accurately implemented as features in the product.  - Serve as Product Owner to one or more Scrum agile development teams.   The successful candidate will learn the features of the product family, what users of the product want to accomplish and what features they value, and the important aspects of the systems, applications, and devices that interact with the assigned areas of the Encore product family, and how those interactions work. Establish and maintain professional relationships in other business units such as Sleep Therapy, Home Ventilation, Patient Interface, and other relevant groups.   Your team  This position will be part of a software product group that develops the Encore family of computer applications, which are used by clinicians and therapists to analyze and evaluate that data that is collected by mechanical ventilators and medical devices that treat obstructive sleep apnea (OSA). These software applications are both web based and MS Windows based and are distributed and used by outside customers to manage patients data, to evaluate how the therapy is improving the patient’s quality of life, and to generate reports for doctors, insurance companies, etc. This position will act as a liaison between the software development team and Product Marketing.   We are looking for  Seeking a highly motivated professional with a passion for software applications. The ideal candidate will have at least 4 years of experience on a software development team but not necessarily a programmer.  Bachelors Degree from an accredited university is required. Since a Business Analyst is a mix between Business/Marketing skills and Computer Science/IT skills, one of the following is preferred: 1) A Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or software related program along with an MBA, or 2) A Bachelors Degree in Business Administration or Marketing with extensive experience with the process of developing computer software. Applicants with equivalent degrees such as a Bachelors Degree in Information Technology, Management Information Systems, or Quantitative Business Analysis will also be considered. Agile and Scrum experience strongly preferred.   The candidate will be required to demonstrate proficiency in:  - Writing requirements specifications for computer applications that are unambiguous, testable, and verifiable.  - Interacting directly with end users (clinicians, homecare health providers, etc.), Software Engineers, Project Managers, and Marketing Managers.  - Software application development and/or the process of developing software.  - Distinguishing between customer requests and needs.  - Creating use cases, user stories, acceptance criteria, and other forms of requirements documentation  - Tracing product requirements through the design, implementation, and test phases of development

title: Business Analyst II

details:
Overview
Envision Physician Services is a multispecialty physician group and practice management company. Established in 1953, our organization provides anesthesia, emergency medicine, hospital medicine, radiology, primary/urgent care, surgical services, and women’s and children’s health services to hospitals and health systems nationwide. Sheridan Healthcare, EmCare, Reimbursement Technologies and Emergency Medical Associates have recently joined forces to form Envision Physician Services.  As one organization, we now provide a greater scope of service than any other national physician group. Our collective experience from hundreds of local, customized engagements, culture of continuous lean process improvement, and team of experts in the business of healthcare enable us to better solve complex problems and consistently give healthcare organizations confidence in our execution. Our combined organization serves more than 780 healthcare facilities in 48 states and the District of Columbia.  If you are looking for a stable, fast-paced, growing company in the healthcare industry that is committed to innovation, excellence and integrity, then this may be a great next step in the advancement of your career.We currently have an exciting opportunity available for an experienced Business Analyst II. 

Responsibilities
The Business Analyst II role is to identify, document, and provide work estimates for radiology platform integration and deployment projects. May work on more strategic and larger scale initiatives as needed. 
Partner with internal subject matter experts to elicit requirements that best meet business needs and properly document business, user, functional, and non-functional requirements for platform deployments. 
Leverage tools and templates to estimate level of effort and cost associated with work to deploy/integrate platforms, and populate financial models with project information.
Publish meeting notes to summarize and communicate estimates and projected impacts.
Partner with IT and business teams to discuss functional design concepts, validate assumptions, and follow through with problem resolution.
Translate requirements to with project team to ensure clear understanding.
Produce professional quality work products such as project summaries, diagrams, and estimates.
Demonstrate the ability to learn new techniques and adapt to using the tools aligned with the organization, i.e. Kaizen Tools. 
Establish processes to intake and manage new requests
Assist in weekly/monthly status update presentations
Participate and promote a knowledge-sharing environment.
Provide timely, comprehensive verbal and written status reports.
Provide application demonstrations and training as required.
Other duties as needed

Full-Time/Part-Time
Full-Time 
Description
POSITION TITLE: Vendor Relations Business AnalystDEPARTMENT: Configurations________________________________________________________________________GENERAL PURPOSE: The Vendor Relations Business Analyst is responsible for defining and implementing best practices that maximize efficiencies while building and preserving positive vendor partnerships. The Vendor Relations Business Analyst acts as a liaison between external vendors as well as internal and external departments within the company. The Vendor Relations Business Analyst will also assist as necessary with the integration of all new vendors, initiating contact and providing a company overview and technical support.ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Interacts externally to resolve issues affecting operations. This includes, but is not limited to, vendors and outsourced companies.
Assists as necessary with integration process of all new vendors.
Daily monitoring and troubleshooting of vendor programs, working cooperatively with others to achieve long term resolution of errors.
Works with other team members to provide guidance, training and technical direction.
Assists in cross functional projects and achieves timely and accurate deliverables.
Assists in testing and documenting configuration solutions for the following functions:
Provider reimbursement configuration set-up and maintenance.
Membership/divisions configuration set-up and maintenance.
Group/member premium configuration set-up and maintenance.
Medical management configuration set-up and maintenance.
Setup of code sets used for configuration in benefits & pricing and other sub-systems.
Sustains business relationships that foster open communication and are built on integrity, and mutual respect.


Reviews processes and procedures to identify needs and provide recommendations with high emphasis on continuous improvement.
Performs other duties as assigned.
QUALIFICATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE: An undergraduate degree in business administration, information science, computer science, industrial engineering, or a related discipline from an accredited institution of higher learning preferred; minimum of two years of configuration experience providing pricing and/or benefits configuration support on IKA, Facets, MHS, Diamond, or a similar payer system required, preferably in a medium to large health care or related organization; or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.NECESSARY KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:  Ability to: work from designated office for collaborative/interactive fulfillment of duties; concentrate in an open-office “cubicle” environment; appropriately and directly interact with other staff members and/or outside associates; perform telephone and/or computer work for extended periods of time; operate office equipment such as computer, telephone, and copy/scan/fax machine; attend and participate in meetings via phone, computer, or in person.
Configuration knowledge of Medicare/Medicaid a must.
Understanding of CMS guidelines for MA’s, PFFS and Medicaid products a must.
The ability to build and develop business relationships at multiple levels within the organization and outside with our vendors and other partners.
Problem solving and project management skills.
EDI Process knowledge a plus!
Medicare claims knowledge required.
MS Office skills.
Windows operating system and its utilities.
Excellent analytical & organizational skills, including the ability to work with all levels of personnel.
Excellent oral and written communication including good grammar, voice and diction.
WHAT WE OFFER:Benefits include:
Paid Vacation time
Paid Holidays
401k employer match
Full line of Healthcare Benefits
Opportunities for career advancement

details:
Oracle Business Analyst




Uline – Shipping Supply Specialists

"The people I work with are as passionate as I am." 
"I came to Uline for a job. Instead, I found a career."

Uline is North America's leading distributor of shipping, packaging and industrial supplies. We're a family-owned company known for our incredible customer service and quality products. Our people make the difference.

We're looking for the best and brightest to take our Finance department to the next level. If you have passion and expertise in accounting, tax, financial analysis, international finance, credit and collections, or accounts payable, Uline is the company for you.


Uline seeks an Oracle Business Analyst at its Corporate Headquarters in Pleasant Prairie, Wisconsin (north of Chicago, Illinois). Position will be based out of Gurnee, IL office.


ORACLE BUSINESS ANALYST RESPONSIBILITIES



Work closely with Accounts Payable, Accounting and Procurement staff to support Oracle EBS R12 software. 


Review and analyze business requirements and process configuration, mapping and management. 


Provide system and business support to users. 


Accurately repair, resolve and document system changes and issues. 


Document specifications and solutions to satisfy project requirements. 


Help deploy and implement application projects and enhancements. 


Monitor system performance. 


Coordinate Oracle service requests and drive them to a final resolution.



ORACLE BUSINESS ANALYST MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS


Bachelor's degree. 


Expertise with Oracle modules – Accounts Payables, General Ledger, Cash Management and Purchasing. 


Understanding of Oracle Workflow. 


Experience upgrading Oracle 11i to Oracle R12 with an understanding of the functional changes between the two versions. 


Proficient in understanding the application design, configuration / module setup and documentation of functional documents. 


Strong communication and management skills. 


Ability to troubleshoot issues and assist with support. 


Knowledge and experience with Oracle open interfaces and application programming interfaces (APIs). 


Understanding of flex fields, workflow, setup and profile options. 


Understanding of multi-organization and multi-currency functionality. 


Working knowledge of query tools (PL/SQL, Toad, SQL Plus).





ORACLE BUSINESS ANALYST BENEFITS



Complete insurance coverage – medical, dental, vision, life.




State-of-the-art fitness facilities and gourmet cafeteria. 


401(k) with company match.



Generous paid time off.



Tuition reimbursement.



3 bonus programs. 



Please visit www.uline.jobs to learn more about our job openings and benefits package.

HOW TO APPLY

Please click the “APPLY" button to submit your resume for immediate consideration! 

EEO/AA Employer/Vet/Disabled

Uline is a drug-free workplace

ORACLE, ORACLE ANALYST, ORACLE BUSINESS ANALYST, FINANCE, ACCOUNTING, ACCOUNTS PAYABLE, PROCUREMENT, ORACLE EBS R12, CONFIGURATION, ORACLE SYSTEM, SYSTEM REPAIR, TROUBLESHOOT, ORACLE MODULES, ACCOUNTS PAYABLES, GENERAL LEDGER, CASH MANAGEMENT, PURCHASING, ORACLE WORKFLOW, ORACLE 11I, API, APPLICATION PROGRAMMING INTERFACE, QUERY TOOLS, PL, SQL, TOAD, SQL PLUS, MILWAUKEE, CHICAGO, KENOSHA, RACINE, WAUKEGAN, LAKE COUNTY

details: IT Business Analyst - Senior Top Criteria: - Strong Facilitation Skills - Expert level in requirements elicitation and documentation skills of User Stories, System Use Cases, Functional Requirements, Non-Functional Requirements and Business Rules. - Expert Level Business and System Modeling skills using BPMN and/or UML. Producing BPMN Process Models, UML Activity Diagrams, UML Use Case Diagrams, UML State Diagrams, UML Sequence Diagrams, etc. - High level of comfort interacting with business stakeholders/product managers as well as the dev/tech team on a day to day basis. General Summary: IT Business Analyst - Senior works as a liaison among stakeholders in order to elicit, analyze, communicate and validate requirements for changes to business processes, policies and information systems. The Business Analyst - Senior understands business problems and opportunities in the context of the requirements and recommends solutions that enable the organization to achieve its goals and overall business strategies. Level Expectations: Possess advanced knowledge of the tools and processes required by the role. Function well in large-scale, highly complex, cross-functional / platform environment. Solid individual performance, but may spend considerable portion of their time providing direction for others. Share knowledge, coach and mentor Standard level resources in area of expertise. May serve as technical lead in area of expertise. May have duties instructing, directing, and checking the work of others. Good communication and relationship skills, both in directing the technical team and updating leadership. Essential Functions: - Perform analysis of business issues, provide recommendations for possible solutions, work with Business users and IT project teams to drive decision making and define requirements for application development, ensuring that business needs are being met. - Complete documentation for business requirements, which guide application development efforts, working closely with the development team and business teams to ensure successful implementation of business requirements. - Assist with the development and maintenance of the business requirements process used to define requirements for systems projects, assist with the definition and negotiation of project scope and create appropriate scope documentation. - Analyze opportunities to improve application reliability, provide recommendations for possible solutions, and work with IT and Business partners to implement solutions that enhance application and infrastructure reliability. - Work with IT and Business partners to build support processes and procedures provide ongoing support to manage application SLAs, resolve a majority of the problems and fulfill service requests that do not require application development. - Perform analysis of compliance vulnerabilities; work with IT and Business teams to eliminate vulnerabilities, support internal and external audit related activities. - Communicate project status and escalates issues as needed. Qualifications: - 4 - 6 years of experience in business analysis of product or software development. - Experience with various development methodologies is highly desired. - Proven organizational skills with the ability to develop a detailed work plan to ensure project success. - Demonstrated ability to organize and facilitate large cross-functional meetings. Promoted consensus on a high level view of the project and drill down into the details to obtain the requirements. - Performed thorough requirement interviews with project stakeholders. - Ability to document project issues, risks, assumptions and requirements. - Demonstrated problem solving skills and the ability to work collaboratively with other departments to resolve issues. - Ability to analyze and develop business scenarios and use cases. - Follow policies and procedures to ensure audit and corporate compliance. - Consistently deliver project status and time tracking regularly to management. - Demonstrated understanding of system design concepts. - Conduct comprehensive requirements reviews with project stakeholders, development and QA teams. - Creating process flows and diagrams necessary to assist the requirements gathering process. Possess excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong facilitation, negotiation, and conflict resolution skills. - Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, handling multiple priorities. - General PC knowledge including Microsoft Office expert level knowledge of Excel, working knowledge of Access, In-depth knowledge of SQL preferred - Working knowledge of SharePoint required. - Working knowledge of Atlassian Agile tools like Jira and Confluence is a definite plus

Business Analyst 

The Business Analyst will be primarily responsible for eliciting and capturing end-user technical requirements and translating them into groomed and estimated user stories. Additionally, the Business Analyst will have varying degrees of responsibility for managing the delivery of technology development and testing, acting as the Scrum Master within the organization.

The Business Analyst will join a cross-functional team of diverse staff at our client's world headquarters, working with IT staff, assorted project delivery staff, business intelligence analysts and a team of remote developers and testers offshore.

Job Title:  Business Analyst - Anoka,  Job Description:  Advantage Resourcing is seeking a Business Analyst to work on a team at our client site in Anoka, MN.  The position is W2 with Advantage Resourcing, with all work taking place at our client site.    Job Description: Purpose: Working under general supervision to identify gaps between business objectives and systems scope by interviewing business owners, conducting research and drawing on own knowledge of applicable business systems and industry requirements in order to develop approved system enhancements.  Job Accountabilities  Coordinate and lead activities with business owners to gather detailed requirements through interviews, documentation and facilitated working sessions for projects and enhancements. Research government and other documentation to determine desired system behavior. Monitor business decisions and manage requirements documentation and communication. Lead analysis of requirements to determine the systems’ potential and define impact on other business units and systems. Support development and QA team members; ensure requirements are met. Create process models based on business requirements in order to determine the completeness of the information and process components. details: Job Title:  IT Business Analyst - Houston, TX Job Description:  Job Title:  IT Business Analyst – SAP SD Service contracts and Customer billing   Job Description:   We are looking for an experienced IT business analyst with broad experience in developing solutions to integrate our order management and service delivery functions to a vast array of modern customer centric sales motions. Looking for individuals who can innovate and take ideas from concept to implementation while providing leadership and direction to teams.   Responsibilities  • Develop and lead implementation of solutions in customer order billing and services contracts including installed base(functional location; equipment records)  • Establishes and maintains relationships with key tactical leaders and business implementation leads. Uses deep business knowledge of multiple businesses or sub- domains to drive engagement for major IT initiatives. Influences overall IT and business planning; engages in strategic business planning where there is IT impact.  • Actively participates in IT projects to ensure that business, function, and geography “customers” are included appropriately and ensures that they receive sufficient and timely communications.  • Develops request for proposals/quote, works to develop project proposals and statements of work, and other engagement activities with IT service providers.  • A preponderance of time is spent in strategic and creative problem solving. Demonstrates broad project leadership, impacting significant technical direction; exerts influence outside of immediate team and drives change. Applies in-depth or broad technical knowledge to various technology areas or functions. Performs solution design.  • Provides leadership to teams and integrates technical expertise and business understanding to create superior solutions for the company and customers. Consults with team members and other organizations, customer and vendors on complex issues. Mentors others in the business analysis community.    Knowledge and Skills  • Must have 10 or more years of experience developing complex information systems  • Must have 7 years of experience implementing SAP ERP/ECC/S4 systems with a focus on SD and Installed base functions such as sales order processing, pricing, billing and invoicing, Service contracts, functional location and equipment records  • Must have strong verbal and written communication skills; demonstrated influencing skills, high level of technical and team leadership skills and ability to partner effectively with business resources  • Must have understanding of modern software design patterns  • Ability to lead teams that design and document complex solution architectures from conceptual thru technical implementation  • Strong business process knowledge of complex supply chain or order processing at a global scale  • Experience with data management, governance, and cross application data mapping  • Implementation experience with eCommerce solutions with a focus on customer invoicing in a global deployment  • Experience working with multiple IT service providers and solution integrators preferred  • Must have experience working with multi-geography cross–functional teams.  Additional Details:   Job ID: 319333 Dept ID: 10581 Location: Houston, TX United States of America Industry: Information Technology / IT - Software Job Type: Temp Position Folder Group ID 13  Posted Date:3/30/2018 Domain:arna Contact: [Click Here to Email Your Resumé]

title: Sr. Business Analyst

details:
Hi,

We are actively hiring for IT Business Analyst II at Waltham, MA.

If interested, please respond back with your updated word format resume.No C2C/C2H. This position is on W2 only for US Citizens/ Green Card/ EAD.

 

Job Title: IT Business Analyst II

Location: Waltham, MA

Duration: 12+ Months

Job Description:

The IS/IT Cyber Security Business Analyst is responsible for assessing the business needs of the project, converting these into formal business requirements, and producing the documents that will allow the (remainder of the) project team to define, develop and implement a solution that will meet these needs. He/she will produce the Investment Proposal, Business Requirements, and the Total Cost of Ownership and provide input to a range of other project deliverables. 

Key Accountabilities: 

Delivery of analysis deliverables for medium and some large sized projects such as the investment proposal, business requirements document, and supporting analysis deliverables. 
Investigates work to determine business requirements and specify business processes, through improvements in information systems, information management, practices, procedures and organization change. Conducts investigations for strategy studies, business requirements and feasibility studies. 
Applies and monitors the use of required modeling and analysis tools. Methods and standards giving special consideration to business perspectives. 
Identifies stakeholders and their business needs. 


Knowledge & Experience Required: 

Good Leadership skills and a tracking record of ability to influence business or IS colleagues. 
Experience of undertaking roles in which analytical thinking is applied to produce business improvements within thecompany's Environment 
Knowledge of IS project development processes and wider organization units of IS is preferred but not mandatory 
An understanding of how the company is organized as a business, what the business functions do at a high level and how the company makes money 
Understanding of the purpose of business process teams and the new RIIO regulatory framework. 


Qualifications Required: 

Relevant business analysis qualification – e.g. working towards or has BCS ISEB Diploma in business analysis or similar qualification or experience that demonstrates analysis skills. 

Key Interfaces: 

Business Users 
IS Business Consultants 
Project Manager 
Solution Architects 
Partner resources 
IS Procurement, IS Finance, IS Service Delivery 


Core Business Skills: 

Commercial Awareness - Consistently takes into consideration commercial implications of actions when making decisions or setting objectives for self or others. 
Leadership & Team Working - Strongly demonstrates team working through sharing the workload to ensure the team meets its objectives. Keeps the team informed and up to date with relevant information and consistently is encouraging continuous improvement. 
Customer Focus - Shows depth of approach in communication with customers. Developing relationships with customers to address underlying needs and identify areas for improvement. 
Drive and Initiative - Without supervision will apply extra effort to meet the team’s objectives and deadlines. Demonstrates a strong determination to achieve business goals despite opposition. 
Business Analysis Techniques - Familiar with a broad range of modelling techniques. Works independently. Frequently provides advice/support to colleagues on areas of knowledge. Has proved competent to work on a few larger scale or more complex projects. Shows a desire to improve techniques and methods employed. Frequently demonstrates sound understanding of the key purpose of analysis activity. Can effectively analyse given information, identifying relevant relationships and resolving given business problems. Can independently pick up new analysis tools and techniques quickly. Analysis deliverables benefit from peer review but do not require significant rework Frequently demonstrates a sound understanding of the key objectives and strategies of the majority of business functions within the organization 
Information Capture - Demonstrates a sound knowledge of the appropriate information capture techniques appropriate for any situation. Works independently on information capture activities. Able to supervise others on the selection and use of appropriate techniques. Identifies the needs of different classes of stakeholders and knows how those needs would be catered for in the management of interviews, workshops, materials, etc. for such stakeholders. 
Communication Skills - Under minor supervision, conducts stakeholder analysis to understand communication preferences and certain characteristics. Occasionally applies analysis without supervision. Without supervision, regularly selects the most appropriate communication method based on goals and characteristics of the audience. Adapts templates to complete documents appropriate for the audience, with limited repetition of information. 
Business Process Improvement Skills - Analyses information gathered about current business processes and business aims to identify improvements at a project level, including balancing end-business aims with IS business aims. Is aware of wider issues including cultural, organisational and business constraints affecting options for change. Identifies potential alternative processes to achieve business aims. Helps assess the risks, costs, potential benefits and feasibility of the potential approaches. Facilitates cost estimation by obtaining information and costs from potential suppliers and from experience of previous projects. Prepares business cases for the recommended approach for medium sized projects. 
Project Management - Demonstrates the ability to produce plans to support the definition of schemes of some complexity. Regularly supports project control techniques, sometimes unsupervised. Identifies and manages risks associated to the project including mitigating actions and running risk workshops. 

If interested, please respond back with your updated word format resume or apply for this job for complete details.
 
Regards
Dev

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration, or other related field or equivalent work experience- In depth knowledge of business requirements and corporate priorities- Advanced ability to gather/refine complex business requirements, recommend or make decisions on business requirements/interdependencies- Advanced ability to develop complex business cases- Advanced ability to present complex positions and strategies for business decisions, processes and plans- In depth knowledge of compliance principles- 5 to 7 years of relevant technical or business work experienceUNICON International, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. details:
Ecommerce Business Analyst 

 

This position will support the E-Commerce team.

 

Our client is transforming as a business and this person will help instill common eCommerce processes across all of our global businesses. This will be a great mix of challenge and opportunity for someone who understands how to influence others indirectly, and who enjoys putting the pieces together to create and disseminate a strong eCommerce process. If that sounds like you, then send your resume today

 

 

This is a 12 month contract role for our Charlotte  NC area based client- This role will be onsite at a client site , no remote- 

 

To be a strong fit for this opportunity you will have:

• 8+ years of experience gathering and documenting requirements, writing user stories with at least 5+ years in eCommerce space

• 3+ year of SaaS based eCommerce platform (Onboarding supplier, Data Acquisition, Product Catalog, Order Management, Payment, Settlement) 

• Manage and conduct requirements gathering, stakeholder interviews and initial discover work.

• Provide fit-gap analysis of the business processes and requirements against the out of the box fitment in eCommerce platform.

• Hands on experience in both B2B & B2C business processes

• Developer business process redesign, roadmap planning and developing proof-of-concepts

• Prepare detailed requirement specifications, functional specifications, use case and work-flow diagrams and manage the requirements throughout the project lifecycle

• Prepare training materials appropriate for target audiences and developed solution and conduct training sessions

• Lead testing efforts in conjunction with the Project or QA Manager, including the design and execution of test scripts and scenarios

 

This is a 12 month contract role for our Charlotte  NC area based client- This role will be onsite at a client site , no remote- 



Required:

• 8+ years of experience gathering and documenting requirements, writing user stories with at least 5+ years in eCommerce space

• 3+ year of SaaS based eCommerce platform (Onboarding supplier, Data Acquisition, Product Catalog, Order Management, Payment, Settlement) 

• Manage and conduct requirements gathering, stakeholder interviews and initial discover work.

• Provide fit-gap analysis of the business processes and requirements against the out of the box fitment in eCommerce platform.

• Hands on experience in both B2B & B2C business processes

• Developer business process redesign, roadmap planning and developing proof-of-concepts

We are actively hiring for Business Analyst at Brooklyn, NY.

Job Title:  Business Analyst

 

Location: Brooklyn, NY

 

Duration: 30+ Months

 

Job Description:

The Client IT Program Management Office is seeking a temporary consultant to perform business, system and workflow analysis; develop specifications, User Acceptance Test (UAT) scripts and documentation in compliance with Client standards and procedures, and assist in testing systems interfaces to deliver a new 3rd party cloud based software solution to the internal business client.


RESPONSIBILITIES






Perform analysis of business processes, business and system requirements for the configuration and implementation of a new software application that supportsthe internal client business requirements







Employ structured modeling techniques and tools to describe business functions, processes, workflows, information and technology designs







Develop and maintain PDLC (Project Development Life Cycle) artifacts and gate review documentation for program development activity in a timely and high quality manner







Update and maintain MS Project schedules on weekly basis







Document As-Is and To-Be process flows for existing and future systems




 Requirements
REQUIREMENTS:

Documents detailing: (PDLC artifact documents including:)

1.      Business Requirements documentation

4.      Test Cases, Test Plans and scripts

·         Strong inter-personal skills including ability to work with internal and external/vendor business and technical staff, at all levels of each organization.

SALESFORCE BUSINESS ANALYST BOSTON, MA 02110  The Salesforce Business Analyst will be a hands-on critical resource that will work directly on a variety of processes and systems including all aspects of product sales lifecycle. The role requires a high degree of interaction with all levels within the organization especially internal stakeholders. The candidate must possess strong interpersonal and influencing skills along with in-depth knowledge of salesforce.com.  SALESFORCE BUSINESS ANALYST RESPONSIBILITIES:

Lead Salesforce system projects through all aspects of project lifecycle; project planning, requirements definition, solution design and documentation, testing, deployment, and change management.



Identify opportunities for process and system improvements as well as opportunities to leverage existing systems to create strategic business advantage.



Provide functional specifications in coordination with systems architects and developers to design, configure and deliver high quality business solutions within SFDC.



Create all deployment required documentation; process flows, use cases, test scenarios and test scripts, job aides and training guides and conduct end user training and provide end-user technical support as needed.


SALESFORCE BUSINESS ANALYST REQUIREMENTS:

2-5 years of experience in a Salesforce Analyst or Implementation Consultant role.



Skilled in assisting business operations to articulate business requirements focused on efficient processes and tools. 



Direct hands-on experience implementing Salesforce applications with a broad scope.



Excellent verbal and written communication skills 



Experience with working with extended team to provide improved reporting and analytics information with a focus on self-service technologies.

title: Salesforce Business Analyst

details:
Business Process Business Analyst

Optomi, in partnership with an industry leader in consumer transaction technologies for their innovative solutions, services, workplace, and environment, have an immediate opening. They are looking to bring on a Business Analyst with a broad understanding of retail business operations, software technology solutions, and industry best practices. The Business Analyst’s responsibilities will be a client facing role where you will have to navigate effectively in a multi-faceted government organization with a wide and complex range of products and business challenges. You will be the liaison between assigned business units and the IT organization to support the translation of operational needs into software specifications as well as coordinate the implementation of new or enhanced software technologies.  
What The Right Professional Will Enjoy!
●  Room for rapid career progression within the first few years. 
●  Up to 50% travel to work with fortune 500 and industry leading clients across the US.
●  Have the opportunity to build relationships and work with top C-level executives in the business. 
●  Work with other professionals with the hunger to learn and develop their IT skills further.
●  Implement change in an organization that will be rolling out your policies and roadmaps globally! 

Apply Today If Your Background Includes:
●  5+ years of experience demonstrating Business Analyst skills’ including the understanding of functional analysis for specific applications within the SDLC.
●  3+ years of experience as a Project Lead and setting project cost controls.
●  Excellent listening and analytical skills, facilitation skills, organizational skills, and the ability to lead people and help them through the challenges of change within a complex environment.
●  Planning and organizational skills necessary to prioritize and coordinate workload within a multiple project setting.
●  Bachelor degree in Business Administration, Management Information Systems, Computer Science or a closely related field.



Responsibilities:
●  Works with clients and other consultants to formulate plans outlining steps required to develop the program, uses structured analysis and design. And submits to end-users for approval.
●  Conduct business needs analysis against existing technology and supporting processes to determine if area of focus is IT or business-related.
●  Assist business units in process definition and act as consultant to improve business processes.
●  Collaborate with business units, other technology areas, and vendors to identify alternative solutions and translate operational needs into IT specifications.
●  Assemble and present business requirements, functional specifications, and project statements.
●  Monitor activities of assigned projects to ensure project remains on schedule and within approved scope/budget.
●  Communicate status of each phase for assigned projects to management on a scheduled basis.
●  Execute formal change management process to adjust project scope, budget or schedule as needed.
●  Develop testing requirements and plan to validate application changes and supporting business processes.
●  Support beta testing, end-user testing and validation by business unit for new or revised applications.
●  Provide support to end-users on features and functions of applications for assigned areas.
●  Evaluate proposed changes to existing applications to identify potential adverse impact upon operations.
●  Ascertain that newly implemented/revised application and supporting processes are meeting end-user requirements and business objectives.
●  Perform modeling of business and system processes based on findings through use-case scenarios, workflow diagrams, and data models.
●  Collaborate with third-party vendors to resolve project or support issues.
●  Research/analyze current/emerging technologies/vendor services in support of business priorities and objectives.
title: Business Process Business Analyst

details:
Ref ID: 02720-0010407456Classification: Business AnalystCompensation: $80,000.00 to $85,000.00 per yearA national consumer products company located in Edison seeks a Senior Business Analyst with 4 plus years of experience in database management. The Business Analyst must have a strong background in database management and be extremely proficient in Excel. A strong background in budgeting and project analysis is also required.
