Optomi, in partnership with a Global Investment company in the Baltimore, MD area supporting over 800 billion dollars in assets is seeking, a Business Analyst that will put an emphasis on requirements gathering and bridging communications between the financial services and technology groups. 



The Business Analyst will be responsible for communicating with key system users and the other teams to translate business needs into project requirements. They will need a solid understanding of end-to-end business process, ability to learn financial services if they don’t have the experience, and utilize project tools so they can track the progress. 
 

What The Right Professional Will Enjoy! 

Be a part of an organization that is implementing Agile methodologies and SAFe implementations.
Fast growing company with the opportunity to pave your career path within the organization.

5+ years of experience as a Business Analyst or Project Manager.
5+ years of experience interpreting customer and internal business needs and translate them into requirements.
3 years of experience implementing Six Sigma Black Belt methodologies.

Uline – Shipping Supply Specialists

"The people I work with are as passionate as I am." 
"I came to Uline for a job. Instead, I found a career."

Uline is North America's leading distributor of shipping, packaging and industrial supplies. We're a family-owned company known for our incredible customer service and quality products. Our people make the difference. 

We're looking for the best and brightest to take our Internet department to the next level. If you have passion and expertise in web content, web translation or eCommerce analysis, Uline is the company for you.

details:
Genesis10 is actively seeking a Business Analyst/PeopleSoft Financials resource for a contract position opening (contract term approximately 6 months). This position is within the financial services industry for our client located in Kansas City, MO. Description: Sr. Business Analyst is responsible for working with users to define and document system requirements for new Financials Cloud implementation. Other responsibilities will include facilitating requirements gathering and design sessions, reviewing design documentation with users and developers, preparing process and data models, prioritizing system functionality based on requirements, coordinating pilot and test activities, and designing screens and reports.Responsibilities: 

 Responsible for production support of assigned system(s) to ensure efficiency in system and production. Work with developer upon failure of system and apply patches and fixes to current system(s). Work with developer and/or DBA to "tune” the system to ensure the most efficient system(s) within available resources. .Responsible for ensuring an efficient and smooth production environment for assigned system(s) by applying patches and fixes to system or working with the developer upon failure of system. Responsible for ensuring the least amount of downtime or inefficient production for assigned system(s). Use in-depth understanding of system to write reports for users and/or clients from system(s) which aid in business decision making. Develop and conduct user training on system(s) functionality. Work with internal users to understand system needs and develop plans for meeting those needs. Assist in large scope projects or lead activities in small to medium scope projects during analysis, design, construction and testing phases of projects. Facilitate in requirements and design sessions for smaller to medium scope projects and participate in the requirements and design sessions for large scope projects. Define and document functional and system specifications. Develop process flows, system flows, and data models using modeling and process tools. Prioritize system and data functionality requirements based on user needs and project constraints. Review design documentation with users and developers. Work with vendors and vendor packages to ensure that system requirements are understood. Write test plans and test cases in compliance with relevant organizational and industry standards. Creates clearly documented defect reports that enable a developer or technician to recreate the defect. May clear defect reports. Maintain and update test documentation, user guides, release notes, and help notes to ensure accuracy of applications and related documentation. Executes end-to-end functional tests and utilizes automated tests developed by others to exercise system. Collaborates to achieve end-to-end product and process quality. Information, analysis and recommendations to support the product. Understands the business needs the product is trying to meet and applies this understanding to guide testing. Applies a comprehensive understanding of the product functions and the marketplace in which it is sold effectively test assigned products.

Requirements: Five plus years as a business/requirements analyst or business systems analyst in an information technology environment. QA Testing experience. PeopleSoft Financials (GL/AP/FA/nVision) experience. Possesses a considerable understanding of current and emerging IT products, services, processes, and methodologies, along with a continuing understanding of the business function and process Ability to understand business requirements, goals, and risks, in order to formulate and define the technical scope and objectives of projects Demonstrated facilitation skills for capturing requirements Effective verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills Demonstrated decision making, analytical and problem solving skills Effective time management and organizational skills with the ability to handle multiple priorities.

details: Job Description  If you are an experienced IT Business Analyst II looking for a position with a leading company, Bartech can help! We are a leading staffing firm and our clients include some over the nation’s biggest companies. Our client has a need for an IT Business Analyst II. This is a contract position; however it is not uncommon for assignments to transition into permanent positions with our client companies. If you have the background we are looking for, and you are interested in an opportunity to get your foot in the door with leading company, we want to talk with you!     IT Business Analyst II         Job Responsibilities Your specific duties as an IT Business Analyst II will include:  As a Product Owner you will be responsible for capturing business requirements from stakeholders and converting them to IT deliverables, system enhancements, and new features. Be an active member of an Agile software development team. Be accountable for communicating the product needs with business partners and development staff and work directly with development teams to clarify requirements and approve completed work. Collaborate with stakeholders during concept development/validation of a product(s) and solutions. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, business partners and stakeholder management for a product(s). Develop and manage product backlog of MMFs, Features, Defects, and User Stories. Monitor project status and provide demos to stakeholders and prioritize project backlog based on ever changing customer/business feedback. Able to work off shift hours, for example early morning and/or late night    IT Business Analyst II Job Requirements As an IT Business Analyst II you must represent our company well by being responsible, punctual and motivated to go above and beyond the call of duty. You must also be highly detail-oriented and organized with excellent analytic and problem-solving abilities. It is also important that you display excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills.  Bachelors of Arts/Science in Information Technology, Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent experience in a related career field. 4+ years project management experience. 4+ years’ experience gathering requirements for large scale applications. 3+ years of software delivery. 3+ years of Agile software development process experience. 1+ years of experience working on agriculture related software applications. Experience with direct interaction with customers and User Experience professionals in order to develop concepts into full solutions and demonstrate a fundamental understanding of end-to-end customer experience. Experience in roles that required demonstration of negotiation, interpersonal communications, and conflict resolution skills. Demonstrated ability to work on several projects/programs simultaneously. Experience in roles that required demonstration of excellent analytical and problem solving ability. Experience working with off-shore development teams. Experience with Ag Software related processes Experience working with external customers. Experience with enterprise/global applications. Experience and demonstrated high level understanding of Amazon Web Services platform technologies.      IT Business Analyst II  As an IT Business Analyst II with Bartech, you will be working through an established and respected staffing organization with 40 years of serving as a trusted partner to our client companies. We are dedicated to providing our talent with personal, responsive attention, and will assign an employee care representative to answer any questions or concerns that you might have. Depending upon the client, the assignment and your performance, you can find potential opportunities for direct employment. Your hard work and professional dedication will be rewarded with competitive compensation, including benefits. Available benefits for IT Business Analyst II Position may include (but are not limited to):  Exceptional medical, dental, and vision 401(k) Paid time off, including holidays                                                     Make the most of your experience! Apply now!  Applicant must be eligible to work in the US for immediate opening. Keywords:  business analyst, agile, amazon web services

Will act as a liaison between the business users and technologists possessing a good understanding of both business requirements and of technology and are able to explain the business needs to the technologist and can “translate” technological terms and concepts to the business users/clients. Will be part of the workflow business requirements gathering, writing, reviewing and finalizing functional requirement with all stakeholders and participate in solution design. Work with the development team in helping them understand requirements, create test plans, analyze QA and UAT defects, tracks and manages and fully documents changes for functional and business specifications Validates test cases to ensure that scripts will evaluate the business function being performed. Gathers and interprets information from multiple sources (including databases, interviews, etc.) and makes recommendations. Provides support for application development teams including documenting business processes. Translates technical concepts to business audience and business information to a technical audience. Participates in developing estimates and implementation plans for technical solutions. Partners with team members to develop project schedules, reports and documentation. May be required to act as project lead on small to medium projects and/or provide direction to others on the team. Works with User Experience / Design resources to help visualize requirements into prototype. Understands and applies principles in risk management, issue tracking and change management. Performs other duties and responsibilities as assigned.
Financial Services experience highly preferred.Knowledge/Experience in the following: Experience in Billing and pricing, understand the Accounting and General Ledger concepts, Revenue Management. Experience with billing applications such as Oracle Revenue Management & Billing (ORMB) or Oracle’s Customer Care & Billing (CC&B) is highly preferred. Proven experience in System Configurations, Conversions, Fit/Gap analysis, documenting functional specifications are required. Has excellent writing, oral and organizational skills. Experience in using tools like TFS, PL/SQL developer etc., have some experience in writing PL/SQL queries. May occasionally work a non-standard shift including nights and/or weekends and/or have on-call responsibilities. May work in a team environment or project room to facilitate collaboration. Knowledge of risk management, issue tracking, change management and requirements gathering.

details:
Business Analyst needed in Asheville NC   The Business Analyst works with various groups to gather and examine information to make informed conclusions.  Among other duties, the business analyst acts as a facilitator within the financial institution to make internal departments more efficient by leading the project team in activities including, but not limited to, documenting business processes and requirements, verifying requirements, and developing training materials. The candidate should have sharp critical-thinking skills, be flexible, highly adaptable and an excellent team player.
Responsibilities:

Develops business case and requirements by conducting interviews and performing analysis to determine business need and requirements, and develop solutions.
Critically evaluates information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs.
Conducts thorough research to determine process inefficiencies, seeks solutions and makes recommendations to improve processes.
Understands business issues and opportunities in the context of the requirements and recommends solutions that enable the organization to achieve its goals.
Manages day-to-day operational aspect of project and scope to ensure high quality results within defined time and budget schedules.
Communicate project status, issues, changes, enhancements, and modifications through written documentation to project stakeholders in such a manner that issues and solutions may be understood.
Conducts thorough research to justify product recommendations to support purchasing efforts.
Performs other duties as requested.

Knowledge/Skills Required:

Demonstrated ability to become a quick study by grasping the essence and underlying structure of unfamiliar processes and systems.
The ability to successfully apply research methods into system issues and products.
Thorough knowledge of business analysis and project management functions and related requirements and procedures.
Above average organizational and communications skills with ability to communicate with end users with various levels of computer skills.

Physical and Mental Qualifications:

Ability to understand, and use financial institution policies and procedures to ensure operational efficiency and regulatory compliance.
Ability to communicate positively and effectively one-on-one and in small group meetings or presentations.
Ability to understand and/or convey detailed or important instructions or ideas accurately and quickly if necessary.
Ability to think and act independently within guidelines and limitations of financial institution policy and assigned personal authority.

Bachelor’s Degree

Must be bondable.

Knowledge of Fiserv technology solutions

In this role, you would report directly to the Director of Sales, and essentially be in charge of the day-to-day responsibilities of this Salesforce instance.Responsibilities include helping with the Salesforce CRM rollout and customization, as well as driving continuous improvement into the platform and helping to establish best practices to help the business grow. You will be seen as the first-in-line resource in helping utilize the Salesforce platform to drive business results. This is a high-impact, client facing role where you will be regularly tasked with delivering deep insights and recommendations to departments such as Sales, Marketing, IT Management and Services based on your strong understanding of the platformMajor Areas of Responsibility: *Be a key contributor to strategic analytical projects from the design phase through architecture, development, testing, documentation, production deployment and support *Lead training and documentation of core research & analytics functions, mentor and work collaboratively with other team members on data integrity and data acquisition *Resolve end user requests for help*Collect, analyze, interpret and summarize data in preparation for data modeling and analytical report writing *Define adoption strategies for different end user groups*Serve as liaison between business and technology teams in order to maintain and improve system efficiency *Partner with various teams to understand new capabilities in Salesforce and train the field on the most effective use of these capabilities*Design and build quality dashboards that give insight into SFDC adoption and give insight into developing enablement strategies*Design requirements for SFDC enhancements and partner with IS teams to translate those enhancements   Qualifications:*Experience with measuring and improving Sales organizations performance and productivity*2+ years of experience in Sales Analytics or Sales Operations*Einstein, Vlocity, Heroku experience preferred*Experience in training new users on the Salesforce platform and maintaining continuous training*Bachelor's Degree*5 years of Relevant CRM experience*Salesforce Certified Administrator highly recommended   The interview process for this opportunity has already begun and I promise you this role will not last long. details:
Business Analyst




Description: This Business Analyst, IT Systems and Compliance role will take direction from a Team Leader to support and enhance the quality and compliance operations posture for an IT department. Perform business analysis, compliance and computer system validation working between two company locations.

Responsibilities:

Performing, reviewing and/or approving quality and compliance work activities and documentation related to IT change management, computer system validation, periodic activities and software development.
Assist in integrating the IT department with both site manufacturing quality and global IT quality processes procedures as well as assist in continuous improvement projects for IT quality and compliance operations.
Manage projects and compliance activities as assigned.
Perform BT Quality Management activities related to qualification, GXP validation, and change-management of IT systems.
Provide technical expertise to write computer system lifecycle, validation, and decommissioning documentation in accordance with cGxP, 21 CFR Part 11, 210, and 211, and other applicable regulations and procedures.
Develop and manage project documentation for SDLC requirements during computer system implementation projects including developing user and functional requirements; technical and functional business process flows, use case, test case and test script documents; perform functionality, usability and testing during required project phases.
Perform IT system periodic activities and oversee the process for completion according to quality procedures.
Assist in performing impact assessments and work with technical SMEs to close-out IT related CAPAs and commitment tracking items.
Represent company BT in site level change control meetings and act as main point of contact for company BT core solution teams regarding change management, quality assurance and compliance management.
Work with Site Quality Organization and company BT Quality Assurance personnel staff to review, update and approve all documentation.
Act in a project lead and/or business analyst capacity for assigned projects to include performing project documentation, tracking and communicating project status and status of deliverables, risk and issue analysis and problem resolution.



Business Analyst






Business Analyst


W2 ONLY!! NO CORP TO CORP!!



Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or other science-related discipline.
BA with CSV (computer systems validation) experience.
At least 1 year of experience (ideally 3+ years) in current Good Manufacturing or Laboratory Practices, CFR 21 Part 11 regulations, Good Documentation Practices, and other applicable regulations for validated computerized systems.
At least 1 year of experience (ideally 3+ years) in writing Validation Documents (e.g. Validation Master Plans, Validation Protocols, Associated SOPs, Part 11 Risk Assessments, Verification Plans, Test Scripts).
Must have demonstrated capability in completing projects according to prescribed timelines and other requirements in previous project management or business analyst roles.
Excellent self-management, time management, and problem solving skills; must be able to multi-task / multi-project.
Be able to function in multidisciplinary teams, must possess excellent documentation, presentation, training and computer skills.


Experience w/ Aseptic Techniques, Manufacturing, GMP and FDA.


Experience with SDLC and other IT project management methodologies; Agile development is a plus.
Lean Six Sigma certification and/or experience preferred.
Familiarity with lab systems, plant manufacturing systems, Document Management Systems, CAPA processes, Learning Management Systems, highly desirable.

title: Business Analyst

details:
The IT Business Analyst is responsible for converting business requirements into technical solutions. To be effective in this role, the Business Analyst will need to be able to quickly understand business issues and data challenges within the organization. This role will be instrumental in testing efforts, systems integration, project management, communication, and reporting. This position will report primarily to the Global IT Director.

Job Responsibilities:

Act as liaison between business users, vendors and the IT team.
Develop business requirements as a result of client engagements and business issues.
Provide software usage expertise for business process supporting applications.
Recognize and identify potential areas where existing policies and procedures require change, or where new ones need to be developed. 
Review and test systems for conformance to functional and performance requirements.

This includes supporting the users of our client’s websites and the interfaces within the Ecommerce environment. The Ecommerce Business Analyst must understand and have experience working with Ecommerce, web platforms and packages. International experience preferred.  Analyze and document existing processes and operating procedures Analyze business issues and objectives and work with Business and Technology to craft a solution Participate in/facilitate small to large projects including project planning input and schedule updates Develop and/or review project methodology documentation including: business requirements, user stories, functional specifications, project benefits and costs, deployment strategies, training plans and materials, test plans, other technical and business materials Coordinate user acceptance testing with the business Develop templates and/or department standards Conduct testing Conduct training Conduct informal and formal presentations, including meeting facilitation Provide production support when necessary  Qualifications:  Experience in agile methodologies Experience writing agile user stories Experience working with ecommerce platforms like Websphere, Demandware, Hybris, etc. Experience working with content management platforms like Adobe, Drupal, Sitecore, etc. Experience working with functional ecommerce areas like checkout, product detail pages, my account, shipping, returns, customer service etc. Experience working in an Agile Environment Senior BA Experience (5 plus years) 2-3+ years of experience in design, problem solving, and implementation of Ecommerce technology and applications. This includes a solid understanding of Ecommerce and Marketing functions. MS Office tools - Excel, Powerpoint, Visio, MS Project and MS Word Experience with a Software Development Life Cycle methodology including Agile functions for Business Analysis (e.g. User Stories). Primary Responsibilities:

1)            Provide business analysis for the Transportation functional area, which may include load planning and optimization, rate maintenance, freight costs, load tendering, and transportation reporting.

2)            Design and implement business processes using best practices during a full lifecycle implementation of SAP TM; collaborate with business users and colleagues to design, develop, test, train, and implement the solution.

3)            Collaborate with GLOBE application specialists to manage business requirement documentation, submit configurations, localize business processes, develop functional/technical specifications, create or modify batch jobs, and write test scripts.

4)            Identify content and development requirements for process and system training.  Liaison with the team to update existing materials and develop new materials.

5)            Resolve hypercare issues by working with both business leaders and support personnel, including off-hours (on-call).

6)            Develop strong working relationships with business partners, management, and other IS/IT team members.  

7)            Coach other team members and assist others to meet project deadlines.

Requirements and Minimum Education Level:

•             A Bachelor’s degree is required.

•             Conceptual knowledge of information technologies and methodologies; specific knowledge of transportation processes and technology is critical.





Experience:

•             5+ years of experience with SAP R3/ECC modules and their configurations supporting transportation and/or supply chain functions.

•             1 to 3 years of experience with SAP TM including at least one full lifecycle implementation of it in a consumer goods environment.

•             SAP certification in SAP TM or/any Supply Chain Module is desired. Certification at the Professional level preferred.

Key Skills:

•             Experience with business processes related to transportation and other supply chain functions.

•             Strong analytical aptitude with a proven ability to analyze/interpret business requirements and translate them into system specifications.

•             Creative thinking skills with emphasis on developing innovative solutions to complex problems.

•             Strong troubleshooting skills.

•             Ability to learn and apply concepts quickly.

•             Familiarity with SAP BW is desired.

•             Excellent verbal and written skills, with an ability to express complex technical concepts in business terms.

•             Strong interpersonal, organizational and time-management skills.

•             Work in the St. Louis office 5 days a week.

•             Collaboration / team player.

•             Follow up / results orientation.

•             Willing to travel to support go-lives.

•             Off-hour Support during go-lives (i.e. on-call).

details:
Our client, a leading global financial services company, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 140 countries. They provide consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.Senior Business Analyst -A Senior Business Analyst with system implementation and process re-engineering experiences in the areas of financial control and/or balance sheet reporting to perform business analysis activities in support of critical planning and execution of project deliverables.Business description (group overview):The Finance Projects Group delivers automation and process re-engineering projects. These projects allow the firm to report P&L and balance sheet consistently across the globe, mitigate and better manage risks, improve financial controls, automate regulatory and management reporting, and perform transactional processing and ledger posting. In addition, these projects impact significant firm business and architecture initiatives such as security referential and pricing referential realignment, and revamp of the settlement and clearing platforms.Job Purpose:An senior analyst with experience in project management, product control and financial reporting functions. The candidate should possess system implementation and project management experience. The analyst will initially be responsible for capturing and documenting business processes, workflows, data flows, general business requirements. Activities may include communication and planning, process modeling, data analysis, business and functional requirements documentation, test specification, planning, coordination and execution.Key Responsibilities/ Day to Day Activities:- Work with senior managers, SMEs, and users to identify requirements and be responsible for Business Requirement Documents (BRD's), using use cases, workflow, screen mock-ups, and spreadsheet models.- Analyze current business and system processes for potential areas of improvement.- Perform data analysis on securities and transactions to identify the root cause and the resolution of the issues.- Coordinate with business and technology partners to get feedback and sign off's.- Complete or facilitate functional requirements process with technology partners.- Write or contribute to test scenarios and drive UAT planning and implementation.- Provide analysis and interpretation of UAT results.- Reconcile trades and positions from different sources.- Develop or contribute to cost analysis, design considerations, and implementation timelines.

Experience (years, type, nature of work, specialized knowledge and technical skills):- 4 to 7 years' experience in business analysis, financial reporting, system integration, business transformation, project management preferred.- Some knowledge of Fixed Income, Equities, Derivatives Instruments; and some knowledge in accounting and financial calculations, such as P&L, dividends, coupons, accretion.- Financial control and/or product control experience is a plus.- Be able to manage project milestones and risks.- Understand general ledger posting.- Experience in business process reengineering and software development life cycle is a plus- Experience in system analysis and writing business and functional specifications is a plus.- Strong data analysis, data mapping and reconciliation skills.Qualifications (educational background, licenses, professional knowledge) & Skills (soft skills):.- Good communications including the ability to compile and contribute to management level presentations.- Strong interpersonal, problem solving skills- Understand the tradeoffs and the limitations of technology.- Agent of change.- Be able to identify opportunities to solve business problems.- Bachelor's Degree; advanced professional qualifications are considered a plus.116774Please see our complete list of jobs at:www.rmscorp.com

Lead Business Analyst - POS (Point of Sale)Location: US-NY-New YorkSalary:  120-135K  Responsibilities:The Lead Business Analyst – works with the Director of Business Systems, Project Manager and other IT staff delivering functional business analysis, requirements-gathering and application troubleshooting support services. The Lead Business Analyst is responsible for the development of documentation for existing and proposed business processes and functional specifications, as well as the facilitation of joint application design sessions with users and IT staff. The Lead Business Analyst will participate in custom software development and integration projects by documenting requirements, creating functional specifications, documenting test plans and managing the software deployment process. The Lead Business Analyst is also responsible for troubleshooting moderately to complex system issues and communicating with all application customers who use the system supporting all venues.  Typically, the Lead Business Analyst is assigned to one or more business units of small to medium size and the project assignments are small to medium scale, moderately complex, and/or moderately to highly visible. The Lead Business Analyst will focus on key functional business areas including, point-of-sale, vending, inventory, purchasing, event and property management, ticketing and warehouse receiving

details:
UPDATED 04/23/18
... APPLY TODAY ! 

Our client has been in business for 30+ years and are the largest provider of Fleet Management Systems in North America to Municipal government. Therefore, the person filling this position will have the opportunity to work with the best team of professionals.

 

This is a unique role where you will be working closely with the company’s CEO and key Managers doing business analysis and writing business requirements for what will often be high-profile projects. Knowledge gained in the process of doing the analysis and writing business requirements will provide insight to monitor the progress of some of these high-profile projects on behalf of the CEO. You will also take a leadership role in documenting Company processes. 

Responsibilities: 

 

Technology Research & Analysis: 



You will do research that results in providing management cost analysis and specifications that advise management on purchases

Or it may involve the identification of vendors or consultants related to a Company need. 
Or the analysis may involve interviewing internal staff, Customers, or external consultants to identify and further define the scope of a project. 
You will execute the purchase and do a hand-off for implementing the product or service with key Company Staff
After you are acclimated to the Company, occasionally there will be epic enhancements you will join in the initial business scope meetings with senior managers and SMEs to record business scope (not technical). After a review process of those requirements, you will then:
Hand off the business requirements to our Development Team for them to use to create technical specifications. 
Coordinate with the Company's Copy Editor to place the business requirements into marketing materials.  
And when the enhancement is complete, you will review the in-product help as the representative of the Company’s CEO to confirm it conforms to the initial business scope. 


Documenting Company Processes and Procedures: 


Maintain and improve the Company's written processes and procedures using state of the art digital tools. 
This will place you in a facilitative role where you work with Company Managers to insure each Team's processes are documented properly.   


Projects:  This is a unique role where you will be working closely with the Company’s CEO and key Managers doing business analysis and writing business requirements for what will often be high-profile projects. Knowledge gained in the process of doing the analysis and writing business requirements will provide insight to monitor the progress of some of these high-profile projects on behalf of the CEO. You will also take a leadership role in documenting Company processes. 





Minimum Required Career Experience:

3-years' experience as a business analyst or procurement specialist or project manager or have an MBA and 2-years' experience in one of the above.

Required Technical Skills:


Strong knowledge of business technology trends.
One-year experience using a project management tool such as Microsoft Project.
Experience using Excel to create detailed vendor specs or cost-analysis documents (We request you to bring 2-samples of analysis that you have created in Excel). 
The ability to write detailed information in an organized and concise fashion. 
The ability to type rapidly to record key project scope in design meetings. 


 Required Professional Skills: 



Strong organization skills and attention to detail.
Highly capable of managing multiple projects and priorities.
High personal standards that will enable you to earn the respect of others.
Excellent listening and writing skills that enable you to interview and facilitate understanding with Company SMEs and then write concise business requirements. 
The courage to speak the truth to help others to stay focused on scope/goals and the communication skills to facilitate collective wisdom.


 Other Valuable Knowledge:



Tools that create process maps such as Visio
Microsoft SharePoint
Microsoft TFS or similar tools
Microsoft InfoPath 


 

Salary and bonus will be commensurate with experience. (Direct Hire, Permanent position)

 

Benefits:

Client offers a comprehensive benefits program including health insurance, health savings account (HSA) for qualified health care and/or dependent care expenses, life insurance, long term disability insurance, 401K defined benefit pension plan with company match, 3-weeks' vacation after the first year.  They are 100% owned by an Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP). After one-year of service you join the ESOP and will be eligible for stock allocation. The value of these benefits is approximately 15 to 20% of your annual compensation. (Salary plus bonus).

  
TO APPLY: please email your up to date resume (in a Word Document or other editable format such as a PDF) to: [Click Here to Email Your Resumé]  and include the job title (Senior Business Analyst & Requirements Writer, L025) on the subject line. If your experience and skills match the job requirements we will contact you to continue the screening/interview process.

details:
Job Description: 
• Needs to be proficient in both Agile and IT Service Management framework and process requirements. 
• Can work independently and across cross-functional teams within and outside of the program. 
• Provide support to Workstream Leads and be responsible for providing assigned deliverables. 
• - ITIL v3 certified - Foundation - Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) and/or Certified Scrum Master (CSM) certified 
• - Understands Agile process and management including understanding work from a Value Stream Mapping perspective
• - Ability to translate Agile based Themes and Epics and decompose into detailed requirements written as either user stories and/or jobs to be done (JTBDs) 
• - Clearly identify and articulate the requirement(s) which the engagement will address (problem statement) 
• - Define, document and sign off the deliverables and outputs associated with the role
• - Engage with appropriate stakeholders to elicit and validate the requirements and ensure that the proposed solutions meet the objectives 
• - Create and maintain artefacts, including but not limited to functional requirements, current state analysis, stakeholder analysis, data model documentation, test plan, test cases, user acceptance test, and process mapping. 
• - Able to work with a team and on tasks without supervision.


• Need exceptional communication and relationship building skills!  Team player.  
• These BAs will be assisting the 3 Workstream Leads that are in the 3 locations above.  They will assist where they can and will not be assigned to one lead.  
• Very Agile and collaborative environment. Need to be able to communicate verbally, written in documents, spreadsheets, charts, etc.
• Having someone that has been a part of a Service Transition/Transformation before is a huge plus! Change and/or operational management, and process transformation experience is all a huge plus.
• Need to be able to document and talk about work.  Must know how to write user stories-might even ask to write one in the interview.  
• Need someone to hit the ground running as this project has already started.  Need to take initiative, find info, identify gaps and close them.
• Jira experience is a major nice to have!!  Need to navigate and move around it-Jira admins administer it.

details:
TISTA is looking for a Business Analyst to work with the Program Manager to support our client’s objective to implement an Enterprise-wide Privacy Program.  The candidate will successfully work with a team to further the client’s Privacy Maturity Model efforts through strategic planning and privacy program implementation activities.  The candidate should have excellent research, writing and organization skills.  The preferred candidate will have knowledge of federal policies and procedures related to handling personally identifiable information (PII), protected health information (PHI) and sensitive but unclassified information (SBU).  Prior consulting experience and experience with business process re-engineering, process improvement, and organizational change is a plus.



Analyze Privacy Program requirements and risk, as well as identify gaps in compliance processes


Coordinate with stakeholders at the highest levels to document program requirements


Capture data, collect relevant documentation and participate in reporting requirements


Provide solutions to accomplish overall operational efficiency, organizational change and cultural change of Privacy Program office


Demonstrate a strong understanding of safeguarding personally identifiable information (PII) and protected health information (PHI)


Demonstrate knowledge of Maturity Models, process redesign, performance measurement and management, strategy, risk management


Support weekly, bi-weekly and quarterly reporting requirements



Provide research on privacy practices and federal privacy environments


Responsible for quality reviews


Demonstrate exceptional written, oral and analytical skills



Qualifications:


Prior experience as a consultant supporting a federal client


Ability to perform research, analysis, and risk management in a team environment


Knowledge of business process analysis and improvement


Ability to work under pressure, with time constraints and minimal oversight


Knowledge of government privacy processes and policies


Must have experience using MS Office Suite, including MS Project, MS Visio


Must have experience using SharePoint


Preferred Qualifications:


Knowledge of federal IT systems and the SA&A process preferred


Knowledge of privacy statutory authority and guidance (e.g., Privacy Act of 1974, E-Government Act of 2002, OMB Circular A-130, NIST publications and FISMA) preferred


Knowledge of data management, protecting personal information and matter related to general information disclosure preferred


Education:


Bachelor’s Degree or higher


10 years of additional relevant experience may be substituted for education


Clearance Requirements:

Required obtain a NACI level clearance

 
Location:

NW Washington, DC 


TISTA is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

title: IT Business Analyst

details:
JOB DESCRIPTIONJob PurposeThe Senior Business Analyst will collaborate with cross-functional groups (Development, QA, Product Management, and Quantitative) to elicit requirements on projects related to a fixed income related systems. The Senior Business Analyst works with stakeholders to detail enhancements within time constraints. Further, the Senior Business Analyst provides documentation and testing on projects with minimal or no supervision.Duties and Responsibilities
Elicit, analyze, communicate and validate requirements for business processes from users.
Capture and document current business workflow and recommend improvements and efficiencies. Keeps documentation organized and up to date to support and train new project team members.
Present approved requirements to Business, Development and Quality Assurance in walkthrough meetings.
Serve as a subject matter expect for development and QA for the assigned system and understanding of fixed income securities.
Production support to troubleshoot issues and answer user questions in a timely manner.
Understand the business problems and opportunities in the context of the requirements and help recommend solutions that enable the organization to achieve its goals.
Develop reports (Excel, SQL) that expedite requirement analysis or testing of large and complex projects.
Lead the UAT cycle, formulate testing strategies and assist users and developers in testing of key deliverables.
Mentor junior team members by suggesting in best practices and peer reviewing documentation.
Knowledge and ExperienceRequired:
Strong oral and written communication skills
Strong analytical skills
In depth understanding of fixed income securities and rate products.
Experience as a Business Analyst leveraging formal Business Analysis methods (particularly Use Cases) to elicit, analyze, communicate and validate requirements.
General technical background required (understanding of principals and key practices in the areas of application programming, database and system design).
Working knowledge of SQL
Working knowledge of Excel
Preferred:

details:
Job Tittle: Business Analyst
Location: Frankfort, KY
Duration: Long-term Indefinite 
Interview type: Interviews: in person 
 

Client has an immediate need for an exceptional individual to join our organization as a Business Analyst. This opportunity is based in Frankfort, KY. The ideal candidate will have strong communication skills, critical thinking skills, possesses leadership skills, and is committed to delivering successful and quality work products that completely address Business Unit requirements. The candidate must have the ability to envision impacts and possibilities of their work on the broader Client organization and apply those thoughts to improve their analysis efforts.

 
Core Responsibilities
The IT Business Analyst (BA) will assist the Project Manager (PM) in the management of the project work by facilitating communication with the business unit/customer, project team, and other stakeholders as necessary related to requirements and proposed solution for the project. The BA will elicit business requirements (features & user stories) for assigned project requests, and manage the product backlog. For each upcoming sprint, the BA will decompose the user stories to a consumable level that is understood by the developers. The BA will lead the team in the identification of acceptance criteria for the decomposed user stories. The BA will ask business stakeholders probing questions and communicate that information to the development team to ensure they understand the requested work. The BA is expected to understand the business processes and to use that knowledge to make recommendations for business process improvements as well as improve the value to the end user and the Transportation Cabinet.




 
 

   
 
Minimum Requirements 

Bachelor’s Degree with a focus in IT or equivalent combination of experience/knowledge
2-3 Years’ experience working with businesses to identify and document IT needs and facilitate solutions
Experience and comfort with business analysis, requirements definition & vetting
Knowledge of and experience with agile process
Strong analytical, design and problem solving skills
Ability to work independently/self-reliant and show initiative with minimum supervision
Ability to quickly learn new technology and apply appropriately to business situations
Strong team player who enjoys working in a fast paced team atmosphere
Ability to work under pressure; meet strict deadlines
Ability to listen effectively and seek clarification
Ability to build a rapport with clients

Excellent written and oral communication skills in English. Must be able to effectively and comfortably communicate with all types of individuals from the customer technical expert to the customer executive management


 
Best Regards,

details:
Job ID: 4355Position Description: Joseph T. Ryerson & Son, Inc., one of the largest metals distributors in the US, is currently seeking a Business Analyst to join our Analytics team in Lisle, IL. The successful candidate will play a vital role in driving the financial performance of Ryerson by contributing to the development of analytic tools used to optimize our business and supply chain operations. The Analytics team is part of the office of the Chief Data Officer and supports key decision makers throughout all functional areas and management levels of Ryerson. Our toolset includes best in breed software such as IBM Cognos, Oracle, SAP and Salesforce.com as well as the ability to leverage in-house programming resources for custom application development. Roles and Responsibilities: • Understand the content, structure and business meaning of data from various systems such as the Data Warehouse, ERP Platforms, web site or external sources. Help enable ongoing expansion of same. • Collaborate on development of analytic tools with business experts, programmers, developers and other analysts. These tools include reports, dashboards, models and ad-hoc queries used by decision makers to gain required insight into complex business circumstances utilizing software such as Cognos, Salesforce.com, SPSS, SAP, Google Analytics or Excel. • Work with data from a variety of business disciplines ranging from the local service center operations to corporate departments such as Sales, Supply Chain, Operations, Human Resources, Accounting, and Treasury. • Gather and document requirements for datasets and reports as well as business user training materials. • Aid in the data collection, testing and validation for newly created and existing data sources. • Provide tactical analytical support to meet business demands as required.Position Requirements: Skills and Abilities: • Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative major such as Supply Chain, Business Analytics, Industrial Engineering, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, or similar business area. • Strong quantitative and logical thinking skills, combined with the ability to think creatively in order to envision relationships between data, and communicate those findings to key decision makers. • Demonstrated ability to quickly learn and understand new software products and concepts, including ability to self-instruct using available texts and other resources. • Excellent organizational skills with emphasis on attention to detail, ability to organize tasks, manage multiple projects, create and maintain documentation, prioritize work and meet deadlines with minimal direct supervision. • Advanced level abilities in Microsoft Excel and Access, including knowledge of pivot tables, vlookups, and query writing to collect, transform and evaluate data to provide actionable information. • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills; ability to interact across multiple departments and levels within a medium to large size enterprise. • Experience working with business analytic software such as IBM Cognos BI / TM1 and CRM software such as Salesforce.com is a strong plus. • 1 – 5 years of experience We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

title: IT Business Analyst

details:
Alphanumeric is hiring a BUSINESS ANALYST II to work in Cary, NC.
Must be local to Cary, NC.
 
The Business Analyst II works with the product manager to analyze and understand customers’ business problems, translate them into requirements for development, and coordinate acceptance and launch of solutions that solve those problems in a compelling way.

Key Responsibilities:


Drive the Agile software development effort by acting as the voice of the customer to define and clarify user stories with the development teams through continual team collaboration, business acceptance testing, making quality decisions, and taking responsibility for the overall development team success.
Interface with stakeholders to obtain requirements.  The requirements (user stories) will include the business logic, expected behavior and user acceptance criteria.  The Business Analyst will test the user story and sign off on the business functionality completeness.
Develop new product ideas by challenging business owners and subject matter experts on their assumptions and how their proposed business requirements will successfully meet their business goals while identifying potential solutions to business problems by applying technical and non-technical analysis.
Analyze and assess data usage and product performance for maintenance prioritization and compliance with service level agreements. Provide third level support to the product support team as the product subject matter expert.
Continually prioritize work within the budget, level of effort and opportunity costs constraints by leveraging customer, product support, internal IT and other stakeholder interests.  Work can be defined as user stories, features, new products, projects or a process improvement.
No emergency releases due to incomplete or untested requirements
Provide Input into new product analysis
Complete assigned project and product enhancement work
Ensure the timely handling of customer requests and issues
Support the product manager in the daily activities and operation of product lines, projects and customer interactions.
Conduct market research and business intelligence analysis around new product lines and profitable opportunities.
Participate in root cause analyses for product performance.
Actively participate in continuous improvement processes
Successful Product Launches as determined by the customer base
Principles & Values List examples of how position displays and supports company principles & values



Key Skills/Education/Experience

Strong ability to manage multiple activities in a deadline-oriented environment; highly organized and flexible.
Confident in building customer and industry relationships
Strong research skills with an attention to detail.
Exceptional listening, verbal and written communication skills.
Strong Microsoft Office skills
Experience in analysis, basic statistical analysis; must be able to write basic SQL queries
Ability to work independently and jointly in unstructured environments in a self-directed way.
Ability to take a leadership role on projects and with customers

title: Business Analyst

category: Health Care, Information Technology, General Business
details:
Healthcare Business Analyst – Hospital System
Albuquerque, NM

Business Analyst Job Summary: 



Use data to tell stories that impact the lives of the patients and members.
Perform data research, analysis, prepare reports to communicate results, and support development of appropriate reporting/analytics solutions.
In addition to standard tools of SQL and Excel, focus on using SAS, Tableau, Business Objects, MedeAnalytics and other advanced platforms to bring our internal customers to a new paradigm of managing through data-driven tools.
Analyze and synthesize related and seemingly unrelated data into an audience appropriate story to support the business initiatives, accreditation, and regulatory compliance.
Act as a data steward and maintain the analytical foundation through business definitions and design of data marts to ensure integrity and reliability of analytics.
Serve as a liaison with internal business units and external entities to support reporting/analytics efforts.
Utilize strong technical skills, unquenchable curiosity, and a desire to engage new tools and help others.




Business Analyst Background:   



Bachelor of Science (B.S.) or Bachelor of Arts (B.A.) in Business Administration, Information Systems, Business Statistics and Analysis, or other technical field required; MBA or similar advanced degree strongly preferred.
Additional years of directly relevant experience may be considered in lieu of advanced degrees.
At least 1-6 years’ experience in data compilation, analysis and reporting, and utilizing appropriate tools, including SAS and SQL use. 
Demonstrated skills in leading a team through standard processes or projects.
Must demonstrate strong analytical skills/capabilities, communication skills (verbal and written), project management and presentation skills/capabilities. 
Strong working knowledge and/or experience with Microsoft Office products, relational databases, and other analytical tools.
Prior Business Objects and health care experience preferred.
Excellent written and oral communications is a MUST.
Requires detailed knowledge of business data analysis, utilizing computers, computer tools and/or information systems and procedures for compiling analyzing and reporting data, including interpretation of data.

You will help the Security business achieve industry-leading profitable growth by running comprehensive Planning-Strategy cycles, supporting strategic initiatives, composing market insights and directly advising business leaders with the broader Security business community. Drive day-to-day operations of Executive Sponsor program, coordinating with the both Account Teams and Security Leadership to provide support for critical pipeline deals. Support production of both Annual and Long Range plans including administration of the overall Planning framework; drive standardized core processes such as SME inputs, meeting coordination, status reporting and interlock coordination. Responsible for monitoring and reporting on these business programs including: progress against success metrics, overall program health, stakeholder satisfaction and your improvement insights. Specific role includes the following activities: 
 Executive Sponsor program: coordinate over 100 pairings of Sales Specialists with appropriate executive sponsor. Ensure productive engagement

 Coordinate the Executive Sponsorship program

 Experience running cross-functional programs 
 Skilled at validating business cases, offering constructive feedback and 1:1 coaching 
 Excellent communication and organization skills: keep stakeholders informed and on schedule 
 Skilled at using collaboration platforms to provide 'self-serve' program information

title: Business Analyst

details:
JOB DESCRIPTION
 The Business Analyst will work with business and technology members of an Agile team to define the requirements for a web application redesign in the post-trade processing space. This role involves research, business analysis, user interface design, and design specifications. The BA is a subject matter expert who bridges communication between all representatives on the team, as well as with external stakeholders.   • Actively participates with other members of the Agile delivery team (Product Manager, Technical Product Managers, Information Architects, UX Designers, Mid-Tier Dev, UI Dev, QA Analysts and other BA’s) on the web redesign of a post-trade matching and settlement application  • Works with the team to translate business workflows, data, messaging, and business rules into user interface requirements using both visual (storyboards, wireframes, etc.) and written specifications (defining detailed user flows, functionality and data mapping in messages); determines and produces just-enough documentation for the design being delivered 

Researches, analyzes, and documents user needs and behaviors as required to inform the UI design; applies detailed knowledge of design principles and user needs to ensure that user interfaces are of high quality, usable and intuitive, perform well and are consistent with other product lines • Works cross-functionally to ensure UI design guidelines and best practices are followed and the design and performance can be achieved despite the technical constraints associated with applications requiring interactions around large amounts of data • Conducts design walkthroughs, demos and functionality feedback sessions with internal and external stakeholders • Fosters a culture of dedication, teamwork, problem solving, and continuous improvement • Partners with internal stakeholders such as Integration, the Client-Facing Documentation Team and the Client Support Team on operational readiness activities by sharing subject matter expertise on features and functions and uncovering operational requirements

title: Senior Business Analyst

details:
Position Description: The Business Analyst's role participates in the planning, design, and development of engineering systems critical to core organizational products and functions. This includes interviewing stakeholders and gathering, compiling, and validating user requirements for development teams throughout the software lifecycle (storyboarding). It may also include researching and analyzing data in support of business functions, process knowledge, and systems requirements. The Business Analyst is also responsible for generating and compiling reports based on the findings, complete with probable causes and possible solutions to systems issues. Position Responsibilities:Working with product development/customers to understand product background & requirements. 
Analyzing requirements and generating use cases, activity diagrams along with detailed functional specifications document or User Stories for assigned functionality.
Working with User Experience team to develop and refine prototypes. 
Working with developers to ensure they understand all aspects of the requirements, including assisting with the logical data modeling.
Working with the QA team to ensure corresponding test cases are created and reviewed before development is completed.
Work with the product owners & project managers to assist in Agile development processes, such as verifying user stories' status per iteration, demos to product development, etc.



 Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent in technical or other appropriate field from accredited college or technical school
Major in business, computer science or related field
Project management experience
Healthcare IT project experience
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience in healthcare industry
Experience with mobile applications
EMR integration experience is a plus

title: Salesforce Business Analyst (Financial Services)

details:
Job Title  : Salesforce Business Analyst
Location  : Duluth, GA
Duration : 12 Months
 
JOB SUMMARY
The Salesforce Business Analyst provides the first level of
Salesforce support for their respective business unit. This includes working
directly with key business leaders to fully understand AGCO business processes
and how Salesforce can streamline those processes. The Salesforce Business
Analyst will gather business requirements and design solutions based on
knowledge of the AGCO environment while working closely with the Salesforce
global team to implement value added solutions.
 
JOB FUNCTION AND RESPONSIBILITIES 
• Provide Tier 1 support for Salesforce related issues
including data quality, configuration defects, training, reports &
dashboards, user management, minor enhancements, and other system related
issues.
• Oversee regional/functional change management.
• Configure Salesforce objects, workflows, approval
processes, validation rules, etc. in sandbox environment.
• Work with global team to promote to UAT environment for
testing.
• Provide final signoff once changes have passed UAT and
been promoted to stage and production environments.
• Train end-users and support the business during roll out
periods.
• Support business by identifying opportunities for process
improvement and automation.
• Gather detailed business requirements and offer
recommended solutions to Business Process Manager.
• Work with business leads to establish regional/functional
priorities and work with global support team to implement prioritized
enhancements within budget.
• Recommend and prepare documentation on best practices, business
procedures, reporting, configuration and master data maintenance that can be
handled by super users.
• Collaborate with other Salesforce Business Analysts and
identify solutions to business challenges.
• Own data quality for region/function.
• Ensure individual compliance with all AGCO policies and
procedures including Sarbanes Oxley, IT and Security. Follow established
governance processes and standards. 
 
FUNCTIONAL KNOWLEDGE
• Knowledge and demonstrated experience in supporting
opportunity and business case development, business process re-engineering,
requirements gathering, and project management.
• Detailed knowledge of the following:
o AGCO business processes
o How to link business processes to enterprise strategy
o How to create Salesforce workflows and approval processes,
design solutions, and update system configuration
o Salesforce security and sharing models
o How to manage complex data bases including database design
and data quality management
• Good working knowledge of the following:
o Day-to-day operational environment locally, regionally and
globally
o All systems being supported and their impact on the
business both regionally and globally
o The roles and responsibilities of the key stakeholders
within the region/function
• Deep expertise in one or more specialties with broad
knowledge across a wide spectrum of industry technologies.
• Previous experience with Mobile, ERP, and other large
system deployment is a plus.
 
BUSINESS EXPERTISE
• Detailed understanding of the business areas supported by
the systems is required to ensure solutions meet true business needs and
requirements.
• Minimum 3 years of AGCO commercial business experience
• Agricultural experience is a plus.
• Global company experience is a plus. 
 
Preferred Skills, Education, Experience:
• Strong communication / interpersonal skills,
capable of interacting with multiple levels of IT and business management.
• Successfully influences diverse groups and teams in a
complex, ambiguous and rapidly changing environment to deliver value-added
solutions.
• Expert in advanced writing, verbal and other presentation
skills.
• Bachelor’s degree in IT or a related field.
• Minimum 1 year of Salesforce experience.
• Salesforce Certified Administrator

Salesforce Business Analyst
title: Salesforce Business Analyst

details:
The Matworks Company, LLC operates in two divisions, flooring products and janitorial and floor care services (TEC Services).  The product division sells and installs various flooring products in big box, grocery, pharmacy and other retail chains while TEC Services provides janitorial services for retail chains and restaurants. The privately held company, headquartered in Beltsville, Maryland, was founded in 1966 and operates across the continental US, Alaska and Canada.

 
Our Opportunity

We seek a self-motivated finance professional who will be a key player in providing problem solving and analytical support to help drive the TEC Services Division’s rapid growth and diversification. This position, an individual contributor role, will be responsible for performing financial and business analysis for the Division President and his team. The individual should be a well-rounded top performer with the desire to contribute and add innovative ideas to an expanding division management team and growing customer base. Additionally, this person will be partnering with functional leaders to drive results by understanding key business drivers, developing robust budgeting and forecasting tools, modeling implications of various actions, extracting insights and recommending and driving appropriate actions. The individual must be capable of understanding the financial impacts and performance of the individual accounts and the division overall.  

Primary Duties & Responsibilities


Lead the long-term and near-term financial planning process, partnering with the division managers to develop financial and business plans to execute against company priorities
Partner with the business to support strategy and business decision-making. Work cross functionally to develop insights and understanding of variances. 
Lead the monthly business operations review with the field managers.
Oversee division P&L and provide analysis and presentation of monthly financial, sales and operational metrics; develop performance metrics and circulate with analysis on a timely basis
Establish regular interaction with business partners for monthly performance analysis, forecast updates and recommended actions to drive improvement.
Manage the equipment leasing and inventory programs
Review and negotiate with vendors of various supply categories across the county
Take ownership of the periodic forecast model and manage the annual budgeting process
Ensure all investments are measured against desired outcomes and course corrected when needed.
Provide financial/operational/sales modeling and analysis, statistical analysis, and assistance with other ad-hoc financial projects as needed
Identify and introduce external factors that influence revenues or profits
Proactively seek opportunities to improve planning, dash-boarding and reporting processes


 

 



A minimum of five years of finance experience with the majority spent in FP&A roles
BA/BS in finance; an MBA is desirable
Experience in a service industry utilizing outsourced service providers
Influential, effective at cross-functional collaboration and driving change
Problem solver that is highly analytical and data savvy (including statistical)
Exceptional presentation skills, sharing complex information that will drive action
Systems expert, advanced Excel skills, adept at forecasting, dash-boarding and reporting
Comfortable aggregating and manipulating large data sets from multiple systems to derive insightful analysis and create financial models
Demonstrated ability to roll up sleeves and collaboratively work with team
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Ability to work independently and prioritize workload

title: Communitcations/IT Business Analyst

details:
Job Title:                     Principal IT Business Analyst
Reports to:                 Senior Manager, IT 
Department:              IT
Location:                    San Diego, CA 
 
Summary:
Principal IT Business Analyst will be responsible for collaborating with the IT department and all business functions within our company.  This position will support process definition and requirements gathering to enable documentation of policies and procedures, implementation of best practices and delivery of IT solutions and systems as necessary.
Essential Functions: 
 
·         Execute new system/application implementations under the direction of the IT Leadership. Responsibilities include all phases of project management life cycle. 
·         Analyze business processes, functions and impact of change requests to determine the most effective business systems technology to meet the needs of the organization.
·         Provide guidance and consultation for continuous improvement for existing processes leveraging technology; document and present the outcome to sponsors.
·         Collaborate with business users to fully understand their requirements; conduct interviews with key project stakeholders.
·         Support data validation functions, computer system validation and UAT script execution for projects as needed.
·         Manage relationships with external vendors delivering technology systems and support.
·         Assist with fulfillment of corporate compliance requirements.  
·         Perform administration in one or more business enterprise applications as required 
·         Participate in and provide support for IT tasks and responsibilities as necessary.
·         Provide references for users by writing and maintaining user documentation and training.

Qualifications:
 
·         Bachelor degree in Information Systems or related field. Equivalent combination of education and applicable job experience may be considered.  
·         7-10 years progressively increasing responsibilities. Experience in the pharmaceutical/biotech industry, with a focus on research/clinical functions is a plus.
·         Experience managing application lifecycles and change control, ensuring all changes are controlled, tested, validated, and communicated. 
·         Experience with SaaS environments and solutions is required.
·         Knowledge of 21CFR Part 11 and Computer System and Software Validation preferred. 
·         Demonstrated ability to manage and work on multiple projects, solve problems, deliver on commitments and work with multidisciplinary teams.
·         Strong interpersonal and organizational skills and excellent verbal and written communication skills are required.   
·         Highly self-motivated and directed individual with the ability to work independently and in a team environment.

We are currently interviewing for the following contract position:  IT Business Analyst Contract Dallas, TX  POSITION PURPOSE: As a member of the IT Enterprise Portfolio Management team, the IT Business Analyst will be expected to perform all duties related to the requirements gathering process from the inception of a project through end-to-end testing, in order to capture and document business requirements while creating and maintaining traceability throughout the cycle. This position will require interaction with Business counterparts and IT technical resources.  PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES: The IT Business Analyst primary responsibility will be gathering business requirements and documenting requirements for business approval. The specific day to day job responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:  Requirements planning. Requirements elicitation. Create excellent documentation (e.g., functional requirements, non-functional requirements, user stories, etc.) that can be easily understood by highly technical outsourced or distributed teams Selecting the appropriate elicitation technique to efficiently identify critical requirements. Analyzing and refining business, functional, and operational requirements. Asking the right questions through the use of interviewing templates developed specifically for business analysis elicitation. Quickly understand technical vision and align interactions, meetings, etc., with steps to achieve future state Lead requirements gathering sessions with business leaders; facilitate stakeholder process to find common ground on business needs, process requirements, prioritization and differentiate needs versus wants, etc., throughout each session Responsible for traceability matrices to ensure that all project and program requirements are delivered through business processes and software objects. Define testing objectives and verify requirements are testable. Build strong relationships with project stakeholders and utilize these relationships to meet sponsor project and program objectives in a timely manner. Anticipate issues, think proactively, and use critical thinking skills to plan stakeholder elicitation sessions. Effectively communicate business needs, organizational changes, etc., across the team (e.g., business leaders, service line technical solution architects, etc.); ensure strong understanding from all team members Responsible for working with the IT Project Manager on communications with internal and external sources. Must be able to support multiple service line leaders and projects as allocation needs change for the organization. Interested in and able to work as an individual contributor. Experience with SAAS based applications and how to elicit requirements to meet the technology needs.   EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATIONS: The IT Business Analyst should be able to demonstrate these characteristics for employment qualification:  Bachelor Degree in IT, CS or an equivalent Bachelor s degree with relevant Information Technology experience and 3-5 years associated work experience. Strong knowledge of standard Microsoft software applications, i.e. Word, Excel, Microsoft Project, PowerPoint and Visio required. Strong technical, analytical, troubleshooting and problem-solving skills with the ability to establish effective working relationships and contribute in team environment. Effective organization and time management skills, with the ability to establish effective working relationships with all levels of executive and line management. Proven track record of working with complex system environments. Ability to understand and manipulate concepts as to design solutions that will fit high level business requirements as well as everyday limitations. Effective communicator at all levels of the organization (verbal, written and presentation). Self motivated, eager to learn and grow.
