Liberty Bank for Savings is celebrating 120 years of service to its communities! With five branch offices located on the north side of Chicago, we are currently looking for diligent, analytical, detailed and inquisitive self-starters to make an impact within the Bank. As part of the Accounting Team here at Liberty Bank, the role will entail exposure to and responsibility for accounting and financial related responsibilities, including data interpretation, reporting, trend analysis and ROI calculations. The role will also focus on learning and delving into existing software systems to help determine optimal usage.
 
Key duties and responsibilities:
·         Assists with analyzing raw data from the Bank core system and other bank software for trends, interpretation, and offering better ways to report and utilize such information.  
·         Exposure to key accounting and financial processes, including the preparation of Bank monthly financial statements, various monthly board reports, the monthly ALCO report, etc., to build management’s awareness of the performance of Liberty Bank.
·         Performs analysis and provides accurate reports on Bank’s retail and loan products and services.
·         Partakes in evaluating the effectiveness and ROI of Marketing, Retail, Lending and overall corporate initiatives.
·         Researches and provide reports on historical and forecasted financial data for the organization, including economic trends and asset management.
·         Researches peer financial activities and provide an indication of the competition’s behaviors, statistical benchmarks and expense management.
·         Upon acclimation to the Bank and it accounting and business routines and cycles, an opportunity to delve into the various software solutions utilized will be introduced, so as to uncover capabilities and functions that are not being optimized, or that can be incorporated in a more efficient and impactful manner.
·         Participation in projects and change management initiatives to improve on processes which result in improved accuracy, better compliance, meaningful cost-savings, and improvement in efficiency.

We are seeking candidates who enjoy working with numbers and data, systems and software, have a strong sense of initiative and curiosity to delve in and learn new things, and can effectively present new ideas and offer suggestions for improvement and change!

Education/Experience:
·         Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance or Business Administration.
·         1-3 years prior accounting and finance experience desired.
 
Skills/Abilities we are seeking:
~  Effective analytical and reporting capabilities.

~ Strong math aptitude and ability to think critically.
·         ~Good interpersonal skills and the ability to work both in a team and independently.
·        ~ Ability to work on multiple projects and assignments simultaneously, and managing time and resources to ensure work is completed efficiently and within established timeframes.
·        ~ High level of proficiency in Excel; strong working knowledge of Office and Adobe; ability to learn new software and systems.


Liberty Bank for Savings is an Equal Opportunity Employer (Minorities, Females, Protected Veterans and Individuals with Disabilities). Appropriate background checks will be completed.
 
A comprehensive benefits package offered for Full-time positions, including medical, dental and vision coverage, Life/STD/LTD plans, Flexible Spending Account, 401k+Profit Sharing Plan, Pension Plan, paid vacation, sick time and holidays.  For more information on Liberty Bank, visit us online at: http://www.libertybank.com.  To apply for this position, please email your resume and salary requirements to [Click Here to Email Your Resumé]
title: Business Analyst

details:
As our Business Analyst, you will perform a full range of project leadership, analytical and design functions. Through collaboration with users, you will analyze business and user requirements to define project objectives. You will create program and process/design specifications for programming staff to meet project requirements.  You will perform testing and debugging of either new or existing programs, applications and procedures. You will recommend means to increase efficiency or improve system processes. You will lead various IT projects and support the continuity of business processes through documentation; leading appropriate training for users and providing technical support and problem resolution. You will remain current in knowledge of business and information technology processes, technology trends and techniques. You should have the ability to visualize and articulate cross-platform solutions.  We are looking for a self-starter, with the ability to jump into a project with minimal direction and supervision.

Some Essential Duties are:

Upholds Andis Core Values of Excellence, Integrity and Respect in all work-related activities

Leads technology projects by consulting with users; evaluating, analyzing and prioritizing user/business requirements. Defines project objectives based on user/business requirements and develops proposals and estimates for project completion. Designs program specifications to meet user/business requirements. Tests and debugs programs based on project specifications.

Analyzes and assesses modifications to existing programs to increase efficiency or to adapt to new business requirements. Leads projects to completion. 

Trains users to effectively use new or enhanced programs and/or processes. Develops or revises user instruction manuals for various IT processes.

a full job description can be found by visiting our website: www.andis.com/careers


 
·         Bachelor’s degree is preferred, and 5+ years of related experience.

 

·         Proficient in MS Office and MS Project. 

 

·         ERP, Logistics, or Distribution/Warehouse Management System experience required.  Preference to candidates with iSeries software experience (Infor XA, JD Edwards, BPCS, etc.).

 

·         Proven track record of implementing technology solutions and an understanding of the SDLC process.

title: Business Analyst

details:
Sr. eCommerce Business Analyst
Uline – Shipping Supply Specialists

"The people I work with are as passionate as I am." 
"I came to Uline for a job. Instead, I found a career."

Uline is North America's leading distributor of shipping, packaging and industrial supplies. We're a family-owned company known for our incredible customer service and quality products. Our people make the difference. 

We're looking for the best and brightest to take our Internet department to the next level. If you have passion and expertise in web content, web translation, or eCommerce analysis, Uline is the company for you.



Uline seeks a Sr. eCommerce Business Analyst at its Corporate Headquarters in Pleasant Prairie, Wisconsin (north of Chicago, Illinois). 





SR. ECOMMERCE BUSINESS ANALYST RESPONSIBILITIES

Mentor and train business analysts on Internet procedures and best practices.
Coordinate inter-departmental resources for website projects.
Analyze and develop solutions addressing customer comments and issues.
Create website development specifications and business requirements.
Conduct analysis on website analytics and marketing metrics.
Maintain quality control of website development and changes.
Maintain and develop concepts that address website usability.
Prepare reports pertaining to website operations and support.
Assist in maintenance and development of the online procedure guide and knowledge database.







SR. ECOMMERCE BUSINESS ANALYST REQUIREMENTS 

Bachelor's degree.
5+ years experience.
Proficient in Microsoft Excel and Access.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Well organized and detail oriented with an ability to multitask.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.



SR. ECOMMERCE BUSINESS ANALYST BENEFITS


Complete insurance coverage – medical, dental, vision, life.

401(k) with company match.


Generous paid time off.


Tuition reimbursement.


3 bonus programs. 


Please visit www.uline.jobs to learn more about our job openings and benefits package.


HOW TO APPLY

Please click the “APPLY" button to submit your resume for immediate consideration! 

EEO/AA Employer/Vet/Disabled
Uline is a drug-free workplace

E-COMMERCE, INTERNET, ECOMMERCE, MOBILE, MOBILE ECOMMERCE, ECOMMERCE BUSINESS ANALYST, ECOMMERCE ANALYST, WEBSITE DEVELOPMENT, MOBILE WEBSITE DEVELOPMENT, EXCEL, ACCESS, IT, MOBILE APPLICATIONS, WEB APPLICATIONS, CHICAGO, MILWAUKEE, RACINE, KENOSHA, WAUKEGAN, LAKE COUNTY, SENIOR ECOMMERCE BUSINESS ANALYST, SR. The Business Analyst is responsible for providing decision support through financial and situational analysis. This individual is responsible for supporting various departments with solutions as well as providing analytical support to cross-functional departments across the company. This role will be supporting a small to mid-sized organization.

Supports various product categories and business functions and ensures the proper analytics and data are available for internal users.
Provides research and analytical support to internal customers including, but not limited to: financial analysis, data analysis, trend identification, as well as monitoring and summarizing the progress of products and promotions.

Performs and actively seeks to optimize pricing and product sets.

Assesses current Business Analysis processes and provides recommendations for new methods to enhance analytics for internal customers

details:
EMAIL YOUR RESUME TO [Click Here to Email Your Resumé].  If you meet ALL the requirements below you will receive a call, text and email from me.   

Senior Business Analyst - with Pharmaceutical GxP experience, prefer regulatory.  

w2 hourly Only 

3-8 years business analysis experience in a global environment setting, supporting large and complex programs. Excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills across a broad spectrum of stakeholders and senior management. Ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts. Experience with Change Management process, SDLC methodology in a GxP and regulated environment. Recent Client experience in manufacturing and or research IT programs is highly desired. • Elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, task and workflow analysis. • Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs. • Proactively communicate and collaborate with the business to analyze information needs and functional requirements and deliver artifacts as needed, such as Business Requirements Documents and Use Cases. • Experience in using enterprise-wide requirements definition and management systems and methodologies are required. • Successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously • Work independently with users to define concepts and under direction of project managers • Drive and challenge business units on their assumptions of how they will successfully execute their plans • Strong analytical skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements. • Serves as the conduit between the internal customer community and the software development team through which requirements flow. • Develop requirements specifications according to standard templates, using natural language. • Collaborate with developers and subject matter experts to establish the technical vision and analyze tradeoffs between usability and performance needs. • Be the liaison between the business units, technology teams and support teams.

details: Senior Business Analyst  Position ID:                  req11061  Sector:                         Major Appliances North America   Functional Area:           Finance  Location:                      Charlotte Office, 10200 David Taylor Dr, Charlotte, NORTH CAROLINA 28262-2373 USA  Number of Openings:     1   Employment Type:        Full-Time    POSITION DESCRIPTION:  The Senior Business Analyst has overall financial responsibility and accountability for the Ownership Solutions business units of Direct to Consumer, Consumer Engagement Center and Extended Service Agreements.  This position will serve as a credible, knowledgeable and trusted resource to the Senior Director of the business units and the SVP Ownership Solutions.   He/she is expected to actively engage with and support the Directors and extended team in execution of the business strategy and attainment of financial goals for the business unit.  The Senior Business Analyst will provide sound financial leadership through data-driven business insight, collaborative working relationships, and proven business acumen. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES  Ensure financial plans are consistent with organizational short to mid-term goals and long term strategy Communicate effectively with senior management and influence decision making Contribute effectively to team efforts Develop strong working relationships with business partners, peers, sector management, and global support staff  Monitor & Manage Day to Day Financial Activities  Apply Continuous Improvement focused approach (Plan, Do, Check, Act Cycle) Ensure quality control over financial transactions Establish and monitor metrics for assessing business unit’s performance relative to strategic objectives and goals Achieve objectives by analyzing and understanding variances and initiating corrective actions Maintain and strengthen internal controls to protect and efficiently manage assets Develop and document standard operating procedures Support cost out initiatives with analysis and recommendations Develop price strategies for products and channels and control process for execution  Management Reporting and KPIs  Provide status of financial condition and implications of ongoing business decisions by collecting, interpreting, and reporting financial data Prepare and publish accurate and timely periodic financial statements, management reports, and KPI dashboards Create special reports as needed by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends  Budget & Forecasting  Develop budgets by establishing schedules; collecting, analyzing, and consolidating financial data; recommending plans Produce monthly forecasts and weekly Risk & Opportunity updates Prepare Pro-formas and What If scenario analysis  Product Development, Project Controlling & Investment Management  Lead and ensure successful completion of all financial deliverables pertaining to product development and project controlling work streams Evaluate (ROI, Payback Period, IRR, NPV) and prioritize capital projects; allocate and manage resources Prepare Investment Requests and required follow-ups  Other  Manage and execute special projects Additional Controller responsibilities as necessary   POSITION REQUIREMENTS:   BA in Finance or related field of study required; MBA a plus 7+ years of progressive accounting/financial analysis experience required, including minimum 2 years of leadership experience Certified Public Accountant (CPA) and/or Certified Management Accountant (CMA) designation preferred Prior Financial Controller and Project Management experience a plus  REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS  Highly performance orientated, recognizing what is achievable and which factors inhibit  Innovative mindset with ability to execute strategic initiatives and drive performance Exceptional technical and analytical skills with ability to translate data from multiple sources into meaningful information and business insight Ability to manage competing priorities, work under pressure and meet deadlines in a fast paced financial environment  Demonstrated excellence in communication and interpersonal skills for negotiating, presenting, and resolving complex issues  Strong executive presence and a positive cultural leader, champion, and motivator Outstanding expertise and leadership across all aspects of the finance function.  Strong business acumen with the ability, drive and curiosity to quickly and fully understand the Accessories & D2C business Demonstrated process improvement experience and work ethic Impeccable financial and commercial judgment, able to navigate in the Company’s competitive marketplace, make/contribute to timely decisions A well-developed strategic perspective on business decisions and able to maintain a big picture view while also paying attention to detail  Provide insightful analysis, perspectives, and constructive challenge to enable informed decision-making and proactively drive performance  Assesses and manages risk  PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS   Highest ethical standards, impeccable character, integrity and seasoned judgment   Visible passion for the business and capability to motivate and have a broad sphere of influence on the overall business  A hardworking, high-energy individual with a significant amount of stamina and drive  A hands-on leader, who can roll-up his/her sleeves and get involved in running the business in a dynamic manner Respects company culture  REQUIRED LANGUAGES: English  COMPANY DESCRIPTION Electrolux is a global leader in home appliances and appliances for professional use, based on deep consumer insight. We offer thoughtfully designed, innovative and sustainable solutions, developed in close collaboration with professional users. The products include refrigerators, ovens, cookers, hobs, dishwashers, washing machines, vacuum cleaners, air conditioners and small domestic appliances.  Under esteemed brands including Electrolux, AEG, Zanussi, Frigidaire and Electrolux Grand Cuisine, the Group sells more than 60 million products to customers in more than 150 markets every year. In 2015 Electrolux had sales of $14.7 billion ($5.1 billion in North America) and 58,000 employees.  Electrolux has been doing business since 1919. The headquarters are located in Stockholm, Sweden, and the Electrolux share ELUXb is listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm.

details:
As a trusted partner to our client, Corus360 is looking for a Business Analyst (with BI and ERP experience) for a long term contract role in Little Ferry, NJ (near Teterboro). This person will be working with a group further data collection and analysis practices and will be responsible for instituting new policies, procedures and programs in conjunction with the MIS department. This position requires the coordination with multiple departments within the Customer Service organization to put collected data to practical use, with the end goal of maximizing profits and increasing efficiency.  Qualifications Needed 
Minimum of five (5) years of experience as a Business Analyst
BI and SQL and ETL experience
Experience with Agile methodology and creating and gathering requirements
Strong customer service skills to collaborate in defining needs, addressing issues and answering questions.
Strong prioritization and organizational skills, including the ability to maintain several concurrent projects while providing realistic delivery dates and managing customer expectations through complete life cycle of the project.
Prior experience with ERP systems
Bachelors in Business, Business Intelligence or related field required
title: Business Analyst (BI and ERP)

details: Alluvion Staffing is searching a Business Analyst for one of their global financial clients located in the St. Petersburg Area. This is a great opportunity within a major investment firm.  Job Summary: Primary area of work - Cash and Money Management.  Requires advanced brokerage and/or banking experience.  Under general supervision, uses specialized knowledge and skills obtained through education, experience and/or, specialized training to serve as a liaison between the business community and the IT organization in order to provide solutions to meet user needs. Provides business analysis support for moderately complex applications, including analyzing and documenting business processes and translating user requirements to software development teams. May train or lead the work of others. Leads projects of moderate scope and complexity or serves as a technical advisor to project teams. Guidance is provided to perform varied work that is frequently difficult in character requiring some evaluation, originality and ingenuity to make moderately complex decisions. Resolves or recommends solutions to moderately complex problems. Extensive contact with internal customers is required to identify, research, and resolve problems. Essential Duties and Responsibilities: • Adheres to established standards and maintains currency in business analysis practices, procedures and techniques. • Consults with users to identify, analyze, refine and document business requirements. • Coordinates project scheduling with appropriate entities. • Develops and maintains project schedules and produces project reports and documentation. • Develops conceptual design documents, including project definition, alternative solutions, scope of work, functional specifications, and logical skeletons for new systems. • Follows up with internal clients about completed tasks to ensure client satisfaction. • Identifies requirements for testing, develops test plans and scripts and coordinates test transmissions, as required. Tests software. • May determine appropriate actions in emergency situations to ensure data is secure and available for use as soon as possible. • May prepare project proposals and project plans. • Provides training and may lead the work of others, as required. • Reviews operational procedures and methods; maps current business processes; defines and analyzes business activities; identifies best practices; and recommends improvements. • Serves as a liaison between end users and software development teams, including functioning as a subject matter expert (SME) in translating requirements to software development teams. • Maintain currency in analyst skills. • Performs other duties and responsibilities as assigned. Skills: Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities: Knowledge of: • Functional, operational and technical requirements of assigned project(s). • Concepts of risk management, issue tracking, change management and requirements gathering. • Concepts, practices and procedures analyzing business processes. • Investment concepts, practices and procedures used in the securities industry. • The use of technology in business. • The relationship between IT and business. • Core business competencies such as finance, management, accounting, operations, and marketing. • More detailed awareness of the business context of a technical solution, including specific business goals associated with the project, how the project will meet the goals, and their own part in advancing the goals. • General financial industry knowledge and knowledge of supported business area. Skill in: • Business Analysis tools: Microsoft Office suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook), Software Engineering Methodology (SEM) process, Change Management, Project Management tools (MS Project), basic database query language usage, time tracking tools, Use Case / UML, advanced quality assurance (QA) tool usage for test case development, execution, and defect tracking/issue tracking software. • Creating and interpreting process maps and flowcharts. • Preparing various reports, summaries, surveys and written recommendations. • Developing and maintaining project plans. • Developing conceptual design documents, including devising logical skeletons for new systems. • Conducting usability testing of software applications. • Operating standard office equipment and using required software applications Ability to: • Ask pointed questions to verify clear understanding of client issues. • Analyze a business function and derive a set of requirements to satisfy a general request. • Take ownership of an aspect or task on a project with little to no assistance. • Actively communicate technical and business aspects of work efforts to team members. • Mentor other analysts when necessary. • Champion a non-technical project improvement effort. • Lead requirements gathering sessions. • Provide a high level of customer service. • Establish and maintain effective working relationships with others. • Exhibit a positive attitude when dealing with others. • Follow all internal procedures for handling customer requests. • Communicate timely and through proper channels to keep customer and upper management informed of the progress of an issue. • Take personal ownership of issues, following through to issue resolution. • Attend to detail. • Analyze and solve logic problems. • In emergency situations, determine appropriate actions to protect critical systems and data. • Meet all deadlines created by management or clearly communicate to management the reasons the deadlines are not possible. • Effectively organize and prioritize all tasks and responsibilities. • Participate in team projects and activities. • Demonstrate flexibility in accepting and adapting to change. • Clear, concise, grammatically correct oral and written communications, including SEM documentation. • Demonstrate appropriate frequency and level of detail in communications. • Escalate unresolved issues to others. Education: Minimum BA or BS in Computer Science, Business or comparable, 7+ years experience.

title: Business Analyst III

details:
Business Analyst / Pricing Analyst
 
Wurth USA is a world leader servicing the transportation and maintenance industry with solutions in fasteners, chemicals, tools and inventory management.  We are part of the Wurth Group of companies with over 72,000 employees worldwide and 13 billion in yearly sales.  With Wurth USA, you will find a family oriented, stable company that can provide a career, not a job. 

The Business Analyst within the pricing team is a strategic thinker who provides pricing management expertise through advanced analytics. This role, reporting to the pricing manager, works directly with sales and sales management to provide competitive pricing for our customers while maximizing sales and profit. 
Job Description:
●  Create reports to track the effectiveness of general price performance and recommend alternative methodologies that maximize gross margin and market share
●  Create and/or update monthly reports for Executive Management while meeting tight deadlines
●  Monitor special price offers by sales management and provide exception reporting to management
●  Work with sales management to minimize unnecessary price concessions
●  Educate the sales force and sales management on pricing policies and pricing systems that lead to higher gross profit while supporting the company’s value proposition to its customers.
●  Create Excel & PDF price lists

Requirements:
●  Bachelor Degree in business, finance, accounting or a related function is required
●  Minimum of 2 years’ experience using Excel and/or Access to do complex analysis and reporting with large data sets
●  Advanced Excel or Access is a minimum requirement ; Advanced Access skills preferred
●  ERP software knowledge; SAP preferred
●  Strong analytical and organizational skill with attention to detail
●  Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously in a fast-paced environment
●  Ability to communicate will all levels of individuals within an organization

Wurth USA offers a competitive salary plus an outstanding benefits package including medical, dental, vision, 401k
 
 In order to be considered for the position, please complete an online application through the WURTH USA Career Center by clicking on the orange "Apply" button.  
 
Our Vision: Quality, Innovation and People provide extraordinary value that drives our customers’ business forward by understanding their needs and developing solutions together.
 
Wurth USA is an Equal Opportunity Employer
 






●  Bachelor Degree in business, finance, accounting or a related function is required
●  Minimum of 2 years’ experience using Excel and/or Access to do complex analysis and reporting with large data sets
●  Advanced Excel skills are required; Advanced Access skills preferred
●  ERP software knowledge; SAP preferred
●  Strong analytical and organizational skill with attention to detail
●  Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously in a fast-paced environment
●  Ability to communicate will all levels of individuals within an organization

title: Business Analyst

details: Description: This position will play a key role in ensuring projects (change initiatives) meet objectives on time and on budget by increasing employee adoption and usage. This person will focus on the people side of change, including changes to business processes, systems and technology, job roles and organization structures (in collaboration with Human Resources). The position will support project teams in writing and owning change management activities into their project plans and sizing the effort for the Change function (project by project) to rightsize Resourcing requirements to deliver Change activities. The primary responsibility will be creating and implementing change management strategies and plans that maximize employee adoption and usage and minimize resistance. This position will work to drive faster adoption, higher ultimate utilization of and proficiency with the changes that impact employees. These improvements will increase benefit realization, value creation, ROI and the achievement of results and outcomes. In addition, we look for this role to help us better market what we do in Information Technology, and Research Technologies, to help inform/educate impacted stakeholders throughout the organization as to the critical role we play.   This person needs to have the ability to work independently (HANDS-ON role) and will have to work through others in the organization to succeed. The person will advise senior leaders in helping them fulfill the role of change sponsor. This person will also help create an IT change agent network with influential stakeholders to help enhance communications and awareness of initiatives throughout the organization.   Roles and responsibilities of the Change Management Analyst include writing and owning/managing plans and all associated deliverables whether emails, articles, presentations, tip sheets, training classes (in person/online/videos), etc:   This position will:  Apply a structured methodology and lead change management activities  Apply a change management process and tools to create a strategy to support adoption of the changes required by a project or initiative.   Support communication efforts  Support the design, development, delivery and management of communications.   Assess the change impact  Conduct impact analyses, assess change readiness and identify key stakeholders.   Assess the impact to Service Delivery (support model)  Conduct impact analyses, assess change readiness, identify skills gap, changing roles/headcount requirements.   Support training efforts  Provide input, document requirements and support the design and delivery of training programs.   Additional responsibilities may include:  Complete change management assessments  Identify, analyze and prepare risk mitigation tactics  Identify and manage anticipated resistance  Consult and coach project teams  Create actionable deliverables for the five change management levers: communications plan, sponsor roadmap, coaching plan, training plan, resistance management plan  Support and engage senior leaders  Coach managers and supervisors  Support organizational design and definition of roles and responsibilities  Coordinate efforts with other specialists  Integrate change management activities into project plan  Evaluate and ensure user readiness  Manage stakeholders  Track and report issues  Define and measure success metrics and monitor change progress  Support change management at the organizational level  Manage the change portfolio    Skills and qualifications:  A solid understanding of how people go through a change and the change process  Experience creating new service delivery models  Experience creating new support models  Experience marketing a department and it’s services to an organization to improve perception and value created  Experience and knowledge of change management principles, methodologies and tools  Exceptional communication skills, both written, quality of presentations and verbal  Excellent active listening skills  Ability to clearly articulate messages to a variety of audiences  Ability to establish and maintain strong relationships  Ability to influence others and move toward a common vision or goal  Flexible and adaptable; able to work in ambiguous situations  Resilient and tenacious with a propensity to persevere  Forward looking with a holistic approach  Organized with a natural inclination for planning strategy and tactics  Problem solving and root cause identification skills  Able to work effectively at all levels in an organization  Must be a team player and able to work collaboratively with and through others  Acute business acumen and understanding of organizational issues and challenges  Familiarity with project management approaches, tools and phases of the project lifecycle  Experience with large-scale organizational change efforts  Change management certification or designation desired

title: Business Analyst

details:
A global, medical device manufacturer in Irvine, is seeking for a Sr. Business Analyst (BA). The Business Analyst is primarily responsible for requirements elicitation, management and analysis, system implementation, driving adoption, supporting and enhancing small to medium size Windchill projects and associated business processes across the organization globally. The BA should have prior Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) experience and expertise on industry best practices, processes, and system improvements. This is a W-2 contract.Essential Job Functions: - Lead or manage small to medium size CAD/Windchill projects/enhancement releases - includes deliverables developing and managing project plan, managing project scope, communication and change leadership (communicate effectively across multiple constituencies to support project deliverables, schedule, timeline etc.) - Leads efforts to reengineer and optimize business processes and systems by assessing business needs and developing, proposing and implementing technology solution options. Act as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) in business processes in responsibility. - Configures and tests systems to execute features, integration, and reporting. - Serves as liaison between business process owners in Business Units, Functional Groups, Regions and IT. Enable super-users (by training and performing knowledge transfer) to leverage IT systems for business process automation and optimization - Develop global best practices and data management strategies and manage implementation - Work as an integral partner with the IGNITE/Teamcenter team and lead CAD-PLM integration, product data management and business/operation process improvement projects - Develop policies and procedures to improve data quality throughout the lifecycle of the data. Define and implement processes for resolving non-compliance to standards - Provide management reportingWe are an equal opportunity employer and make hiring decisions based on merit. Recruitment, hiring, training, and job assignments are made without regard to race, color, national origin, age, ancestry, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, disability, or any other protected classification. We consider all qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, in a manner consistent with state and local laws, including the City of Los Angeles' Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance.

Minimum 6 years of experience in a Business Analyst role interfacing with multiple functional groups and stakeholders; experience working in an FDA preferredBachelor's degree in science required. Master's degree in computer science or related field is a plusKnowledge of CAD software, tools (Creo and Solidworks) and PLM platforms (Windchill and Teamcenter)Windchill Project Link knowledgeStrong project management and organizational change management skillsSolid voice of customer (VOC) and other requirement gathering skillFamiliar with: Related ISO standards, design control, and regulatory agency requirementsExperience in medical device design, documentation, regulation, validation, manufacture, business processes and technical systems is a plusStrong oral and written communications skills, ability to develop and maintain business/technical documentation, and strong organizational, interpersonal, and analytical skills requiredAbility to interface with internal and external customers, project teams, and all levels of managementSmall and large group discussion facilitation across a wide variety of audiencesAble to work effectively with remote team membersSelf-motivated, flexible and adaptable to changing business needs and prioritiesDemonstrates creativity to develop and implement innovative, out of the box solutions and changes, rather than just incremental improvements

title: Business Analyst - DIRECT HIRE

details:
Location: Dallas, TX/ Teterboro, NJ/ Miami, FL
Duration: 1 year

Description:
Responsible for analysis and evaluation of user business problems and development of system recommendations to meet requirements. Translates high-level business requirements into functional specifications for business application development. Interviews end users to obtain and document the detailed business requirements for projects. Assists in the business process redesign and documentation as needed for new technology. Combines understanding of IT and business processes to recommend solutions. details:

details:
Business AnalystDuration: 8+ monthsLocation: Augusta, ME (onsite only, no remote options)Position Requirements:The Business Analyst is responsible for the set of tasks and techniques used to work as a liaison among stakeholders in order to understand the structure, policies, and operations of an organization, and to recommend solutions that enable the organization to achieve its goals.Preferred Education: 4 year college degree or equivalent and IIBA Certified Business Analyst Professional (CBAP) designationKey job responsibilities: Interviewing users for requirement gathering to achieve a smooth transition from legacy to new Database source to target mapping, including recommendations for resolving gaps Report analysis Developing business/data requirements for technical team to build an ETL and data access solution
Role Description/requirements:  Ability to understand both business operations and information technology  Ability to analyze the current implementation and capture requirements from that implementation  Ability to work with product, business and application teams to define and write technical user stories and associated outcomes ensuring business rules, business outcomes etc. are accurately represented  Ability to deliver completed and polished workflows to technical teams and executive management  Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills  Strong SQL skills to analyze existing data, identify gaps/data quality issues, and identify entity relationships  Solid working knowledge of Business Intelligence concepts (e.g. reporting, querying software, OLAP, spreadsheets, dashboards, relational databases, warehouses, and data mining)  Experience working in large, complex data environments  Experience working on multiple large and medium scale software projects in the BA role  Experience conducting Facilitated Workshops for requirements analysis.  Experience creating workflows using formal notation such as the Business Process Modeling Notation (BPMN).  Knowledge of formal requirements gathering methodologies.  Experience developing Business Requirements - project initiation document, what the needed achievements will be, and the quality measures.  Experience developing Functional requirements - describe what the system, process, or product/service must do in order to fulfill the business requirements.  Experience developing User (stakeholder) requirements - are a very important part of the deliverables, the needs of the stakeholders will have to be correctly interpreted. This deliverable can also reflect how the product will be designed, developed, and define how test cases must be formulated.  Experience developing Quality-of-service (non-functional) requirements - are requirements that do not perform a specific function for the business requirement but are needed to support the functionality. For example: performance, scalability, quality of service (QoS), security and usability.  Experience developing Report Specifications - define the purpose of a report, its justification, attributes and columns, owners and runtime parameters.  Experience developing Requirements Traceability Matrix - a cross matrix for recording the requirements through each stage of the requirements gathering process.  Strong organization and writing skills. Experienced developing graphic representations of complex business processes.

title: Sr. Business Analyst

details:
Excellent opportunity for a Lead Business Analyst in Coppell.  This is is a local office that has the feel of a start up and the backing and stability of a Fortune 1000. They also have one of the best benefit plans in the city. You will play a key role in the creation, management, evaluation, and interpretation of business and technical requirements.   This includes but is not limited to evaluation of design specifications and translation of business needs to technical solutions throughout the product life-cycle.   You must be proficient in all things related to gathering requirements, feature tracking, and change management activities across business IT and supplier teams.    
RESPONSIBILITIES

Maintain currency in business analysis practices, procedures, and techniques
Follow up with internal clients about completed tasks to ensure client satisfaction
Identify requirements for testing, develop test plans and script, and coordinate test transmissions as required
Define and document business needs and objectives, current operational procedures, problems, input and output requirements, and levels of systems access
Elicit requirements using interviews, data analysis, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, and workflow analysis 
Decompose high-level business requirements into an appropriate level of business rules and detailed user, functional, and non-functional requirements using alternative views such as flows, diagrams, models, and use cases when applicable
Create Babok training including process, timeline, and standardized templates
Conduct training sessions for Babok
Perform Ad-Hoc reporting and report support as necessary  
Lead the identification and documentation of business metrics  
Work with development and business personnel to develop and execute plans to test and validate systems/applications and business requirements - including developing user documentation, first draft of training materials, manual updates, and field communications 
Manage project documentation deliverables 
Assist in identifying data quality problems and determine remediation steps
Create customized reports based on data provided by various teams via emails, phone calls, meetings and updates within change management system
Act as a liaison between departmental end-users, in the analysis, design, configuration, testing and maintenance of case management systems to ensure optimal operational performance
Develop requirements for new systems and enhancements to existing systems to ensure the system design fits the needs of the users
Identify opportunities for improving business processes through information systems and/or non-system driver changes
Read and interpret case management systems and functional technical literature and translate in terms understandable to the end-users
Research and prepare statistical reports using data 
Consolidate information into cohesive and understandable correspondence or other written form for use in management decision-making
Assist in developing an overall change management strategy 
Conduct change impact analysis to assess the potential implications of changes and documents business rules, functions and requirements
Participate in user acceptance testing and testing of new system functionality
Direct or participate in studies of new and existing programs and special projects to determine feasibility, resolve problems including organizational, procedural, technical and fiscal research and analysis


QUALIFICATIONS

8+ years of experience with requirements management or change management systems
8+ years Business Requirements writing experience
1+ years of experience with various software development methodologies
Documentation skills including non-functional, functional, business rules, and business processes are required as well as solid verbal communications
Expert knowledge of the Software Development Life-Cycle (SDLC) and/or Product Development Life-Cycle (PDLC)
Experience or background in business analysis, requirements definition, building systems solutions, and deployment of business requirements
Visual Basic, SQL experience, general programming
Strong knowledge of Visio and MS project
Good organizational skills; able to assemble and present information clearly
Customer service focus
Ability to understand, configure, and manage complex technology solutions
General understanding of Windows, MS Office, Outlook
General understanding of data flows

details:
CU Medicine is dedicated to providing healthcare and administrative support to the University Of Colorado School Of Medicine’s nearly 3,000 providers. We are seeking a highly motivated Sr. IT Business Analyst to join our Information Systems team.

The Sr. IT Business Analyst will be expected to understand requirements of the business in terms of the need for new or updated processes, and/or solutions and subsequently document those requirements in business terms. The individual in this role will communicate the current and potential functional capabilities of IT solutions and services. The Business Analyst must ensure the business is ready for any changes introduced by new solutions, and oversee the process of confirming business requirements are met prior to release of new solutions into production.

Areas of responsibility include but are not limited to:

Business Requirements and Solution Design

Develop clear understanding of business processes inclusive of how work and data flows through the organization.
Facilitate information gathering sessions with business stakeholders to understand current and desired business capabilities.
Document as-is and to-be business processes, and associated business requirements for new capabilities while identifying cross-unit impacts.
Log, classify, categorize, rationalize, and submit new demands. Consolidate/cancel duplicate demands and disqualify demands by communicating existing service availability, as needed.
Assess relevance/alignment of demands against business objectives, compliance, and technology requirements, as well as current and future organizational structure.
Prioritize and rank demands from stakeholders’ perspective.
Develop/document solution requirements and design
Develop and/or assist with development RFIs/RFPs and project charters.

Organizational Change Management

Coordinate business readiness planning and execution of required business readiness activities. Ensure business/technical impacts are understood and accounted for.
Develop and execute communication plans.

Quality Assurance

Develop and publish testing and quality assurance standards and guidelines.
Ensure delivered solutions meet stakeholder requirements/quality standards and have no negative impact to operations and/or unintended consequences.
Coordinate system testing of business/user functionality prior to UAT.

Other duties as assigned







This position requires a Certified Business Analyst Professional (CBAP) certification and 6+ years’ experience in business process analysis, process design, requirement definition, communication (both written and verbal), facilitation and organization competencies. Bachelor’s degree is strongly preferred. Education and/or experience in Information Technology and/or the Healthcare industry a plus. Expertise in Microsoft (MS) Office Suite required. Experience with MS Visio, Project, PowerPoint or other computer software applications a plus. Must have good planning, organizational and time management skills. Must be flexible with the ability to work independently in a high-stress environment. The ability to take direction and handle multiple, simultaneous assignments is essential to success. Must be accurate and detail oriented. The ideal candidate will demonstrate excellent verbal and written communication skills and a courteous, professional businesslike manner.

HIPAA Protected Health Information Access
This position requires contact with protected health information during the course of performing job responsibilities.

TO APPLY FOR THIS POSITION, please visit our website at www.cumedicine.us and reference job #191. All applications MUST be submitted via our website. 

CU Medicine is dedicated to ensuring a safe and secure environment for our staff and visitors. To assist in achieving that goal, we conduct background investigations for all prospective employees prior to their employment. We are an equal opportunity employer.

CU Medicine supports a Tobacco Free Workplace Environment which prohibits smoking and the use of tobacco products on CU Medicine property, Anschutz Medical Campus and adjacent business locations.

details:
Business Analyst- Construction Company/ Construction Systems Duration: 6 + month contractLocation: Downtown Boston MA GENERAL STATEMENT OF DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESThe Sr. business systems analyst collects and analyzes business and nonfunctional requirements and creates specifications. He or she validates requirements against business needs. He/she performs systems testing to validate high-level functionality of the solutions. It is important for the Sr. business analyst to build subject matter expertise in customer's field and develops productive relationships with customers, as well as using knowledge of the organization's security standards to adhere to all security standards and directives.DETAILED STATEMENT OF DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Solicits and identifies vision objectives and requirements for change With the support of the business, define rules, validations, decision points for all the steps in a process Analyzes business and financial data and how the values relate to the business process Identifies gaps during the business requirements phase Establishes new requirements and functional specifications, screen mock-ups, , error messages, rules, and security requirements Develops User Stories, Use Cases, UML diagrams - "Happy Path” and "Alternative Path”  Defines report specifications Documents detailed business and nonfunctional requirements in a traceable, testable, verifiable format, including business requirements documentation, functional specifications, workflows, use cases, business rules, process flows, data flows, test cases, and training materials. Document business requirements and functional specifications in a clear, concise manner. Develop and execute system test plans Articulate impact of change to other Departments Alert Project Manager of scope creep that may impact the project  Identifies work breakdown structures for required tasks to reach milestones: e.g., problem analysis; requirements definition; business case formulation; project scoping and definition and finally translating all that into a set of solution options and sound technical requirements. Conducts requirements gathering by leveraging meetings, such as interviews, requirements workshops, use cases, and scenarios. Provides recommendations and specifications to refine business processes, as needed, to achieve a positive impact. Supports Development test strategy definition, test requirements definition, development of test scenarios, and execution of functional test phases. Contributes to Continuous Improvement initiatives across the enterprise. Participates in the definition of data analysis requirements and data storage Applies expertise and understanding of data warehouse, data mart policies to the results of the data collected  Assists in defining the scope, time frame and display/ format of the data analytics Participates in defining the executive data metrics and dashboard reporting requirements Perform due diligence & quality assurance on services being provided by the Security team to ensure adherence to process and consistency of output for operational standards using the IT Security checklist to ensure security controls are used. Assumes team lead role as required on projects or in support of a business unit. Create and execute system test plans. Work within an agile scrum and/or waterfall methodology for project implementations.
QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED AT TIME OF HIRE BA/BS degree in Business, Computer Science, or related field. Eight or more years of direct work experience as a Business Systems Analyst. Strong analytical skills Strong listening skills Strong communication skills Ability to easily work with all people regardless of role/title Ability to think and question people across the organization to minimize requirement gaps Ability to help bring people together to a common understanding and agreement Ability to accept constructive criticism Ability to work in an agile-like environment Technical background  Subject matter or domain experience working in related industries (Construction Systems) is a plus. Understanding of data analytics for construction projects Dashboard creation Experience with asset management, inspection, or other data collection and inspection systems is a plus Demonstrated track record of success with IT projects that meet business requirements and customer expectations. Experience with business process modeling. Experience with prototyping and Business Process Modeling tools is a plus. Experience with packaged product solutions as well as custom built. Proficient at problem identification and resolution, and defining and managing business requirements. Experience in producing various work products throughout the analysis and design phases of a project. Ability and motivation to learn. Ability to define, manage, and exceed business customer expectations. Strong intellectual curiosity and capacity for professional growth. title: Business Analyst

details:
SUMMARY
The Business Analyst serves as a key account Management/Client interface for a 7X24 production print, fulfillment and automated mail facility.  This position is also responsible for developing, and managing, activities associated with, analytical reports, ad hoc reports, process documentation and report requests from Management, and the Client.  
 
ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS  
Essential job functions include, but are not limited to the following:
·         Generate internal, and Client, management reporting deliverables, illustrating statistical data, text and graphics. 
·         From multiple data sources, complete analysis and identify anomalies within reporting on SLAs, performance, productivity and cost metrics. 
·         Serve in account/management liaison role between internal production, technical staff and Client representatives to ensure business reporting requirements, and expectations are achieved.
·         In conjunction with production teams and client, develop and validate, process documentation relating to key production activities.
·         Produce documentation, including analytical reports, decision backup, information research reports, budget analyses, training plans, business justifications, and graphics.  
·         Plan, organize, document, coordinate and schedule assigned work within task plans by partnering with production staff and other analysts on the team.
·         Partner with Client and internal production teams, to facilitate implementation of new or improved reporting processes.
·         Produce Management reports related to performance metrics/KPIs for the organization’s production activities.
·         Execute daily, weekly and monthly SLA reports for the business to report on.
 


EXPERIENCE AND SPECIAL SKILL REQUIREMENTS
 Education Requirement
·         College diploma or university degree and/or equivalent work experience.
 
Experience Requirements
§  Minimum of 3-5 years related experience in business and/or systems analysis
 
Special Skill Requirements
·         Demonstrated ability to prioritize and manage multiple responsibilities and deadlines.
·         Proven data analysis, data verification, and problem-solving abilities.
·         Thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs into application and operational requirements.
·         Knowledge of process improvement, workflow, benchmarking and evaluation processes.
·         Excellent organizational and business analysis skills; process analysis and documentation skills also required.
·         Strong knowledge and skills in Microsoft Office Suite:  Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access
·         Excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills.
·         Ability to design, develop and manage Access databases a plus.  
·         Previous experience with process/quality/continuous improvement programs (Six Sigma, LEAN or institutional quality programs) a plus.
Experienced with Inventory Management Software (i.e. SAP, Midnight, etc. capabilities or related experience

title: Business Analyst

details:
Translate client business requirements and user stories into functional requirements and technology solutions in support of the strategy. Assesses related impacts and alternative approaches.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities (include but not limited to)


To fulfill this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily:

Work with sponsors, customers, Information Services staff and other stakeholders to define requirements and user stories
Work with subject matter experts (SMEs) to determine functional requirements, technical solutions, alternative approaches and related impacts
Research and recommend technical solutions to business problems according to the defined requirements and user stories
Identify and advance solutions that support the established and a desired future enterprise architecture
Effectively communicate current state and potential future state scenarios to sponsors, customers, Information Services staff and stakeholders
Lead customer interviews and business analysis sessions
Support project management activities with the necessary documentation to initiate and execute successful projects
Conduct research on software and hardware products and services to justify recommendations and to support purchasing efforts
May be assigned to a project team for execution on a project
Create system design proposals
Create models, specifications, diagrams, and charts to provide direction to developers
Other duties as assigned.





Qualifications (Knowledge, Skills, Abilities, and Requirements)

The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required: Able to contribute to community life, requiring stable and healthy interpersonal skills

Technical skill sets:

business analysis
root cause analysis
system design; technical and project documentation; task management; Ability to assess and solve complex problems
Ability to create systematic and consistent requirements specifications in both technical and user-friendly language
Highly competent in identifying related and co-dependent tasks, processes, problems, solutions and resulting opportunities
Excellent listening, interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills
Highly self motivated and directed
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks while under pressure
Strong customer service orientation
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment
Supportive of the company's mission and vision, and committed to its core values
Understand and apply servant leadership, work collaboratively with integrity and demonstrate accountability


Education and Experience: 
The requirements listed below are representative of the education and / or experience required:


Bachelor's degree in the field of business administration, computer science, finance, or information systems, or the equivalent combination of education and experience
At least 3 years proven experience with business and technical requirements analysis, elicitation, modeling, verification, and methodology development
Experience in design, development, and implementation of software and hardware solutions, systems, or products
Proven experience with adult learning principles, methodologies, and course design techniques
Successful completion of the company's Entry Training will be required within the first year

title: Business Analyst

details:
BUSINESS ANALYST GAITHERSBURG, MD
                                                                                          Project Description: The Business Analyst (BA) will be part of the Access Services Project Management Team. The BA will be responsible for eliciting, analyzing, validating, specifying, verifying, and managing the business needs of the project stakeholders, and end users. The successful candidate will work closely with business units, subject matter experts and technical resources to identify business needs, define project requirements, develop requirements and manage the development effort to completion.  Conduct business analysis.  Work collaboratively with project teams, end users/stakeholders to analyze, understand, and document the business processes or needs with the goal of recommending a technology and / or process solution.  Document functional analysis and create detailed business requirements; analyze and suggest improvements to business processes with system solutions, and make system recommendations to meet project needs, participate in projects to ensure solutions meet user requirements.  Work with stakeholders to elicit, document, and manage functional, and non-functional requirements.  Conduct requirements analysis, model the business process using process diagrams, flowcharts, data models, decision models.  Document as-is and to-be process diagrams.  Identify gaps for potential technology solutions.  Explore methods of user interaction utilizing use cases, storyboards, wireframes, and user stories.  Verify and validate requirements and contribute to development of a test plan. Assess proposed solution and its ability to meet stakeholder requirements. Generate, validate, and maintain analytical reports from a variety of sources in support of operations and applications.  Develop new deliverables as needed based on operational requirements and following best-practices for documentation and delivery.  Analyze operational data to identify trends, issues, and opportunities to improve customer satisfaction and operational efficiency. Make recommendations based on findings.  Create and maintain use cases, user stories, system requirements specifications, requirements traceability matrix, interface requirements with other systems, and user guides.  Conduct and participate in peer reviews for requirements and other stage gate artifacts. Development of test scenarios and test cases, and testing activities necessary to assess the quality and completion of system implementations. Facilitate user acceptance testing with users and clients. Assist Project Manager, and Directors in project related tasks. Work collaboratively with peers to coordinate the overall delivery of technology solutions.
 Required Skills: Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Information Systems, or equivalent years of professional work experience in related discipline. At least 3+ years of experience working on IT related projects. At least 3+ years of experience with documenting processes; requirements gathering, analysis. Strong grasp of MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, and Visio). Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts. Demonstrated ability to communicate in both verbal and written communication. Demonstrated analytical and problem solving skills. Familiarity with general business functions. Strong organizational skills; attention to detail. Ability to multitask and work on multiple parallel projects. Ability to prioritize work assignments, communicate progress, and deliver on time. Broad working knowledge and experience with healthcare applications and technology.
 This 6+ month position starts ASAP. Please E-MAIL your resume (attachment to email) with rate and availability to Briana: [Click Here to Email Your Resumé]  ALPHA'S REQUIREMENT #18-00405W2 ONLY MUST BE ELIGIBLE TO WORK IN THE U.S. AS AN HOURLY W2 EMPLOYEE
title: Business Analyst

details:
Our Eastern Operations Center in Parsippany, NJ is currently recruiting for a Technical Business Analyst. As a Technical Business Analyst, you will have responsibility for capturing business data, building business models, and processing solutions to address business needs.In this role, you will gather data, identify structure and context, extrapolate the insights and create reports. Produce financial, market and operational analysis by querying data repositories and generating periodic reports. Devise methods for identifying data patterns and trends in available information sources. Provides reports on financial and performance measures on both a recurring and ad-hoc basis.Functions:
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
Developing database solutions to store and retrieve company information
Extract data from databases and data warehouses for reporting and to facilitate sharing between multiple data systems
Assist in the design and development of data warehouses and other database components to support Business Intelligence dashboards and reporting
Provide recurring and ad-hoc reports as required on financial and performance measures;
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Analyzes and interprets financial and operating data for management including performance benchmark reporting, cost analyses, market niche reporting, profitability analyses, performance assessments, contract pricing analyses, wage analyses, and other reporting as required
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems
Standardize data collection by developing methods for database design and validation reports
Synthesize current business trends or data to support recommendations for action
Analyzes and interprets trends; identifies and communicates loss trends; recommends corrective actions to stem immediate shortfalls while addressing long-term profitability issues.
Oversees and coordinates financial programs for funding new and continued operations in order to increase productivity and maximize profitability
Provide application analysis and data modeling design to collect data for a centralized data warehouse.
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities
Work with team members and functional leads to understand existing data requirements and validation rules to support moving operational data into data warehouse
Other duties as assigned by management
Education/Experience:
Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related field, and a minimum of three years progressively responsible business experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to perform the essential functions of the job, as determined by the company
Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc) and databases (SQL etc)
Programming language (JAVA, Python, Ruby, XML, Java, ETL frameworks, VBA)
Competencies :
Strong understanding of business intelligence tools, databases, systems and methods
Skill in financial and operational analysis
Demonstrated knowledge of ethical business practices
Ability to think strategically, synthesize complex business/financial data and develop solutions
Ability to interact effectively at all levels and across diverse cultures
Ability to be an effective member of complex project teams
Ability to use financial systems and standard office applications software effectively
EOE M/F/Vet/DisabilitiesBenefitsMedical, dental, and vision coverage offered, along with 401k and life insurance.

details: Business Analyst Associate Location: Tempe, AZ  Job Description: We are currently seeking an enthusiastic business analyst for a position in Admission Services Information Systems Development. Our ideal candidate has the ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously and translate business data into digestible information that improves business processes.  Essential Duties:  Provide support for Admission Services processes that require manual effort and in collaboration with stakeholders, recommend and prepare specifications for improvement to those processes. Identify opportunities for new and enhanced systems and computer applications. Facilitate discussion and design of applications and coordinate with the Technology Office, Admission Services and other business units to ensure successful development and implementation. Prepares a broad variety of reports and provides data and management information for clients, internal and/or external audiences. Analyze process documentation from multiple sources and recommend changes to drive consistency across the documentation. Participates in high-level business initiatives and assist with all levels of metric reporting.  Manage and execute the employee engagement plan that includes and is not limited to:	 Planning internal events such as town halls, site visits and offsite meetings Writing, distributing and tracking communications  Overseeing technical A/V requirements such as multi-city webcasts Sending and analyzing post-meeting surveys Create monthly newsletter   Manage daily communications to support application and platform activities. Manage the employee intranet and SharePoint sites, including writing and publishing content and keeping all pages up-to-date. May review established policies, maintain issues log and manage report delivery. Advanced PowerPoint skills with demonstrated expertise telling a story visually. Experience managing Targeted Email: sending emails, pulling lists and evaluating effectiveness. Experience managing an intranet site; SharePoint site. Strong writing and editing skills; innovative content generator, digitally savvy. Must understand the complexity of speaking to multiple audiences with differing interests Strong time management and project management skills; must be organized and detail-oriented and have the ability to manage multiple projects concurrently. Experience identifying issues, analyzing solutions and recommending these solutions to management for implementation. Must drive self to deliver to due dates and follow-up with all parties involved to meet those deadlines using multiple communication channels available. Creative with the ability to think outside of the box.  Challenge Status quo. BA/BS degree in Communications, Marketing, Journalism or related degree is preferred.

Advanced Microsoft Excel skills with demonstrated expertise on pivot tables, charts, and look-ups. Advanced experience building and maintaining Dashboards as status reports. Technical writing is a huge plus. Graphic designing a huge plus.
title: Reporting Business Analyst

details:
Location: McLean, VA
Duration: 6-7 months with possible contract to hire



Client cannot sponsor visa candidates for this position. W2 only. 

Local candidates preferred

Description:

- The Role is responsible for our managing data processes to ensure data is accuracy and complete. 
- The successful candidate must have in depth technical knowledge of Salesforce architecture and he/she must be passionate about data, detail oriented, able to manage multiple tasks simultaneously. 
- The ideal candidate is a change agent with consulting experience.
- Salesforce Certifications highly preferred.  
- Experience with Master Data Management tools and/or Microstrategy, preferred.  
- This role reports into the Salesforce Center of Excellence Director.  

Responsibilities:
- Lead data cleaning and dedup program to drive accurate and complete data.
- Develop reports, dashboards, and processes to continuously monitor data quality and integrity.
- Partner with Data Governance Area to implement new MDM Golden record project.
- Lead new data management and migration discovery sessions with key stakeholders to gather, analyze and document clear business requirements.
- Analyze and recommend data modeling, mapping, normalization strategy and design improvements.
- Execute data migrations and data quality efforts focused on completeness, standardization, and deduplication.
- Retrieve and analyze data using Data Loader, Excel and other data management/BI systems.
- Proactively identify and implement operational improvements and enhancements to meet data quality goals. 
- Perform data entry and data management functions. 
- Act as ambassador of the Salesforce CoE, change agent and champion of Salesforce to promote best practices that can transform and empower client’s businesses using Salesforce.  
- Project manage work streams to meet desired scope, timelines and quality and escalates issues for resolution and to mitigate risk. Facilitate meetings, schedule follow ups and responsible for minutes. 
- Create business requirement documentation, user stories and acceptance criteria for Agile deployments.
- Drive communications with all key stakeholders including delivering project updates and gathering project sign offs from CoE Lead and key stakeholders and maintains alignment.





Experience Requirements
- Salesforce Certification, highly preferred.
- 3+ years of in depth experience migrating and managing data in Salesforce.  
- Track record retrieving and analyzing data using Excel and Salesforce.com Data Loader (Eclipse Force.com IDE).
- Experience using Salesforce cleaning data tools such as Active Prime, DemandTools, others).
- Understanding of MDM principles and data mastering. Experience with MDM, highly preferred.
- Experience with data analytics Microstrategy tool, highly preferred.
- Strong business analysis and functional experience with quantitative, analytical and organizational skills
- Strong understanding of key SFDC architecture and data management.
- Intermediate Excel skills (Pivot Tables, VLookups).
- Strong attention to detail and excellent problem-solving skills.
- Strong verbal/written communication and data presentation skills, including an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams.
- Experience working with large-scale, complex datasets.
- Track record for being detail-oriented.
- Highly organized, have multi-tasking skills, and efficient in ambiguous situations.
- Demonstrate ability to influence stakeholders to meet objectives.
- Bachelor’s degree.

details:
As an RPA Business Analyst, you’ll be tasked with creating documentation including requirements, process mapping (using MS Visio), acceptance criteria, user guides, and best practice sharing. You’ll also be responsible for: • Assisting the Product Owner / Subject Matter Expert in leading, directing, and reviewing all activities associated with delivering RPA products • Conducting Design Thinking sessions, gaining insights the process and customer needs • Managing the Product Backlog for a project • Working with the Product Owner to prioritize requirements, define and manage scope for a project • Providing operational support to subject matter experts and other clients, engaging with various teams to resolve problems as they arise • Product quality, project timeliness, and customer satisfaction • Documenting the entire process end-to-end ensuring that exception paths are identified and addressed • Working with the process owner to define and document user acceptance test cases The RPA Team is responsible for the design, development, and deployment of technology, tools, and standard processes to support the delivery of Robotic Process Automations. The team is focused on enhancing competitive advantage through automation, value-added, and efficient automations to our clients. It is dynamic team with professionals of varying backgrounds from technical coding, technology development, change management, Six Sigma, and project management. The team consults and executes on a wide range of initiatives involving process and tool development and implementation including training development, engagement management, tool design, and implementation. 

Basic Qualifications: • Requires a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Business Administration, or relevant educational or professional experience • Experienced Robotics Process Automation (RPA) analyst to help lead UI/UX understanding • Have a strong understanding of the RPA business environment • Lead application discovery to help identify/refine RPA opportunities • Help steward RPA opportunities and help bring experience in RPA best practices • Requires experience in process design and process improvement • Requires Advanced written, verbal analytical and communications skills • Strong interpersonal and relationship skills • Ability to coordinate and work effectively with teammates, end-users and leadership • Ability to work in a virtual team environment • Requires the ability to complete work in an acceptable timeframe, manage a variety of detailed tasks and responsibilities simultaneously. Complete all tasks with accuracy to meet deadlines, goals, objectives and satisfy internal and external customer needs related to the job • Requires a familiarity with agile project methodology Preferred: • Experience working on engagements that have incorporated Robotic Process Automations (RPA)with one of the market leading RPA platforms : UiPath or equivalent • Experience utilizing report writing best practices (optimization, use of joins and sub-queries) • Experience with manual testing to include User Acceptance Testing (UAT) • Experience pulling data from Microsoft SQL Server 2005/2008 R2/2012/2014, Oracle, SAP, text files, excel files, MS Access databases for reports • Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, Power Point, Visio)
