Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems play a significant role in this. SAP is the client's ERP platform. Funds Management (FM) is one of the key modules of this platform supporting the Budget management process. The client is currently upgrading the FM module to a later version from SAP called Budget Control System (BCS). Capturing/revising the business process, analyzing functional modifications involved in the upgrade, coordinating with business and It leads, documenting use-cases and test cases are all critical to the upgrade.ACOUNTABILITY1. Accurate capture of Business requirements, functional and non-functional in the office repository2. Work with stakeholders to define specific needs and priorities3. Capture and maintain the stakeholder RACI matrix for business functions and information entities4. Triage system issues and work with technical teams as needed5. Analyze impact of business process changes on existing systems6. Validation of requirements feasibility with other functions7. Maintain business process and requirements catalogue for systems in use. Tracing requirements to the business processes and the applications8. Disseminating business requirements (e.g. walk-throughs) with delivery and support teams9. Facilitate the balancing of business needs and product offerings in COTS implementations10. Evaluate the feasibility of changes in requirements with all functions prior to finalizing with the business11. Managing requirements baselines and changes to them, including validation with the functional teams12. Coordinate User acceptance testing of system issues and resolutionsDELIVERABLES1. Business process and requirements in the enterprise requirements management repository2. Business requirements decomposed in to Functional, Non-functional and other supplementary requirements as needed for the given project/solution3. Business Rules4. Gap Analysis in case of COTS based solution5. Product selection criteria in case of COTS based solution6. Glossary of Business terms7. Requirements Tagged to Projects/Releases8. Requirements coverage and traceability9. Stakeholder RACI matrix for business activities and Information entities10. Document the Information usage policies and guidelines11. Testing teams identify the critical business scenarios and paths for testingDOMAIN KNOWLEDGENeed to have knowledge in one or more of the following areas1. Business process analysis2. Use-case and test case documentation3. Data analysis and reportingDesired, one or more of the following4. Financial resource (budget) management, planning and control5. Funds management (FM)6. Budget Control System (BCS)7. Finance and accounting (FI)TECHNICAL SKILLSProficiency in1. Requirements management tools such as HP Application Life-cycle Management (ALM)2. Understanding business process models developing using BPM tools (e.g. iGrafx, HP ALM)3. Using various types of requirements modelling and capture techniques such as Use-case modelling, Functional requirements decomposition4. Conducting user workshops to elicit and harmonize requirements5. Analyzing business needs for data marts and analytical platforms6. Requirements elicitation and discovery7. Creating clear and concise documentationSOFT SKILLS• Communication (sharing the right information at the right time to the right audience and right frequency)• Ability to collaborate with others• Analytical skills• Client orientation• Results orientation• Willingness to drive and embrace change• CuriosityGENERAL1. Minimum of 5 to 7 years of overall business analyst experience2. Self-managed and results-oriented3. Good verbal and written communication skills4. Ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts.5. Team player, detail oriented, able to multi-task and prioritize effectively6. Proficient in the use of Business process modelling and Requirements management tools such as HP ALM7. Experience with Data management, Reporting, & Analytics solutions and projects8. Strong analytical and product management skills, including a thorough understanding of how to analyze and interpret business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements.9. Good documentation skills to produce clear and concise documentation.

details: WOONGJIN INC. is looking for a Business Analyst for a conglomerate known worldwide for their electronics and IT services. title: Business Analyst (Bilingual- Korean and English)

details:
AceInfo Solutions is seeking a Business System Analyst for a growing government client located in Ft. Collins, CO. The candidate will work for the engineering division that supports developing and managing a suite of enterprise services and applications.  Engineering and operations are evolving toward a DevOps culture, seamlessly integrating security requirements with automated testing, code integration and deployment.  The candidate will work closely with our government client and well as Development, Security, DevOps, and Operations and Support teams in an agile environment to manage a backlog of requirements, epics, stories and roadmaps for delivery.   
.

Responsibilities




Develop an in-depth understanding of customer requirements to support testable deliverables.
Work face-to-face and remotely with clients to analyze and formulate requirements.
Create and maintain a product backlog that includes well organized epics and stories.   
Participate in Agile planning sessions with product owners and team leads to convert requirements into epics and stories.
Compose and elaborate user stories including acceptance criteria and gain team commitment to completion.
Coordinate with Development and Quality Assurance (QA) engineers to ensure stories have accurate and specific acceptance criteria that can be used to produce detailed functional test plans.
Capture ongoing changes to user stories as they are being analyzed, designed and implemented during the sprints.











Qualifications




Experience Required

3+ years’ experience as a Business Analyst for software implementations.
2+ of experience as BA within agile software development.  
Working, coordinating and communicating on cross-team initiatives.

Experience Preferred

Proficient in the Atlassian suite of agile tools: Confluence and Jira or similar.
Experience with Government systems.

 Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

Familiar with information technology architecture, governance and data exchange.
General understanding of web technologies.
Effectively prioritize work, troubleshoot issues, communicate effectively and complete tasks on time.  
Proficient with presentation and web communication tools.
Ability to communicate complex technical problems to a non-technical audience.
Self-starter with strong self-management skills.
Strong interpersonal, written/verbal communication and leadership skills.
Ability to organize and manage multiple priorities.
Customer service oriented.
Passion and drive for learning new technologies and practices.
Detail oriented across multiple different teams, while keeping in mind the larger picture.
Adaptable, dependable and independent. 
Organize and lead meetings with team and client.

Preferred Educational Requirements

Certified as or willing to obtain PMI-PBA, CBAP, or CCBA.
Bachelor’s degree in Business/Computer Information Systems, Computer Science or related field.

Clearance and Eligibility

Ability to attain Federal Government Position of Trust.

Must pass a background investigation.

title: Business Analyst

details:
Treasury Business Analyst, who can support key business initiatives with insight derived from data for our Treasury Department. This person will be responsible for automating the generation of various internal reports for use by Treasury operations staff. Reporting to be automated will be for purposes including, but not limited to, daily positioning of domestic and international cash balances, cash forecasts, automation of transaction approval processes, daily reporting and analytics.
The Business Analyst will be required to work with the process owners and other internal teams to:


Develop automated approaches to pulling data from existing sources such as daily bank files, propriety coin inventory systems, data cubes, SQL Server-based BI environments, and the company’s ERP (SAP), Cash Receipts, Payment Register, FX, Banking, Banking Feeds both inbound and outbound (Citibank)), Finance and Controllership,  Auditing (Internal IT, SOX, External – Deloitte).

Automate the calculations on that data and population of results in reports for use by Treasury and other finance staff,
Educate Treasury staff on the automation tools employed for the above purposes so they may sustain the newly-automated environment independently going forward


Key Responsibilities:

Elicit requirements using interviews, business process descriptions, business analysis, task and workflow analysis
Responsible for elevating the efficiency and effectiveness of the processes that exist within Treasury; offering recommendations on how best to construct these processes in order automate many daily tasks
Lead process redesign initiatives; solutions developed & implemented should be innovative, thorough, practical, and sustainable.
Build critical tools and automate processes for efficiency
Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs
user friendly automated solutions
Utilize your experience in using enterprise-wide requirements definition and management systems and methodologies required
Strong analytical and product management skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret business needs and translate them into application and operational solutions.

Education & Experience:

3+ years related experience

Experience with Treasury Functions. Cash Receipts, Payment Register, FX, Banking, Banking Feeds both inbound and outbound (Citibank)), Finance and Controllership,  Auditing (Internal IT, SOX, External – Deloitte).

Experience with relational databases and data modeling
Experience with software development lifecycles, including agile software development
Experience with SQL strongly preferred
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Must be able to communicate effectively and confidently with users, team members and management
Organized and detail-oriented
Proven experience at driving consensus across multiple stakeholders


Strong facilitation skills. Must be able to elicit requirements from various personalities across organizational and geographical boundaries
Experience applying these skills and abilities to finance, accounting, or treasury functions is highly desired.
title: Treasury Business Analyst

details: Job Description About the Role: The Client Output Solutions Senior Business Analyst Workforce Management will be responsible for planning and analysis activities of the Workforce Management function of Client Output Solutions. You will assist in managing resource supply to meet demand for Project Management and Engineering resources executing projects on behalf of our Client clients.  Responsibilities will focus on matching available capacity with demand while taking into consideration required skills, workforce mix, allocations, portfolio risks and resource costs. You will work with the Project Management Office (PMO), Senior Leaders and Line Managers to balance workloads and address staffing needs as required to maintain optimal resource levels.  About our Business: Output Solutions at Client delivers business-critical communications to financial institutions, health and property/casualty insurance providers, billers, retailers, travel and entertainment companies and advertising agencies nationwide. With solutions including transactional document production and delivery, card manufacturing and personalization and direct marketing services, we help our clients streamline operations to contain costs, while building customer loyalty and generating incremental revenue.  Essential Job Responsibilities: 1. Lead analysis of actual and projected capacity, anticipate availability and proactively identify resource constraints in collaboration with Line Managers to minimize unassigned time while balancing the workload of all resources designated for build activities. 2. Create and maintain supply and demand models and associated reporting for optimized capacity planning and demand fulfillment in the system of record (CA Clarity PPM) 3. Proactively identify and address supply and demand gaps using forecasts, reports and models to optimize utilization and headcount 4. Engage with managers to recommend and approve staffing to satisfy demand requirements as well as Output Solution's goals for workforce mix, e.g., skill levels, onshore / offshore, contractor / FTE, etc. 5. Planning and designing of business processes and making recommendations or changes in order to improve and support process and strategies. 6. Provide written and verbal updates to senior management regarding Workforce Management 7. Provide input to the performance management process 8. Provide leadership, mentorship and training to the team  The above statements are intended only to describe the general nature of the job, and should not be construed as an all-inclusive list of position responsibilities.  Required Qualifications: " Bachelor's degree (advanced degree preferred) " Minimum of 3 - 5 years of related work experience in any combination of Workforce Management, Professional Services or Portfolio Management " Demonstrated proficiency in forecasting, planning and understanding of financial and operational impacts and proactive in identifying strategies to manage utilization " Advanced knowledge of an established Resource Management Tool (Clarity/ Planview/Change Point) " Exceptional MS Office skills especially Excel and PowerPoint  Preferred Qualifications: " Bachelor's Degree in a business related field " Experience with SharePoint and CA Clarity PPM preferred " Capable of exercising extreme discretion, independent judgment, high organizational and problem-solving skills " Experience working in a fast-paced, multi-faceted environment with the ability to adapt to change and priorities as a trusted business partner " Ability to handle multiple tasks, meet deadlines and adapt to constantly changing priorities without direction or guidance " Ability to communicate, both verbally and written, with a high level of confidence across all levels of business, often as a Change Agent " Possess outstanding leadership, teamwork and interpersonal skills

details:
We are Radial, the leader in Omnichannel commerce technologies and operations. We enable our clients to profitably exceed customer expectations by taking on the complexity of their Omnichannel retail business and transforming it into a seamlessly orchestrated customer experience. To bring order to ordering. To make fulfillment more fulfilling. To keep commerce clicking. When we partner with our clients to execute their orders, payments, fulfillment, or customer care, our clients' promises become ours.Responsibilities:The Business Analyst is responsible for managing the Technology Project Initiation Process (PIP), including meeting facilitation, communication, and cross functional coordination as well as small project management.  Responsibilities include: - Meeting facilitation, process administration and communication - Resource scheduling, reporting and developing and tracking metrics - Acting as the conduit between technology and business requestors - Coordinating and managing small internal IT projects, including status, timelines and milestones - Contributing to the implementation of improvements in standard solutions and processes - Forging business partnerships across Radial to deliver strategic business results - Working collaboratively across the IT and business organizations to ensure data accuracy and open communication related to the portfolio of technology work requestsRequired Qualifications:The successful candidate will have strong organization and time management skills, as well as an entrepreneurial approach and a focus on customer service. Additional required skills and experiences include: - Strong planning, analytic and decision-making skills - Strong customer relationship management and communication skills - Proven ability to work well in fast pace, constantly changing environment - Experience working in dynamic team settings - Working knowledge of full Microsoft Office Suite, particularly Excel, SharePoint and PowerPoint - Bachelor's degree in Business, Technology or relate

title: Business Analyst

details:
Serves as a liaison between the business community and the IT organization in order to provide technical solutions to meet user needs. Possesses expertise in the business unit(s) they support, as well as, an understanding of the IT organization’s systems and capabilities. Analyzes business partner’s operations to understand their strengths and weaknesses to determine opportunities to automate processes and functions. Assists in the business process redesign and documentation as needed for new technology. Translates high level business requirements into functional specifications for the IT organization and manages changes to such specifications. Educates the IT organization on the direction of the business. Negotiates agreements and commitments by facilitating communication between business unit(s) and IT from initial requirements to final implementation. Possesses an understanding of technological trends and uses this knowledge to bring solutions to business units supported to enhance the enterprise's competitive edge. May make recommendations for buy vs. build decision. 

Intermediate professional level role. Works with business partners within one business function to align technology solutions with business strategies. Demonstrates an informed knowledge of a business area to resolve problems on an ongoing business. Supports several moderately complex business processes. Works on multiple projects as a project team member, occasionally as a project leader. May coach more junior staff.



 



Typically has 3 to 5 years of relevant technical or business work experience. -agile -scrum -infrastructure -applications

details:
The incumbent will be responsible for initiating and overseeing the development and maintenance of provider system agreements, fee schedules, and related processes; and will work with various departments in order to ensure that system agreements are in line with provider contracts and amendments. The incumbent will monitor end-to-end provider configuration to identify, report and track potential issues that could affect claims outcomes.   Position Responsibilities:
Oversee various internal and external processes to ensure that the DOFR is appropriately operational.
Serve as subject matter expert to the Finance Department for shared risk pool settlements.
Interpret new provider contracts and contract changes and formally communicate the setup via a System Change Request form to IS.
Develop, create, and maintain an electronic system, with reporting capabilities, for tracking System Change Requests.
Assist the Contracting Department in the development of contract language related to claims payment in accordance with system requirements.
Serve as business lead to IS and other departments for overall provider configuration, including fee schedules and agreements.
Develop back-end quality control reports to identify provider and/or agreement configuration issues which may lead to claim processing or other errors.
Oversee end-to-end system change process to ensure that business needs are met, including the outcome review and approval of testing and production claims.
Other projects and duties as assigned.



Effectively utilize computer and appropriate software and interact with CalOptima IS as applicable.
Perform in depth root cause analysis and develop solutions to complicated issues.
Effectively translate business requirements into technical specifications.
Work independently and as part of a team with minimal supervision.
Communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing.
Manage, organize and track numerous and diverse activities, timelines and issues.
Experience & Education:
Bachelor’s degree in Health Care Administration or other related field; or equivalent work experience required.
3+ years of managed care experience required, system configuration and/or claims experience preferred.
4+ years of data analytic experience required.
3+ years experience working with CPT/HCPC codes required.
Medi-Cal and Medicare experience preferred.
4+ years experience working with practice management software required (Facets preferred).
4+ years provider configuration experience preferred.
Experience analyzing managed care risk pool claims and/or data preferred.
Knowledge of:
Microsoft Word, Excel, Access (proficient).
CPT, HCPC, Revenue codes, ICD-9, ICD-10, CMS-1500, UB-04.
Claims and reimbursement principles.
Managed care payment methodologies, including fee-for-service, capitation, per diem, and DRGs.
Configuring practice management system for claims payment, preferably for shared risk model.
Managed care provider contracts.
Medi-Cal managed care benefits and fee schedules.

Our mission is to be a trusted workplace for team members to be their whole selves at work. A company that people love and positively impacts the lives of all whom we touch.

be your best self

At Interstate Batteries, you have the chance to be excellent at work and excellent at life. We know that professional success depends on personal wellbeing. That's why we want to enrich your life with the tools and services you need to succeed in every area of your life. Join us!

2 to 4 years of experience in a Business Analyst role

Highly Proficient / Advanced in the utilization of MS Excel.
Experience with MicroStrategy reporting tools helpful

Must have a demonstrated ability to excel in a collaborative environment.
Self-starter with ability to work independently and handle multiple projects simultaneously.
Should have strong verbal and written communications skills.

details:
Emser Tile seeks a Operations Business Analyst to provide process and systems support to defined region. This includes, but is not limited to, business systems, policies, and procedures, reporting metrics, and monitoring internal controls. Self-initiated implantation of best business practices, originating process design, and recommendation of systemic process solutions is required. Core Responsibilities:

Provide Operational Metrics Trend Analysis

Analysis of key business metrics and cost centers

Targets Regional Operations Manager efforts through providing targeted analysis and reporting of Operations Reviews metrics 
Follow up as needed on any and all exceptions reporting as it relates to validation of information and results
Provide feedback to Regional Operations Managers, Inventory Control Coordinator, DC Operations Support and Corporate Office
Our ideal candidate posses the following skills: 
Exceptional Numbers Orientation
Highly Analytical
Exceptionally Detail Oriented 
Excellent Communication Skills
Highly Organized 
Solution Oriented 
Critical Thinking/ Cognitive Skills
Multi-tasking Skills
Planning Skills 
Experience and Knowledge: 
Excel (Advanced)
Reports Now (helpful)
ERP Systems Reporting
JD Edwards Experience (helpful)

Must have intimate familiarity and experience in Business Order to Cash Process
Understand Pricing
Have experience and comfort with financials and period, quarterly, annual rollup
Experience preparing Integrated Test Plans to test standard functionality, customizations, reports, workflows and financial data in systems Testing of same systems to ensure it supportsthe systems and users

Prepare user training guides as well as train and communicate them

Must understand process maps and have understanding of how they integrate and affect one another.
International Trading - Understands how costs, expenses, warehousing and distribution affect

About Emser: The Emser Tradition of Excellence Comes From its People...Since its establishment in 1968, Emser Tile has become the leading supplier of the world's finest tile and natural stone. Through our international production network and product development expertise, we offer myriad of possibilities that help retailers, contractors, homebuilders, commercial builders, architects & designers bring their ideas to life. Although Emser has grown rapidly, our on-going dedication to outstanding quality and service remains the hallmark of our success.Emser is always seeking knowledgeable, career-minded professionals to become a part of our team and help drive our growth and expansion into new and existing markets. When it comes to challenging and rewarding career opportunities, Emser is the place to be!As an Emser employee, you will enjoy healthcare coverage including medical, prescription drug, vision and dental care. title: Operations Business Analyst -LOS ANGELES

details:
Carey International, Inc.
the world's largest and most respected chauffeured services company,
is accepting resumes for the position of

Busintess Analyst 
 
at our Headquarters facility in  
Frederick, MD 
 
Summary of Position Responsibilities: 

Responsible for system and business requirements, analysis of defects and improvements and improving the overall end-user experiences across Carey’s Digital applications with the aim of driving incremental value to end users, facilitating adoption of electronic channels, channel shift and supporting Sales and Marketing efforts of new revenue opportunities.

Areas of responsibility may encompass new systems/services/solutions or may encompass all or part of existing integrated systems.  Responsible to maintain an understanding of the business objectives first and foremost and ensure incremental development efforts support corporate strategy.  Supports VP, Digital Strategy and other business stakeholders in evaluating priority of backlog through evaluating opportunity, impact and benefits associated to each improvement as well as the overall impact of each defect both in frequency as well as overall impact to the Carey International brands and user experience. 

Responsible for level 1 analysis of reported bugs or improvements communicated through customer-facing applications, verifies defects and ensures appropriate business context is captured within JIRA prior to handoff to development team.  Responsible for performing data analysis of application performance and producing routine analytical reports on user experience through hands-on testing as well as evaluating various data sources. 



 
Join a world-class and worldwide organization:
·         Won the prestigious Award of Excellence for Best Chauffeured Services Worldwide from Luxury Travel Advisor magazine. 
·         Awarded two GOLD Travel Weekly Magellan Awards, one for best worldwide coverage and the other for best mobile application. 
 
Fleet and Technology Facts:
Carey’s wide range of amenities and services attract clients of the highest caliber.
·         Fleet of well-maintained late-model sedans, SUVs, vans and specialty vehicles with in-vehicle GPS.
·         Proprietary innovative technology allowing Customers to make reservations on-line, through a mobile app or by phone.   
·         Our advanced technology extends to “two-way” in-vehicle tablet-based communications between our Chauffeurs and Dispatchers and between our Chauffeurs and Customers. 
  
Our Benefits
 For Full-Time positions:
·         Paid vacation and sick leave.  Ten (10) paid holidays per calendar year.
·         Company subsidized medical, dental, and vision insurance
·         Company-paid Life insurance and short-term disability insurance
·         Supplement insurance options at group rates, including Long Term Disability, Accident, Cancer, Critical Care, and Universal Life.
·         Free Employee Assistance Program

·         401(k) Plan

Carey is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

To express interest in this career opportunity, please send a cover letter with salary history and a current resume and Refer to position:  FRS18-02



Education:     4-year College Degree or equivalent work experience
Experience:  

A minimum of 4 years experience defining integrated operational business applications that implement mission-critical functionality, have high performance, availability, and data integrity requirements, and are highly user-interactive.  Demonstrated experience with defining requirements, translating to systematic functions, user interface concepts. 
Experience with reservations, order entry, vehicle dispatch, billing, and/or accounting systems or similar systems. 
Direct experience with all phases of the system development life cycle, including analysis, design, development, test, implementation, and production support, is preferred; analysis, design, and support required.  Experience with complex, multi-tiered/service-oriented systems.
Experience with coordination across multiple vendors/teams both on and off site. 
Demonstrated participation in small to mid-sized projects or portions of larger projects.
Project Management experience preferred.  PMP Certification not required but familiarity with core principles of PMP Project Management a plus.
Demonstrated understanding of both Waterfall and Agile software development methodologies and pros/cons of each.
Experience with customer facing applications in Web and Mobile technologies.
Experience in graphic design with emphasis in UI/UX design, testing and acceptance is preferred.
CBAP Certification a plus.
 


Skills: 

Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Consultative skills with ability to elicit and prioritize requirements, obtain consensus on course of action, and maintain business/systems team participation.
Demonstrated ability to identify and document business system requirements, including business process, functions, and rules; define in concise written material; translate to systematic functions; define user interface flow, system control points and functions; document in consistent specifications; define data model and document.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.  Ability to communicate with management, application users, programmers, and other technical staff.  Ability to elicit and interpret requirements and business practices and translate to stable model and system functionality following best practices and system patterns. 
Demonstrated ability to represent complex information in diagrams, tables, or through other techniques that communicate precise information to both business and technical staff.  Use of Visio and/or similar tools is preferred.
Knowledge of, and experience with, structured software development methods; familiarity with service-oriented concepts.
Ability to write simple SQL queries, prepare basic ad hoc reports in Crystal or Tableau is required.
Ability to manage multiple assignments in a multi-tasking, high-pressure, deadline-driven environment. 


Attributes and Characteristics:  

Mature judgment and ability to assess alternatives relative to business needs, costs, and functional integrity and flexibility is required.  Demonstrates strength of judgment to recognize when to escalate issues, questions, and problems to manager.
Organizes work to accommodate priorities and time constraints.  Maintains organized work products.
Exhibits high degree of accuracy and precision in work. 
Is able to compose thorough but concise written documentation in various forms requiring minimal review of content only.  Grammar, formatting and presentation should be solid.
Reliable and dependable. 
Self-starter and proactive.  Demonstrates a high-sense of urgency to ensure team is successful and takes action to prevent issues when identified. 
Team player.  Takes initiative to learn and appreciate every team’s mission and how every group fits into the larger value offering of Carey International. 
Flexible.  Able to change processes and practices as needed to accommodate business changes or priorities and audience.
Ethical.  Upholds high standard of honesty and integrity.  Maintains professional and objective communication and works to build mutually respectful working relationships with both clients and peers.
Focused.  Able to maintain targeted and focused view of strategy and objectives and keep team aligned when tasked with large-scale projects.  Able to prioritize and establish healthy working boundaries with both peers and management alike.

details:
NTT DATA, Inc., a top 10 global IT services company, has an immediate need for an Sr. Business Analyst/Architect to support our client in West Point, Pa  To apply for this position, please follow the link below or send your resume directly to [Click Here to Email Your Resumé] Sr. Business Architect 10+ months West Point, Pa Requirements: The Sr. Business Architect will be needed to partner with the Oncology business team on various initiatives. 
 The Sr. Business Architect will partner with business SMEs to extract business process requirements and design strategy and facilitate/lead platform technical review sessions
 The Sr. Business Architect will develop business process flows/diagrams which can be translated into a viable system design plan. Support the design review process to ensure the solution developed achieves project goals.

title: Sr. Business Analyst/A Business Architect

details:
Meggitt is a global engineering group specializing in extreme environment products and smart sub-systems for aerospace, defense and energy markets. We employ over 11,000 people across manufacturing facilities in Asia, Europe, North America, with regional bases in India and the Middle East.
Job Designation

The Information Services Business Analyst provides expertise in planning and designing business Information Systems to improve the work-flow, production and efficiency of the company’s functional systems. Acts as a liaison between the Information Services development group and business units in the development and implementation of new systems and enhancement of existing ones.
Job Core Responsibilities



Conducts technical business analysis to identify initiatives that will allow the business to meet its objectives
Interprets business needs and translates them into application and operational requirements
Documents, coordinates and plans the modifications or enhancements to software products
Acts as the liaison between the business units, technology teams and support teams
Collaborates with developers and subject matter experts to establish the technical vision and analyze tradeoffs between usability and performance needs
Proactively communicates and collaborates to analyze information needs and functional requirements
Plans, promotes and organizes internal training activities related to new product modifications or enhancements
Understands data sources and is able to develop reporting tools to share data with stakeholders, and to compile business data into actionable reports
Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance
Regular, consistent and punctual attendance is required. May need to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) and additional hours as necessary

Job Specifications

Education: Post-secondary degree or equivalent combination of relevant education and work experience that will allow successful performance of job expectations

Years Experience: 3-5 years of relevant experience

Skills:


Experience in developing and maintaining various analysis, reporting and business intelligence tools, especially SQL Server Reporting Services
Advanced analytical skills and strong mathematical aptitude to proactively identify and solve problems
Ability to apply creative thinking in the use of management systems and development of business processes
Demonstrated project management and leadership skills, including the ability to gather clear business requirements
High level of interpersonal skills with excellent verbal and written communication skills to drive tasks to completion
Advanced skills in Microsoft Office applications, specifically Word, Excel, Outlook and Knowledge of MS Project


 
This position requires use of information which is subject to the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR). All applicants must be U.S. persons within the meaning of ITAR. ITAR defines a U.S. person as a U.S. Citizen, U.S. Permanent Resident (i.e. 'Green Card Holder'), Political Asylee, or Refugee.
Meggitt is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex including sexual orientation and gender identity, national origin, disability, protected Veteran Status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

details:
Scientific Analyst

SUMMARY
The Scientific Business Analyst (SBA) will work with Research Scientists and
act as a liaison between IT and Research. 






Lead
scientific-related business needs assessment, as well as facilitate the
design, build and implementation of IT systems. Work with scientists and
laboratory personnel to understand their business processes and suggest
improvement opportunities to enhance end-user experience
Work closely
with end-users and technical team members to translate high-level business
and user requirements into functional and design specifications using
structured business and technical analysis and data modeling techniques
(e.g. activity diagrams, entity-relationship diagrams, etc.)
Act as an
expert technical and scientific resource to software development staff in
all phases of the development and implementation process
Participate in
user research, usability and acceptance testing




Work with scientists and
laboratory personnel to understand their business processes and suggest
improvement opportunities to enhance end-user experience










 Research Analyst / Scientific BA 

 
Pre Clinical
Drug Discovery and Research.    Experience
in pharma and/or bio tech.
Real-life lab experience and use of IT systems as a scientist in the lab The BA's would need to
have experience working on different systems in lab environments -
   - Experience with Laboratory Information
Management Systems
(LIMS),
(sometimes referred to as a Laboratory Information System (LIS) or Laboratory
Management System (LMS)).

scientific and technical processes

valid improvement opportunities

• Experience in fast changing Research focused environments

title: Business Analyst Contractor

details:
POSITION SUMMARY: Support MMNA Corporate Planning and Product Planning by providing insights through in-depth analytics. Improve market intelligence to identify unseen sales opportunities and improve internal reports and performance tracking for better operational management.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS: 
1. Gather and analyze internal data to contribute to the development of company strategy, business, and objectives.
2. Gather and analyze external data trends to generate insights applicable for product and strategy development
3. Support annual Business Plan and Long Range Plan process with analysis and forecasting.
4. Perform analysis to determine competitive market conditions.
5. Presents findings of internal and external data analysis to managers and business partners.
6. Support the Corporate and Product Planning teams with ad hoc reporting and analysis.
7. Develop and maintain a centralized database for timely and accurate analysis.
8. Calmly respond in highly stressful business conditions
9. Effectively manage multiple priorities and meet stated deadlines while delivering quality results.
10. Regular attendance at work on a full time schedule of at least 8 hours daily and 40 hours weekly.

QUALIFICATIONS:
1. Five years of professional analytics experience including three years of recent experience specifically within the automotive industry.
2. BA/BS of MA/MS/MBA in Business/Economics (or equivalent combination of education and experience).
3. Strong exposure to quantitative business modeling techniques.
4. Strong analytical skills.
5. Prior relevant experience with statistical modeling techniques and analysis of business alternatives.
6. Prior relevant experience with syndicated and proprietary automotive related studies/surveys, and market research/competitive intelligence databases.

Job title: Business Analyst Sr

Description:
Key Responsibilities
• Serve as a key Subject Matter Expert (SME) for key digital products and capabilities
• Interview, investigate, and elicit requirements from a variety of stakeholders, including technical, operations, and business process owners and Subject Matter Experts
• Manage (e.g. create/write, edit, update, maintain version control) appropriate business documentation to support development needs, including Agile user stories, workflows, error matrices, gap analyses, screenshots, product training materials, and known product issues
• Collaborate with Agile Product Owners in user story development, including research and information gathering from multiple stakeholders including business partners, creative services, and IT teams to produce consumable requirements
• Work with other Client team members to drive to robust solutions that meet the evolving needs of the consumer and the business and that factor in consumer value, systems dependencies and limitations, current state functionality and operational opportunities and constraints
• Provide ongoing consultation to development teams to clarify business requirements
• Assist project team with various elements throughout the development lifecycle, including test data requests, creating User Acceptance Test (UAT) scripts, conducting UAT, logging defects, conducting stakeholder demos, and creating and tracking defects
• Participate in high-level capability definition exercises during the project Discovery phase to aid with level of effort estimation
• Partner with IT and Operations stakeholders to determine requirement implementation feasibility
• Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources to identify high value needs, requirement gaps and to reconcile conflicts and requirement feasibility
• Ability to both decompose high-level information into more detailed requirements that can be prioritized and release planned and to abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding of the requirement
• Distinguish user requirements that are must-haves versus user requests that are not critical to development
• Validate that the customer experience meets the customer and business requirements
• Support on-the-fly functional adjustments due to compliance, development issues, defect resolution, etc.
• Experience working with Product Development and Management teams
• Experience working with Health-IT compliance polices related to usability, data privacy, and security (HIPAA, Human Health Services Section 508, Web Content Accessibility Guidelines, Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services guidelines, Usability and Accessibility in Consumer Health, Department of Insurance regulations) to define robust requirements and annotated wireframes for Mobile applications
• Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
• Ability to be a solid member of a cross-functional team
• A great work ethic and a reasonable sense of humor
• Can be remote up to 50% 3-5 years business analyst experience Bachelor's degree required, master's degree preferred Preferred Qualifications
• Healthcare or Financial Services industry experience
• Experience in Health-IT
• Experience with Kanban methodology
• Experience with Mobile applications
• Experience with User Experience teams Skills a Top Candidate
​

• Excellent oral, written and interpersonal communication with both technical and business audiences
• Demonstrate strategic thinking by using appropriate information to diagnose problems, identify possible solutions and collaborate with impacted groups to drive decisions
• Self-directed and able to drive detailed solutions to completion with minimal oversight
• Experience in writing business requirements for web, mobile and/or multi-tier systems
• Experience in working with Agile/Scrum work environment and familiarity with writing user stories, and following the development process through user story acceptance
• Extensive experience in documenting current and “to-be" state behaviors and logical workflows

details:
RESPONSIBILITIES:Kforce has a client in search of an UTM Business Analyst in Jersey City, New Jersey (NJ).Summary:Background: UTM (Unified Trade and Transaction Model) is the logical representation of data required to support the company and Transaction Event Management business capability. The primary intent is to standardize the data representation of trades and transactions across the company's Corporate and Investment Bank for all asset classes. It is to be used to develop interface definitions across applications.Responsibilities include:
 Lead workshops engaging modelers and the business to agree modelling per product
 Lead review sessions that ensure consistency of modelling across the Corporate and Investment Bank
 The individual will not be directly authoring UML models, but will need to engage with their detail - ensuring specific entities and attributes are defined and used consistently and appropriately
 Perform sampling and analysis of data and usage across critical applications
 Data mapping and requirements gathering
 Model evaluation with primary users and user groups
 Production of clean and concise documentation 

Goals:Working alongside our data modelers, define across the range of Corporate and Investment Bank products:
 The entities and attributes necessary to provide a business definition of each product
 How a trade will be represented at each stage in its lifecycle
 Ensure that the same concept is modelled in the same way across the Corporate and Investment Bank and prevent unnecessary divergence
 Facilitate input from Operations and other line of business teams to ensure the model is grounded in the reality of business products and how they are processed



REQUIREMENTS:What we are looking for:1. FpML knowledge, preferably across a broad range of Derivatives, Securities, and FX products
 Business knowledge of a broad range of products and their lifecycles
 Clear understanding of data concepts (relational data) and ability to read a data model (using Erwin or MagicDraw)
 Detailed analytical approach; logical, precise thinker; clear and concise communications

Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

details:
You believe data can help reshape the future, and you find yourself loving the thrill of diving into challenging analysis. At UnitedHealth Group, you'll find an organization that will recognize those talents and have lots of growth potential. Here, you will be empowered, supported and encouraged to use your analysis expertise to help change the future of health care. Does the challenge intrigue you?As a key member of the State Fee Schedule team, you will be part of UnitedHealth Group's mission of helping people live healthier lives. As a Senior Business Analyst, you will grow and develop as you conduct and manage various state fee schedule updates. You will be challenged to transform, analyze, and review data for standardization. As part of this elite team, you will be empowered to impact the health care system through creating product that helps to streamline the bill review process. Join us! There's never been a better time to do your life's best work.(sm)Primary Responsibilities:
Obtain, analyze, review and transform data 

Communicate directly with state employees regarding fee schedule, rules and guidelines 

Monitor and maintain various state workers’ compensation fee schedule information 

Summarize information regarding state rules and guidelines 

Review colleague work for accuracy 

Present research, analysis and interpretation for  colleagues and clients 

Support short and long term operational / strategic business activities through analysis 

Develop recommended business solutions through research and analysis of data and business process and implement when appropriate 

Develop, build and manage databases containing workers' compensation fee schedule information

Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree or higher 

3+ years of experience data transformation, data standardization and / or workers' compensation reimbursement  

Knowledge of general healthcare billing, code sets and fee schedules 

Knowledge of CMS Medicare files (RBRVS, CLAB, DMEPOS, etc.) 

Experience gathering requirements from various sources and  documenting processes 

Experience with process improvement, workflow, benchmarking and / or evaluation of business processes 

Intermediate level of proficiency with PC based software programs and automated database management systems (MS Excel - create and edit spreadsheets, MS Access - create and edit databases) 

1+ years experience SQL 


Soft Skills: 

Ability to communicate analysis including trends and opportunities to clients and the business in writing and verbally 

Ability to problem solve including multiple priorities and research conflicting and / or inaccurate data 

Working knowledge of relational databases and database structures 

Ability to work under tight timelines
Careers with OptumInsight. Information and technology have amazing power to transform the Healthcare industry and improve people's lives. This is where it's happening. This is where you'll help solve the problems that have never been solved. We're freeing information so it can be used safely and securely wherever it's needed. We're creating the very best ideas that can most easily be put into action to help our clients improve the quality of care and lower costs for millions. This is where the best and the brightest work together to make positive change a reality. This is the place to do your life’s best work.SM

Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.

We are currently interviewing for the following direct hire position:  Senior, IT Technical/Business Analyst Dallas, TX Direct Hire  SUMMARY Our client is seeking a Senior Technical Analyst to demonstrate depth and breadth of business analysis process, techniques and methodologies.  Contributes to application design by defining needs and recommending technical solutions that will maximize the value delivered by the system to stakeholders. Determines how the project they are assigned to impacts other projects, systems or business areas.  Ensures project meets the strategic goals/initiatives of the organization.  Influences, persuades, and leads other team members and stakeholders to achieve project goals and objectives.  Additional duties include:  Leads and facilitates interviews and cross-functional working sessions with the business process owner, functional business analyst and development team to elicit and clearly define requirements. Converts business requirements into user stories and acceptance criteria Captures non-functional and other system requirements (e.g., supported browsers, security, system performance expectations, etc.). details: IT Business Analyst (Long-term Contract) (18007162) Description The IT Business Analyst works with Business and Product Owners throughout Chipotle to identify, gather, and document business and functional requirements for IT implementations. On Agile projects, s/he serves as the Product Owner Proxy on cross-functional Scrum delivery teams, ensuring that the requirements are effectively documented, well understood, and executed in a way that exceed stakeholder expectations. For all projects, the Analyst acts as an effective liaison between business departments, various IT teams, and external vendors providing IT-related services. Responsibilities In addition to following Chipotle’s policies and procedures, principal responsibilities include, but are not limited to:•Identifying, gathering, and writing business and functional requirements by breaking features down into user stories and serving as the liaison between business owners and Scrum-based software development teams•Participating in release planning by working with business owners to gather and articulate all of the features needed for a successful project implementation•Educating business and product owners on the agile methodology and an effective cadence for identifying features, and turning those features into user stories that support development cycle•Adhering to the standards for all project related artifacts including, but not limited to, business and functional requirement specification documents, user interface guides, use case specification, business and system process flows•Identifying and surfacing gaps in requirements, cross-department coordination needs, and risks to implementations; working with the right stakeholders to mitigate those risks•Developing product ownership by growing an understanding of applications and interdependencies with other corporate and external systems, business processes, and data; identifying opportunities for documentation of tribal knowledge for long-term organizational ownership•Working closely with our business partners and delivery teams on release planning, feature grooming, user story grooming, and sprint planning•Responsible for user story acceptance in the sprint; verifying all of the user acceptance criteria has been met by the sprint team and the implementation matches the intent of the user story•Presenting the implementation of features to product owners and obtaining acceptance of features from those owners•Leveraging experience to recommend industry standard and best practice solutions; advocating for user experience best practicesThe ideal candidate will:•Possess strong requirements gathering and analysis skills for both business and functional requirements•Have experience working on an Agile development team and advocating for the business owners, product owners, and users throughout software implementations•Be able to communicate effectively with external business partners and internal teams to participate in the delivery of project requirements•Work effectively with other colleagues •Listen effectively and communicate with candor and honesty•Possess the ability to acquire, compile, and evaluate large amounts of data•Be able to triage problems in a practiced, measured, best practice •Be able to multitask effectively•Have experience working with remote (near- or off-shore) teams•Possess a B.A./B.S. in MIS or Computer Science, or an equivalent in education and experience•Be a Certified Scrum Master and/or Certified Product Owner, or have equivalent work experience•Have five (5) or more years of IT and software development work experience, with a minimum of three (3) years of Agile software development experience•Enjoy minimal travel  Primary Location: Colorado - Denver - 9999 - Wynkoop-(09999) Work Location: 9999 - Wynkoop-(09999) 1401 Wynkoop Street Denver 80202

details:
The CSI Companies is a national recruiting and staffing firm. Currently we are seeking a Consumer Goods Business Analyst for our client located in the Woonsocket, RI area. Job Type: Long Term Contract position (potential for extension / perm - no guarantees)  Schedule: Monday - Friday 8:30am - 5pm  Pay Rate: $29 - $30 an hour  Location: Woonsocket, RI  Details: This is an exciting opportunity to work with a company that specializes in sales and marketing of consumer goods to major retailers.  The analyst position will play an important role to the management team managing many of the day to day operational activities as well as supporting longer term strategic initiatives. The role will be analytical and strategic in nature. The analyst will extract data, prepare the data for presentations, apply critical thinking and make recommendations that will enhance the business moving forward. The analyst will also present findings to the management team and our clients.  Key Responsibilities:  
Quantitative Analysis:   Manage the delivery of timely analyses to support insight development. Run ad-hoc analysis upon request and provide actionable insights with recommendations for next steps.   
Product/Project Management:  Initiating, planning, executing and bringing closure to specific goals over a specific time.   
 Administrative:  Manage day to day administrative needs for the team Scheduling vendor meetings and preparing reports as needed. Communicate effectively, both verbally and on paper, to management. Assist with communication and reporting on sales performance, seasonal sales and sell thru and promotional plans.    REQUIRED EXPERIENCE:  Four year college degree in business, finance or other related field. (completed or in progress). BACHELORS in Business Administration preferred, will accept a two year degree with relevant experience. 1+ year experience as a Business Analyst for Consumer Goods or Retail Category / Environment  Ability to analyze mid-size data sets in a Microsoft Excel environment, derive insights from that data, and communicate those insights effectively Excellent interpersonal skills, including the ability to effectively interact and influence at multiple levels within the organization Ability to support multiple projects simultaneously, with the capacity to identify and re-adjust priorities as needed Experience with Retail Category Analysis and/or strategy in a retail or CPG environment Retail store experience or shopper marketing experience. Proficient in Microsoft Office Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Access (Advanced Excel skills required) Verifiable high school diploma or equivalent required.
title: Consumer Goods Business Analyst

details:
A Day in the Life as Business Analyst

As a Business Analyst at Edgenuity, you have a passionate interest and exceptional capabilities in converting our learnings from customer, product and technical discovery into actionable stories that software developers can use to guide their development work. You will be embedded in product teams and will work in a highly collaborative manner with product managers, development managers, software developers and QA. You will be involved with new product concepts from the very beginning to make sure you clearly understand what our product teams need to build and why it’s important. You will quickly understand the “what and the why,” so you can translate that understanding into small and vertically-sliced delivery stories, which feature just the right amount of detail without overwhelming product team members with too much information. As those stories are delivered, you will also be instrumental in answering any questions that arise to ensure we build just what’s promised to the business and what’s needed by our customers.

Qualifications
·         Passion for products and building software that customers love.
·         Minimum 3 years of experience translating business and customer needs into delivery stories that development teams use to build software.
·         Ability to lead grooming meetings which result in efficient and accurate story sizing.
·         Experience working in an agile and/or lean development environment.
·         A hustler mindset.
·         Technical prowess – you don’t have to be a coder, but you shouldn’t be afraid of discussing technical issues.
·         Clear and concise writing skills.
·         Self-motivation and a strong desire to make an impact in K-12 education.
title: Business Analyst - Product Management

details:
RESPONSIBILITIES:Kforce has a client in search of a Business Analyst 2 in New York, New York (NY).Summary:This request is for a Business Analyst to document the existing system processes, provide recommendation to improve existing work flows, provide effective planning to maximize full operational benefits, and supply professional change management skills. As part of the project, the analyst will provide transition support for designated staff as necessary. The Candidate will perform research, analysis of work flow systems, business rules and policies to enhance internal operations and computer systems and develop system requirement documents and technical specification documents for computer applications that will support those polices. Consultant will also compile/provide feedback for system reference documentation and provide feedback for developed test scripts/scenarios.Detailed responsibilities:Under the direct Supervision of a Business Analyst Manager and with some latitude for independent judgment, the candidate will be responsible for the following:
 Serve as Business Analyst and prototype designer for the high priority initiatives within the client
 Analyze agency wide workflow systems to identify opportunities for improvement through automation
 Lead in the research, analysis, and development of project plans, work flows, business rules, and policies to enhance internal operations and computer systems
 Lead the requirements gathering sessions with key stakeholders
 Work closely with Relationship Managers, Project Managers, and other team members, and stakeholders to achieve desired results
 Provide review of design documentation completed by other business analysts
 Prepare business requirements documentation and functional requirements documentation, as well as high-level design documentation
 Analyze and document screen mockups (using Axure RP Pro) and screen flows



REQUIREMENTS:
 Must have 5 years of experience in business requirement gathering, project management, testing, creating workflows for systems, preparing user and functional requirements specifications
 Must have a minimum of 5 years of research and business analysis for client services and system enhancement
 At least 5 years of experience in writing end user documentation/user guides and testing scripts
 Must have at least 4 years of demonstrated practice using MS Visio for flowcharting
 Demonstrated experience in analyzing, disseminating, and interpreting policies and procedures
 Strong experience in system planning, testing, piloting, and system implementation
 Demonstrated experience in Application, User Interface analysis, and testing; understanding of System Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and Agile methodologies

Desirable Skills/Experience:
 Must have at least 1 years of demonstrated practice using MS Project and preparing the end user documentation
 Knowledge of using Axure for wire frame
 Working knowledge of large-scale system integration and implementation
 Knowledge of Client's financial policy and accounting practice
 Knowledge of using TOAD or other tools for data analysis
 Ability to work independently and communicate with staff of all levels as well as users and other divisions and agencies
 Experience in mentoring and planning knowledge transfer to other business analysts

Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.
title: Business Analyst 2

details:
Our client is currently seeking a business analyst. This is a permanent role.Salary: $70,000Bonus: 10%  
The Role: The Business Analyst will work with an interdisciplinary team of economists, statisticians, actuaries, software developers, and other health care professionals to support the sales and retention of national accounts with advanced analytical tools, methods, and services. The Business Analyst will support the development and operations of products and services for their customers. 

Essential Responsibilities: • Assist with investigation into potential data issues • Work with the Product Owner to develop detailed requirements, user stories, and business rules for application development in an Agile framework • Participate in User Acceptance, QA, and Regression Testing efforts • Assist in the operation, refresh, and production support of production systems • Coordinate with vendors and clients to resolve questions/issues regarding data • Assist in data intake and analysis processes 

Qualifications and Skills: • Three (3) years of data analysis experience • Three (3) years of experience in business analysis practices • Marketing, product launch, product roadmap experience helpful • Knowledge of health care industry is preferred • Strong written and oral communication skills • SQL and data driven analytical application experience • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, information systems, engineering, or business related field. Experience in lieu of degree will be considered.

Attributes and Competencies: • Innate ability to solve problems • Prioritize complex projects with ongoing deadlines • A collaborative, team orientation • A bias toward action, practicality and execution, demonstrating appropriate attention to detail • Demonstrated results orientation, with associated perseverance and resilience • A desire to positively impact U.S. healthcare
title: business analyst
